original: rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Like the essence of the cause itself.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the proposition, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin no //
translated: For example, the essence of the cause itself is not different from itself because they are not different continua. In the same way, cause and effect are not different because they are not different continua.

original: yang gzhan yang rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na ther zug pa dag gi 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i tshul gyis yod par gyur pa zhig skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na ther zug pa dag gi 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i tshul gyis yod par gyur pa zhig skyed par byed dam /
translated: Moreover, if the cause generates the effect, does it generate an existent effect in the manner of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas who assert that the effect existed before?

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gi 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba'i tshul gyis med par gyur pa zhig skyed par byed grang na zhes bya bas ni yang gzhan yang rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na grangs can dag 'bras bu ther zug tu gnas par
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gi 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba'i tshul gyis med par gyur pa zhig skyed par byed grang na zhes bya bas ni yang gzhan yang rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na grangs can dag 'bras bu ther zug tu gnas par
translated: If the cause generates the effect,üîΩthen the effect would be both existent and nonexistent.üîΩIf the cause generates the effect, then according to the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, who assert that the effect is permanent, the cause generates an existent effect according to the mode of assertion that the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: 'dod pa dag gi 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i tshul gyis 'bras bu yod par gyur pa zhig rgyus skyed par byed na 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dang / bye brag pa dang / nyan thos mdo sde pa dag 'bras bu snga na med par 'dod pa dag gi 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba'i tshul gyis 'bras bu med par gyur pa zhig rgyus skyes par byed grang na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag gi 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i tshul gyis 'bras bu yod par gyur pa zhig rgyus skyed par byed na 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dang / bye brag pa dang / nyan thos mdo sde pa dag 'bras bu snga na med par 'dod pa dag gi 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba'i tshul gyis 'bras bu med par gyur pa zhig rgyus skyes par byed grang na /
translated: If the cause generates the effect, then according to the LokƒÅyatas, Vai≈õe·π£ikas, and SautrƒÅntika ≈õrƒÅvakas, who assert that the effect does not exist prior to the cause, the cause generates a nonexistent effect according to the mode of assertion that the effect does not exist prior to the cause.

original: brtag pa gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: Both of these analyses are untenable.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the first analysis is untenable, it is said:

original: de la / 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: de la / 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If the effect exists due to its own intrinsic reality,

original: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par 'gyur //
translated: what would a cause generate?

original: 'di ltar @142a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar @142a * //
translated: In this way,

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod par gyur pa ni tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod par gyur pa ni tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: since an effect that exists due to its own intrinsic reality is difficult to teach even conventionally and because the errors of the thesis and so on would ensue, he says, ‚ÄúThis is the intention.‚Äù

original: gal te 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod pa ther zug tu gnas pa nyid yin na rgyus ci zhig skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod pa ther zug tu gnas pa nyid yin na rgyus ci zhig skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: If the effect that exists due to its own intrinsic reality were to endure eternally, what would a cause generate?

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams med par 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod par gyur pa ni tha snyad du yang bstan dga' ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams med par 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod par gyur pa ni tha snyad du yang bstan dga' ste /
translated: In this way, since an effect that exists due to its own intrinsic reality without causes and conditions is difficult to teach even conventionally,

original: 'jig rten na ma skyes pa yod pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par smra ba dgag pa'i skabs su /üîΩ'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ma skyes pa yod pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par smra ba dgag pa'i skabs su / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: Because the world does not see that which is not arisen as existent, and because in the past, Vaibhasikas were refuted when they said that prior to the arising of the effect, it is not empty of the nature of the effect.üîΩAn effect that is not empty does not arise.

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: An effect that is not empty does not cease.

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin /
translated: That which is not empty would be unceased and unarisen.

original: zhes bya ba dag gis des na gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni skye ba med pa'i chos dang / 'gag pa med pa'i chos can yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag gis des na gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni skye ba med pa'i chos dang / 'gag pa med pa'i chos can yin par mthong ste /
translated: Therefore, whatever exists is seen to be a phenomenon that is not arisen and a phenomenon that is not ceased.

original: yod pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi skad cig ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi skad cig ma bzhin no //
translated: Because it exists, it is like the present moment.

original: de ltar yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis de dag bstsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes ji skad bstan pa dag 'dir yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis de dag bstsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes ji skad bstan pa dag 'dir yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since one infers that it exists in that way, the error of the refutation of the intrinsic reality of the subject is committed because of the refutation of non-arising and non-cessation.  Thus, it is as stated, ‚Äúbecause it would follow that the same error would occur here as well.‚Äù

original: de ltar re zhig brtag pa dang po la'o zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad par skyon brjod zin to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig brtag pa dang po la'o zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad par skyon brjod zin to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the first hypothesis is untenable.  This is the conclusion.

original: da ni brtag pa gnyis pa la yang mi 'thad par skyon brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: da ni brtag pa gnyis pa la yang mi 'thad par skyon brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Now, the second hypothesis is also untenable.  This is the conclusion.

original: de'i phyir / 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: Therefore: If the effect has no intrinsic reality,

original: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par 'gyur /
translated: what is it that the cause generates?

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med par gyur pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu skye ba na tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med par gyur pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu skye ba na tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is difficult to teach conventionally that a result that is essenceless like a flower in the sky arises, and because, as before, the faults of the thesis and so on would ensue.

original: gal te 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu nyid yin na rgyus ci zhig skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu nyid yin na rgyus ci zhig skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: If the result were essenceless like a flower in the sky, what would the cause give rise to?

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu med par gyur pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyus skyed cing gsal bar byed pa ni tha snyad du yang bstan dga' ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu med par gyur pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyus skyed cing gsal bar byed pa ni tha snyad du yang bstan dga' ste /
translated: Thus, it is difficult to teach conventionally that a cause gives rise to and makes manifest a result that is essenceless like a flower in the sky, which does not exist.

original: 'jig rten na med pa skye ba nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / sngar 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag @142b 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na med pa skye ba nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / sngar 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag @142b 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Because in the world, one does not see the arising of what does not exist, and because in the past, the LokƒÅyatas said that prior to the arising of the effect, it does not exist, so the effect is empty of essence.üîΩAnd when it arises, it does not have the essence of another thing.

original: skyes na yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: skyes na yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa'i skabs su /
translated: In the context of refuting this, it says:

original: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing /
translated: How could the empty arise?

original: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //üîΩstong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dag gis don dam par stong pa ni skye bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur // stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dag gis don dam par stong pa ni skye bar mi rigs te /
translated: How could the empty cease?üîΩIt follows that the empty would be unceasing and unarisen.

original: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: An empty thing cannot reasonably arise ultimately, because it does not exist, like, for example, a sky flower.

original: don dam par 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid la 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ni 'gag par mi rigs te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid la 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ni 'gag par mi rigs te /
translated: An effect that ultimately does not exist as an entity that is not an effect cannot reasonably cease.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu ma yin pa zhig nas med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu ma yin pa zhig nas med pa bzhin no //
translated: because there is no entity that is not an effect, just as an effect that has ceased does not exist.

original: yang na med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpog pas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa bstsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes ji skad bstan pa dag 'dir yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yang na med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpog pas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa bstsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes ji skad bstan pa dag 'dir yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Or else, because of the inference of the nature of non-existence, the fault of the thesis being vitiated by the absence of the specific property of the subject occurs, since the arising and cessation of the effect are refuted by the non-existence of arising and cessation. This is what is intended here.

original: 'dir gal te gzhan dag na re de ltar 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa rgyus skyes bar mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs dang dam bcas pa'i skyon dag sngar bye brag tu smra ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag dgag pa'i skabs su bstan zin na 'dir yang bzlas te bshad ci dgos zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis sngar /üîΩ'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir gal te gzhan dag na re de ltar 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa rgyus skyes bar mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs dang dam bcas pa'i skyon dag sngar bye brag tu smra ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag dgag pa'i skabs su bstan zin na 'dir yang bzlas te bshad ci dgos zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis sngar / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: The response to this opponent‚Äôs position, which is drawn from within the Autocommentary, is as follows.üîΩAn effect that is not empty would not arise.

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: An effect that is not empty would not cease.

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: That which is not empty would be unceased and unarisen.

original: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: How could an empty thing arise?

original: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: How could an empty thing cease?

original: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur //
translated: An empty thing would also be unceased and unarisen.

original: zhes bya ba de dag gis ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas rgyu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de dag gis ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas rgyu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, in terms of the effect, the cause is shown to be essenceless.

original: da ltar ni rgyu dngos po las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: da ltar ni rgyu dngos po las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: Now, the cause is shown to be essenceless in terms of entity.

original: khyad par ni de yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: khyad par ni de yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the difference.

original: sngar tshig le'ur byas pa de gnyis kyi skabs kyis ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par smra ba de dgag pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu bdag nyid
analyzed: sngar tshig le'ur byas pa de gnyis kyi skabs kyis ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par smra ba de dgag pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu bdag nyid
translated: In the context of the previous two verses, in order to refute the VaibhƒÅ·π£hikas, who say that even prior to the arising of the effect, it is not empty of the entity of the effect, it is said that even prior to the arising of the effect, if the effect existed

original: kyis mi stong par yod pa la skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur @143a * //
analyzed: kyis mi stong par yod pa la skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur @143a * //
translated: non-empty of the entity of the effect, the error would ensue that it would be without arising and without cessation.

original: bas de ni mi 'dod de 'bras bu'i dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med la /
analyzed: bas de ni mi 'dod de 'bras bu'i dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med la /
translated: This is unacceptable, because the entity of the effect has the property of arising and ceasing and thus is essenceless.

original: de ltar 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi sgo nas rgyu yang ngo bo nyid med pas don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi sgo nas rgyu yang ngo bo nyid med pas don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: The Lokayata say that prior to the arising of the effect, it is essenceless, and therefore the effect is empty of essence.üîΩAnd even when it has arisen, it is not a different entity.

original: skyes na yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes zer ba de dgag pa'i phyir snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pas stong pa dag la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas rgyu med par skye baüîΩdang 'gag par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: skyes na yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes zer ba de dgag pa'i phyir snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pas stong pa dag la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'dod de /
translated: In order to refute them, it is shown that the errors of arising and ceasing would ensue if they were empty of prior nonexistence and mutual nonexistence, and therefore they do not maintain that they arise and cease without a cause.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rgyu las skye zhing rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rgyu las skye zhing rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
translated: The entity of the effect arises from the cause, and it is a phenomenon that ceases by its own power. Therefore, it is not essenceless.

original: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas don dam par med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas don dam par med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: essentially nonexistent as the effect, ultimately, that which is essentially nonexistent does not arise and does not cease without a cause.üîΩIn this context, since the cause is essenceless, ultimately the cause does notüîΩproduce the existent effect; and since the cause is not essenceless, ultimately

original: da ltar skabs 'dir ni rgyu ngo bo nyid med pas don dam par rgyus 'bras bu yod pa skyed par mi byed pa dang / rgyu nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas don dam par med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan te /
analyzed: da ltar skabs 'dir ni rgyu ngo bo nyid med pas don dam par rgyus 'bras bu yod pa skyed par mi byed pa dang / rgyu nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas don dam par med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan te /
translated: that which is essentially nonexistent does not arise without a cause.

original: khyad par ni de yin pas zlos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni de yin pas zlos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the difference, and so there is no redundancy.üîΩTherefore, whenüîΩone analyzes in this way, since it is not tenable that ultimately the cause gives

original: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed pa nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed pa nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
translated: rise to the effect,

original: skye ba yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: skye ba yod pa ma yin na //
translated: Since there is no arising,

original: rgyu nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
translated: Causality makes no sense.

original: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Thus, it is as explained.

original: de la don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
translated: In that regard, someone might say, ‚ÄúUltimately, a cause generates an effect,

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de don dam par ni don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de don dam par ni don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: because it is the cause of an effect.‚Äù The reason that was stated is ultimately unestablished.

original: tha snyad pa'i gtan tshigs yin par brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid de /
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i gtan tshigs yin par brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid de /
translated: If it is said to be a reason of convention, then the meaning is contradictory,üîΩbecause it exists only in the discordant position.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te ;
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te ;
translated: This is the conclusion of the section and the result of valid knowledge.üîΩThus, since ultimately the generation of an effect by a cause is untenable, arising does not exist. Therefore, since a cause is untenable, the reason that the opponent stated earlier, ‚ÄúUltimately, a cause generates an effect,

original: de ltar don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed pa nyid mi 'thad pas skye ba yod pa ma yin pas rgyu nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir sngar pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i gtan tshigs don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed pa nyid mi 'thad pas skye ba yod pa ma yin pas rgyu nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir sngar pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i gtan tshigs don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
translated: because it is the cause of an effect,‚Äù is not established.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: But that is not established ultimately,

original: @143b kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: @143b kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: and it is contradictory conventionally.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
translated: Ultimately, a cause does generate an effect,

original: 'di'i 'di 'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i 'di 'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThis is its effect.‚Äù

original: gang gis gang skyed par mi byed pa de la ni rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di 'o zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: gang gis gang skyed par mi byed pa de la ni rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di 'o zhes mi brjod de /
translated: That which does not generate something is not said to be the cause of that,

original: dper na rnga mo'i rva 'di'i ru bzhi 'di 'o zhes mi brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnga mo'i rva 'di'i ru bzhi 'di 'o zhes mi brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the horn of a donkey is not said to be the cause of the sky.üîΩHere it is said, ‚ÄúThis is the effect of this eye,‚Äù

original: 'di la ni mig 'di'i 'bras bu ni mig gi rnam par shes pa 'di 'o zhes sam /
analyzed: 'di la ni mig 'di'i 'bras bu ni mig gi rnam par shes pa 'di 'o zhes sam /
translated: or ‚ÄúThis is the effect of this eye consciousness.‚Äù

original: sa bon 'di'i 'bras bu myu gu 'di 'o zhes brjod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba ni 'dir pha rol po dag ni 'di'i 'di 'o zhes 'grel pa brjod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed
analyzed: sa bon 'di'i 'bras bu myu gu 'di 'o zhes brjod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba ni 'dir pha rol po dag ni 'di'i 'di 'o zhes 'grel pa brjod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed
translated: The opponent may say, The reason is established because it is said, 'This sprout is the effect of this seed.' Therefore, the intended point is established.

original: par byed pa nyid do zhes sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: par byed pa nyid do zhes sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Here the opponent's statement, This is that, is the reason that proves that ultimately the effect is produced by the cause.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The words This is that are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, the example of the discordant side, the application, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: 'di ni rnga mo'i rva med pa'i ru bzhi 'di 'o zhes mi brjod pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni rnga mo'i rva med pa'i ru bzhi 'di 'o zhes mi brjod pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not like saying, This is the horn of a rabbit, which does not exist.

original: mig dang sa bon yod pa 'di'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / myu gu 'di'i zhes brjod pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: mig dang sa bon yod pa 'di'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / myu gu 'di'i zhes brjod pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: This is like saying, This eye consciousness is the effect of this eye, and This sprout is the effect of this seed, which do exist.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la 'di'i 'di 'o zhes 'brel pa brjod pa yod pa'i phyir don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la 'di'i 'di 'o zhes 'brel pa brjod pa yod pa'i phyir don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since the connection of cause and effect is expressed in terms of ‚Äúthis is the cause of that,‚Äù ultimately the cause does generate the effect.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: gal te don dam par 'bras bu skye ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni des na 'bras bu skye ba las rgyu yang rgyu nyid du 'thad pas /
analyzed: gal te don dam par 'bras bu skye ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni des na 'bras bu skye ba las rgyu yang rgyu nyid du 'thad pas /
translated: If the arising of an effect existed ultimately, then it would be tenable that the cause is a cause due to the arising of the effect.

original: rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di 'o zhes brjod du yang rung ba zhig na de yang med pas /
analyzed: rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di 'o zhes brjod du yang rung ba zhig na de yang med pas /
translated: Therefore it would be appropriate to say, ‚ÄúThis is the effect of this cause,‚Äù but since that does not exist,

original: rgyu nyid 'thad pa yod min na //
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'thad pa yod min na //
translated: the cause itself is not tenable.

original: 'bras bu gang gi yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang gi yin par 'gyur //
translated: How could it be the cause of an effect?

original: de ltar ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de ltar ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: Since that is not established, the meaning of the reason is not established,

original: don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: or it has a meaning that is contradictory.

original: rgyu nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the cause itself is not tenable,

original: 'bras bu yang mi 'thad pas rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di 'o zhes bya ba de ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid la kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid do //üîΩgzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang mi 'thad pas rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di 'o zhes bya ba de ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid la kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid do // gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Since the effect is also untenable, it is not established that ‚Äúthis is the effect of this cause.‚Äù Therefore, the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established ultimately, and it is contradictory conventionally.

original: tshogs pa rnyed na 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshogs pa rnyed na 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Others say: If the assemblage is obtained, the effect will not arise.

original: dus kyang tshogs pa'i yan lag yin pas des na 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sngar smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid ma @144a * //
analyzed: dus kyang tshogs pa'i yan lag yin pas des na 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sngar smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid ma @144a * //
translated: Since time is a part of the assemblage, the effect is established by it. Therefore, since the reason is the cause of establishing the effect, the meaning of the reason stated earlier is not unestablished.

original: yin no // kho bo cag rgyu 'ba' zhig las 'bras bu grub par yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de 'ang grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya
analyzed: yin no // kho bo cag rgyu 'ba' zhig las 'bras bu grub par yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de 'ang grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya
translated: We do not assert that the effect is established from a cause alone. Therefore, since we say that the cause does not generate the effect and the effect is not generated by the cause, that which you said, ‚ÄúThis is an establishment of what is already established,‚Äù

original: ba ni 'dir gzhan dag na re lung las /
analyzed: ba ni 'dir gzhan dag na re lung las /
translated: is not correct.

original: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //üîΩchud mi za ba 'ang tshogs dang dus //
analyzed: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni // chud mi za ba 'ang tshogs dang dus //
translated: Karma does not expire even in a hundred eons,üîΩbut when the assemblage and time are obtained,

original: rnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
analyzed: rnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
translated: then for embodied beings

original: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: it will become a result.

original: ces kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: ces kyang gsungs la /
translated: And also:

original: rgyu 'brel pa dang rkyen 'brel pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu 'brel pa dang rkyen 'brel pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is causal relation? What is conditional relation?

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba dang / sa bon gyi rkyen gyis myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba dang / sa bon gyi rkyen gyis myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu 'brel pa yin la /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are actions‚Äù and ‚ÄúConditioned by a seed, there is a sprout‚Äù and so on are causal relations.

original: khams drug po dag tshogs pa ni rkyen 'brel pa yin no zhes kyang gsungs te /üîΩkho bo cag kyang de skad len pas des na rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa rnyed na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: khams drug po dag tshogs pa ni rkyen 'brel pa yin no zhes kyang gsungs te / kho bo cag kyang de skad len pas des na rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa rnyed na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: The assemblage of the six elements is conditional relations.üîΩSince we also say this, the effect arises when the assemblage of causes and conditions is obtained.

original: dus kyang tshogs pa'i yan lag yin pas 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gis sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dus kyang tshogs pa'i yan lag yin pas 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gis sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Since time is a factor of the assemblage, it is a cause for the establishment of the effect. Therefore our previous argument is valid: Time definitely exists.

original: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: The meaning of that statement is not established.

original: khyed dbu ma pas rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la /
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la /
translated: And also, what you Madhyamaka say, namely, that a cause does not produce an effect,

original: 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no//
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no//
translated: and an effect is not produced by a cause, is also an argument establishing what is already established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here explains:

original: 'di la rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, because the assembly of causes and conditions does not substantially exist, it does not exist by its own intrinsic nature.

original: gal te des bdag nyid skyed par byed cing skyes nas 'bras bu yang skyed par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gal te des bdag nyid skyed par byed cing skyes nas 'bras bu yang skyed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it generates itself and having arisen, it also generates an effect,

original: phyogs de yang 'khrul pa skyed pa yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyogs de yang 'khrul pa skyed pa yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: that position is said to generate error.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa de ni spyi 'dus pa tsam la nye bar gdags par zad pas tha snyad du yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pas des bdag gi bdag nyid kyang mi skyed pas
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa de ni spyi 'dus pa tsam la nye bar gdags par zad pas tha snyad du yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pas des bdag gi bdag nyid kyang mi skyed pas
translated: Since the assembly of causes and conditions is merely a conventional imputation of a mere collection, it does not substantially exist even conventionally. Therefore it does not exist by way of its own nature. Thus it does not generate itself.

original: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore it does not generate effects.

original: gzhan yang gal te tshogs pa des bdag nyid skyed par byed cing bdag nyid skyes na 'bras bu yang skyed par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te tshogs pa des bdag nyid skyed par byed cing bdag nyid skyes na 'bras bu yang skyed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, if that assembly generates itself and itself arises, it would also generate effects.

original: phyogs de yang khyed cag 'khrul pa skyed pa'i rgyu tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: phyogs de yang khyed cag 'khrul pa skyed pa'i rgyu tsam du zad kyi /
translated: That position is merely a cause that generates your confusion.

original: brtag mi bzod pas tshogs pas 'bras bu mi skyed pa'i phyir khyed kyis sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang @144b nyams pa med la /
analyzed: brtag mi bzod pas tshogs pas 'bras bu mi skyed pa'i phyir khyed kyis sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang @144b nyams pa med la /
translated: Since it cannot withstand analysis, the assembly does not generate effects. Therefore the meaning of the reason you stated earlier is not established, and it is not undermined.

original: kho bos smras pa yang grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: kho bos smras pa yang grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: And what I have stated is not the establishment of what has already been established.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that point, he says:

original: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
translated: Whatever is the assembly of causes and conditions

original: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
translated: That does not produce itself.

original: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed //
translated: How could it produce an effect?

original: ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what he says.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdes 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir / des 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logic of that,

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bar smras te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bar smras te /
translated: it is said that ‚Äúit does not produce an effect because it does not exist substantially.‚Äù

original: dper na dmag dang nags tshal dang shing rta zhes bya ba dag ni tshogs pa'i yan lag spyi 'dus pa la nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: dper na dmag dang nags tshal dang shing rta zhes bya ba dag ni tshogs pa'i yan lag spyi 'dus pa la nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
translated: For example, an army, a forest, and a chariot are mere designations imputed to the collection of their parts.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag gis bdag nyid kyang skyed par mi byed pas /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag gis bdag nyid kyang skyed par mi byed pas /
translated: Since they do not exist substantially, they do not produce themselves.

original: des 'bras bu gzhan skyed par mi byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa zhes bya ba yang tshogs pa'i yan lag spyi 'dus pa la nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: des 'bras bu gzhan skyed par mi byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa zhes bya ba yang tshogs pa'i yan lag spyi 'dus pa la nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
translated: Just as the cause does not produce another effect, so too the so-called ‚Äúcollection of causes and conditions‚Äù is merely a designation for the mere assembly of the general parts of the collection.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it does not substantially exist,

original: bdag gis bdag nyid kyang skyed par mi byed pas des 'bras bu gzhan skyed par mi byed pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag nyid kyang skyed par mi byed pas des 'bras bu gzhan skyed par mi byed pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: it does not produce itself, and therefore it does not produce another effect.

original: tshogs pa dgag pa 'di la kha cig na re //
analyzed: tshogs pa dgag pa 'di la kha cig na re //
translated: In this refutation of the collection, someone might say,

original: tshogs pa gcig pu ma yin te //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig pu ma yin te //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not just the collection alone,

original: de bzhin dngos po 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po 'ga' yang med //
translated: but also the individual things that exist.

original: gal te de yang de las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te de yang de las gzhan //
translated: If that also is different from that,

original: de yang gcig pu 'ga' zhig yod ;
analyzed: de yang gcig pu 'ga' zhig yod ;
translated: then that also is just a single thing that exists.‚Äù

original: / ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas pa /
analyzed: / ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas pa /
translated: This is what the master has said in the verse:

original: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
translated: The collection of causes and conditions

original: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
translated: does not produce itself.

original: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed //
translated: How does the effect arise?

original: ces gsungs pa rnam par bshad pa'i skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta na re rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa 'bras bu skyed par byed pa zhes bya bar brtags pa gang yin pa des re zhig bdag gi bdag nyid skyed parüîΩmi byed de /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa rnam par bshad pa'i skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta na re rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa 'bras bu skyed par byed pa zhes bya bar brtags pa gang yin pa des re zhig bdag gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed de /
translated: The elder Buddhapalita says that the statement ‚ÄúThe assemblage of causes and conditions produces the effect‚Äù is a mere imputation.üîΩIt does not produce itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: tshogs pa ni du ma yin par shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshogs pa ni du ma yin par shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is known to be a plurality.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang ;
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang ;
translated: Master ƒÄryadeva also says:

original: tshogs pa gcig pu ma yin te //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig pu ma yin te //
translated: The assemblage is not a single unit.

original: de bzhin dngos po 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po 'ga' yang med //
translated: Likewise, there is no such thing as a single entity.

original: gal te de yang de las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te de yang de las gzhan //
translated: If that is different from this,

original: de yang gcig pu 'ga' zhig yod //üîΩces gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro zhes bya bar gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gcig pu 'ga' zhig yod // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro zhes bya bar gyur ro //
translated: then this is a single unit.

original: kha cig na re de ni khungs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re de ni khungs su mi rung ste /
translated: Some say that is not a valid source.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don @145a * //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don @145a * //
translated: The meaning of the verse

original: dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa de bzang mod kyang /
analyzed: dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa de bzang mod kyang /
translated: but it is not the source for this section.

original: skabs 'di'i khungs ma yin pa las gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas khungs su byas pa ma legs te /
analyzed: skabs 'di'i khungs ma yin pa las gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas khungs su byas pa ma legs te /
translated: It is not good to cite the elder Buddhapalita as the source.

original: 'dir slob dpon gyis gsungs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis rang gi bdag nyid mi skyed pas /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyis gsungs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis rang gi bdag nyid mi skyed pas /
translated: The meaning of the verses composed by the master here is that since causes and conditions do not generate themselves,

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yang skyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yang skyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: they also do not generate their effects.üîΩThe meaning of the source cited is that a collection does not exist separately from causes and conditions.

original: khungs kyi don ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las tshogs pa zhes bya ba logs shig na med par ston pa yin pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don dang mi mthun pa'i phyir de khungs su mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khungs kyi don ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las tshogs pa zhes bya ba logs shig na med par ston pa yin pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don dang mi mthun pa'i phyir de khungs su mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is not in accord with the meaning of the verses, it is not suitable as a source.

original: yang na tshogs pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang sngar bzhin du nye bar sbyar nas rgyu bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed pa nyid duüîΩrnam par rtog pa de dgag pa'i thabs ni /
analyzed: yang na tshogs pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang sngar bzhin du nye bar sbyar nas rgyu bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa de dgag pa'i thabs ni /
translated: Or else, just as before, one should apply the refutation of the cause to the conception that the mere assembly of causes and conditions produces the effect.üîΩThe method of refuting the conception that the mere assembly of causes and conditions produces the effect is as follows.

original: yang na sngar rgyu dgag pa'i skabs su rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi 'thad pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe dag bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang tshogs pa dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dang /
analyzed: yang na sngar rgyu dgag pa'i skabs su rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi 'thad pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe dag bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang tshogs pa dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dang /
translated: Just as previously, in the context of the refutation of the cause, the arguments and examples demonstrating that it is not tenable for a cause to produce an effect through being identical to it, through being different from it, through the effect‚Äôs existence, through the effect‚Äôs nonexistence, and so on were presented, in the same way, here too, the arguments and examples demonstrating that it is not tenable for the mere assembly of causes and conditions to produce the effect through being identical to it, through being different from it, through the effect‚Äôs existence, through the effect‚Äôs nonexistence, and so on should be presented.

original: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa la sogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi 'thad pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe dag snga ma bzhin du nye bar sbyar nas rgyu bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa la sogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi 'thad pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe dag snga ma bzhin du nye bar sbyar nas rgyu bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The reason and example that it is untenable for an existent or nonexistent effect to be produced are to be applied as before.

original: yang na tshogs pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa nyid yin na 'bras bu de yang don dam par dngos su 'am brgyud pas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid med par bstan zin pas de'i phyir gang dag gi tshogs pa gang
analyzed: yang na tshogs pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa nyid yin na 'bras bu de yang don dam par dngos su 'am brgyud pas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid med par bstan zin pas de'i phyir gang dag gi tshogs pa gang
translated: Or, if the assembly is the assembly of causes and conditions of those that become effects, then since it has already been demonstrated that ultimately the effect does not exist as the entity of the effect, either directly or indirectly, then because of that, it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is the assembly of what?‚Äù

original: zhig yin zhes bya bas kyang tshogs pa mi 'thad pa'i rigs pa rnam pa gzhan ston te /
analyzed: zhig yin zhes bya bas kyang tshogs pa mi 'thad pa'i rigs pa rnam pa gzhan ston te /
translated: This also teaches another kind of reasoning that demonstrates the untenability of the assembly.

original: 'di ltar tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyes pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu de rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa nyid yod par rjes su dpag pas 'bras bur gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa nyid yin na 'bras bu
analyzed: 'di ltar tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyes pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu de rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa nyid yod par rjes su dpag pas 'bras bur gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa nyid yin na 'bras bu
translated: Thus, the so-called assembly is inferred to exist from the perspective of the arising of the effect. If the assembly of causes and conditions of those effects exists, then the assembly of causes and conditions of those effects would exist.

original: de yang don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos su 'am brgyud pas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du med pa de ltar bstan zin pas de'i phyir 'bras bur gyur pa med na 'bras bu gang dag gi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa gang zhig
analyzed: de yang don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos su 'am brgyud pas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du med pa de ltar bstan zin pas de'i phyir 'bras bur gyur pa med na 'bras bu gang dag gi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa gang zhig
translated: But since the effect is ultimately unarisen, it is shown that it does not exist as the nature of the effect either directly or indirectly. Therefore, if the effect does not exist, then what would be the assembly of causes and conditions of those effects?

original: yin te / tshogs pa zhes bya @145b ba'i sgra 'jug pa tsam yang med do //
analyzed: yin te / tshogs pa zhes bya @145b ba'i sgra 'jug pa tsam yang med do //
translated: The mere term ‚Äúassembly‚Äù would not even exist.

original: de dag gi de med pa nyid du nges par bzung nas //
analyzed: de dag gi de med pa nyid du nges par bzung nas //
translated: Having ascertained that they do not exist,

original: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni /
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni /
translated: The assembly of causes and conditions

original: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
translated: Does not give rise to itself.

original: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed //üîΩces gsungs te /üîΩ'dir don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa tsam yang med pa de'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi 'bras bur gyur pa med pa de dag gi rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa de med
analyzed: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed // ces gsungs te / 'dir don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa tsam yang med pa de'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi 'bras bur gyur pa med pa de dag gi rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa de med
translated: How could an effect be produced?üîΩThe meaning here is as before.

original: pa nyid du nges par bzung nas tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: pa nyid du nges par bzung nas tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs te /
translated: Since there is not even the mere engagement of the term ‚Äúcollection,‚Äù therefore the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, having ascertained that the collection of causes and conditions of those that do not exist as effects is itself nonexistent, stated this verse.

original: 'dir tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words here is as before.

original: skabs kyi don la ni khyad par yod de sngar ni pha rol po dag gi tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed pa nyid phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: skabs kyi don la ni khyad par yod de sngar ni pha rol po dag gi tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed pa nyid phyogs su byas te /
translated: There is a difference in the meaning of the context. Previously, the production of an effect by a collection of causes and conditions posited by others

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyu yod par rjes su dpog pa dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'di rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyu yod par rjes su dpog pa dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'di rnam par bshad do //
translated: was refuted, and this verse was explained in order to refute the inference that the cause of the production of an effect exists.

original: 'dir ni 'bras bu skye bas tshogs pa yod par shes par bya ba yin na 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir tshogs pa yang med pa nyid do zhes bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'bras bu skye bas tshogs pa yod par shes par bya ba yin na 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir tshogs pa yang med pa nyid do zhes bstan te /
translated: Here, if the assembly of causes and conditions is known to exist because the effect arises, then since the effect does not arise, the assembly also does not exist.

original: skabs kyi khyad par ni de yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyi khyad par ni de yin no //
translated: This is the context.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi 'thad cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi 'thad cing /
translated: When it is not tenable that the assembly generates the effect,üîΩand when the effect is not generated by a cause that is not an assembly, that is, by a cause that does not have the character of an assembly of causes and conditions, and when the effect is not generated by a cause, as was previously explained,üîΩthen the effect is not produced by the assembly

original: tshogs pa ma yin pa rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu des kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin par dgag pa sngar bstan zin pas /
analyzed: tshogs pa ma yin pa rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu des kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin par dgag pa sngar bstan zin pas /
translated: and the effect is not produced by what is not the assembly.

original: de phyir tshogs pas byas pa dang // tshogs min byas pa'i 'bras bu med //üîΩces rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag pa'i nang du bstan pa'i dbang gis mjug bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de phyir tshogs pas byas pa dang // tshogs min byas pa'i 'bras bu med // ces rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag pa'i nang du bstan pa'i dbang gis mjug bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the conclusion is that the effect is not produced by the assembly and the effect is not produced by what is not the assembly.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar sngar /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar sngar /
translated: This is the conclusion, because it was explained in the previous chapter.

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: When it is not tenable that the effect is produced by the assembly of causes and conditions,üîΩand when the effect is not produced by a cause that is not an assembly, that is, by a cause that does not have the character of an assembly of causes and conditions, and when the effect is not generated by a cause, as was previously explained,üîΩthen the effect is not produced by the assembly and the effect is not produced by what is not the assembly.

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye gyur na //
translated: If it arises from the assembly itself,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: If the effect exists in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //üîΩgal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye // gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: How could it arise from the assembly itself?üîΩIf it arises from the assembly

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: Of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: If the effect does not exist in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid la skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid la skye //
translated: How could it arise from the assembly?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa'i rim gyis tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par yang mi 'thad pa ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa'i rim gyis tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par yang mi 'thad pa ;
translated: Thus, as explained, it is untenable that an effect arises from the assembly.

original: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po'i skabs su //
analyzed: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po'i skabs su //
translated: Previously, in the first chapter, the analysis of conditions,üîΩit was explained:

original: de'i phyir rkyen las byung ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen las byung ma yin //
translated: Therefore it does not arise from conditions.

original: rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
translated: An effect that does not arise from conditions

original: yod min 'bras bu med pas na //
analyzed: yod min 'bras bu med pas na //
translated: Does not exist. Since the effect does not exist,

original: rkyen min rkyen dug la 'gyur //
analyzed: rkyen min rkyen dug la 'gyur //
translated: Nonconditions are not conditions.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshogs pa ma yin pas kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed par @146a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshogs pa ma yin pas kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed par @146a * //
translated: Thus it was explained that an effect is not produced by an assembly.

original: bstan la ; sngar /üîΩgal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: bstan la ; sngar / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
translated: Previously, it was explained:üîΩIf the cause

original: rgyu byin nas ni 'gag 'gyur na //
analyzed: rgyu byin nas ni 'gag 'gyur na //
translated: Cedes the cause to the effect and ceases,

original: gang byin pa dang gang 'gag pa'i //
analyzed: gang byin pa dang gang 'gag pa'i //
translated: That which is given and that which ceases

original: rgyu yi bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur //üîΩgal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: rgyu yi bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur // gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
translated: would have two natures of cause.

original: rgyu ma byin par 'gal 'gyur na //
analyzed: rgyu ma byin par 'gal 'gyur na //
translated: If the effect is not given by the cause,üîΩthen it would be contradictory for the cause to be the cause of the effect.

original: rgyu 'gags nas ni skyes pa yi //
analyzed: rgyu 'gags nas ni skyes pa yi //
translated: If the effect arises after the cause ceases,

original: 'bras bu de ni rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: then that effect would be without a cause.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin par dgag pa bstan pas de'i phyir tshogs pas byas pa dang tshogs pa ma yin pas byas pa'i 'bras bu med do zhes rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag pa'i nang du bstanüîΩpa'i dbang gis mjug bsdu bar bya'o //üîΩde'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin par dgag pa bstan pas de'i phyir tshogs pas byas pa dang tshogs pa ma yin pas byas pa'i 'bras bu med do zhes rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag pa'i nang du bstan pa'i dbang gis mjug bsdu bar bya'o // de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, because it is taught that the effect is also not produced by the cause, therefore, the immediately preceding chapter taught that the effect produced by the assembly and the effect produced by the nonassembly do not exist.üîΩTherefore time definitely exists because it is the cause for the establishment of the effect.

original: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The meaning of that reason is not unestablished.

original: de ltar 'bras bu 'grub pa med pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis sngar rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang po'i dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu 'grub pa med pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis sngar rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang po'i dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, because the effect is not established, the reason that the opponent previously stated in the first chapter, ‚ÄúThe prior time definitely exists because it is the cause of establishing the effect,‚Äù is unestablished.

original: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub par sngar bstan pa nyid nyams pa med par so na gnas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub par sngar bstan pa nyid nyams pa med par so na gnas so //
translated: The meaning of that reason has already been explained earlier, and it remains undamaged.

original: grangs can dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can dag gis smras pa /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya says:

original: tshogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa nyid de /
translated: The collection exists substantially.

original: rang gi yan lag dag las gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na tshogs pa'i yan lag dag gi bdag nyid bzhin pas tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi yan lag dag las gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na tshogs pa'i yan lag dag gi bdag nyid bzhin pas tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: Because it is not different from its parts, like, for example, the nature of the parts of the collection. Therefore the collection does not produce the effect.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gzhan ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi tshogs pa rdzas su yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gzhan ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi tshogs pa rdzas su yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a statement by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya to prove that the collection of nondifferent reasons substantially exists.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, the example, and the conclusion are applied in order.

original: dper na tshogs pa'i yan lag dag gi bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du tshogs pa yang rang gi yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa nyid yin
analyzed: dper na tshogs pa'i yan lag dag gi bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du tshogs pa yang rang gi yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa nyid yin
translated: For example, just as the collection of parts is substantially existent because it is not different from its own nature, so too the collection is substantially existent because it is not different from its own parts.

original: pas / khyed dbu ma pas sngar tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: pas / khyed dbu ma pas sngar tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, you MƒÅdhyamikas previously said that the collection does not produce the effect.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But that is illogical, because it is not substantially existent.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid @146b kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid @146b kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i tshogs pa yin grang na /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i tshogs pa yin grang na /
translated: If it is an assemblage that produces an effect,

original: 'bras bu skye ba med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang sngar bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang sngar bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: since it has already been demonstrated that an effect does not arise and is not substantially existent,

original: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na //
translated: then an effect does not exist.

original: rkyen gyi tshogs pa ga la yod //
analyzed: rkyen gyi tshogs pa ga la yod //
translated: How can there be an assemblage of conditions?

original: dpe ma grub pa'i phyir dang / btags par yod pa yang de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: dpe ma grub pa'i phyir dang / btags par yod pa yang de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: Because the example is not established and because that which exists as a nominal reality cannot be described as being the same or different,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: grangs can dag tshogs pa rdzas su 'dod pa ni 'bras bu skye ba'i tshogs pa yin grang na /
analyzed: grangs can dag tshogs pa rdzas su 'dod pa ni 'bras bu skye ba'i tshogs pa yin grang na /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that an assemblage is substantially existent.

original: 'bras bu skye ba med pa dang / rgyu rkyen dang dmag dang / nags tshal dang ; shing rta la sogs pa tshogs pa rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang sngar bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba med pa dang / rgyu rkyen dang dmag dang / nags tshal dang ; shing rta la sogs pa tshogs pa rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang sngar bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: The non-arising of effects, the assembly of causes and conditions, the army, the forest, the chariot, and so on, have already been explained as not substantially existent.

original: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if effects do not exist,

original: 'bras bu'i rkyen gyis tshogs pa rdzas su ga la yod /üîΩdes na grangs can dag gi dpe tshogs pa'i yan lag dag gi bdag nyid bzhin pas zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs rang gi yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang rgyu rkyen dang / dmag dang nags tshal dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rkyen gyis tshogs pa rdzas su ga la yod / des na grangs can dag gi dpe tshogs pa'i yan lag dag gi bdag nyid bzhin pas zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs rang gi yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang rgyu rkyen dang / dmag dang nags tshal dang /
translated: how could the assembly of causes and conditions be substantially existent?

original: shing rta la sogs par btags par yod pa dag kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par sngar bstan zin pas /
analyzed: shing rta la sogs par btags par yod pa dag kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par sngar bstan zin pas /
translated: Therefore, since the example of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, ‚Äúlike the parts of the assembly,‚Äù is not established, and since the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is not different from its parts,‚Äù is also imputed to exist as the assembly of causes and conditions, the army, the forest, the chariot, and so on, it has already been explained that they are not to be expressed as being the same or different.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir grangs can dag gi sgrub pa de ma grub po //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir grangs can dag gi sgrub pa de ma grub po //
translated: Because it is not established as not being different, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs proof is not established.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the source that teaches the collection does not substantially exist, he says, ‚ÄúƒÄryadeva also explains,‚Äù

original: tshogs pa rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir de ltar yang /
analyzed: tshogs pa rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir de ltar yang /
translated: and so on.

original: gang phyir 'jig rten ji snyed ming //
analyzed: gang phyir 'jig rten ji snyed ming //
translated: To the extent that there are names in the world,

original: tshogs pa nyid la snang 'gyur ba /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la snang 'gyur ba /
translated: they appear in the collection.

original: de phyir dngos po yod min te //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po yod min te //
translated: Therefore things do not exist.

original: dngos med tshogs pa'ang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos med tshogs pa'ang yod ma yin // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Even the collection of nonthings does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten na ji snyed ming du brjod pa de dag thams cad tshogs pa nyid la snang bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir tshogs pa la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten na ji snyed ming du brjod pa de dag thams cad tshogs pa nyid la snang bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir tshogs pa la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: To the extent that there are names expressed in the world, all of them appear in the collection. Therefore things that are not included in the collection do not exist.

original: dngos po med na tshogs pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dngos po med na tshogs pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: If things do not exist, even the collection does not exist.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: / tshad ma'i 'bras @147a * //
analyzed: / tshad ma'i 'bras @147a * //
translated: The result of valid cognition

original: bu yin te /üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bu blta ba ni sngar dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i skabs su da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi
analyzed: bu yin te / rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bu blta ba ni sngar dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i skabs su da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi
translated: is the meaning of this chapter.üîΩIn this twentieth chapter, the inquiry into cause and effect, the meaning of this chapter is to be seen as the result of valid cognition.üîΩIn the nineteenth chapter, the inquiry into time, it was said, ‚ÄúNow, in order to teach the essencelessness of time by refuting the specific counterparts to emptiness, chapter nineteen is begun.‚Äù

original: khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya bas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de la 'dir rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa brtsam
analyzed: khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya bas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de la 'dir rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa brtsam
translated: So, in the teaching of the essencelessness of time, the twentieth chapter is begun in order to teach the essencelessness of cause and effect by refuting the specific counterparts to emptiness.

original: pa'i skabs su pha rol po dag gis don dam par dus ni med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: pa'i skabs su pha rol po dag gis don dam par dus ni med pa kho na yin te /
translated: At that time, the opponent says that time is absolutely nonexistent,üîΩbecause it is the cause for the establishment of effects.

original: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par smras pa de dgag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par smras pa de dgag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to refute that, the non-entityness of cause and effect is taught.üîΩWhat is the benefit of teaching the non-entityness of cause and effect?üîΩIn this regard, others say that this is merely a treatise of dry logic.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyid tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba btsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs las kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyid tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba btsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs las kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: In order to search for that, it is also established by the source of trustworthy scripture.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las /üîΩ'dren pas gang du tshogs nyid kyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las / 'dren pas gang du tshogs nyid kyi //
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn said in the ƒÄrya-bhavasamkrama-s≈´tra:üîΩWhere the guide taught

original: lta ba rab tu bstan pa de //
analyzed: lta ba rab tu bstan pa de //
translated: The view of the assembly,

original: blo can rnams ni don dam gyi //
analyzed: blo can rnams ni don dam gyi //
translated: The wise ones show the stage of ultimate

original: nye bar gdags pa'i sar ston to //
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa'i sar ston to //
translated: nominal designation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Whatever is said here is established.

original: 'dren pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gang du tshogs pa nyid kyi lta bar rab tu bstan pa de /
analyzed: 'dren pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gang du tshogs pa nyid kyi lta bar rab tu bstan pa de /
translated: The Buddha, the Leader, in the sutra where he fully taught the view of the assembly,

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo can rnams ni don dam pa'i nye bar gdags pa'i sa yin par ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo can rnams ni don dam pa'i nye bar gdags pa'i sa yin par ston to //
translated: the wise bodhisattvas show the stage of ultimate nominal designation.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du tshogs pa bstan pa mdzad pa de ni don dam pa la 'jug pa'i thabs yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du tshogs pa bstan pa mdzad pa de ni don dam pa la 'jug pa'i thabs yin par bstan te /
translated: And the Blessed One, where he taught the assembly, showed the means of entering the ultimate.

original: gang gi phyir tshogs pa 'du ba ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de nyid don dam pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs pa 'du ba ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de nyid don dam pa ste /
