translated: Because the assembly, the gathering, does not exist substantially, therefore it is the ultimate.

original: 'di ltar rdzas su med pa nyid du dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas su med pa nyid du dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not observed as non-existent substantially.

original: de lta bas na 'dir rab tu byed pa 'di nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid skabs gzhan gyis bsgrubs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir rab tu byed pa 'di nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid skabs gzhan gyis bsgrubs so //
translated: Therefore, in this context, non-arising is established by another method.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
translated: The establishment of those scriptures that inspire confidence is the source and the virtue of teaching the essencelessness of cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir rtog ge skam po tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs @147b pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog ge skam po tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs @147b pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not established by mere dry logic.

original: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
translated: The teaching of those scriptures as the very objects to be explained by this treatise is the wisdom and the skill of the author himself.üîΩThis concludes the commentary on the twentieth chapter, having twenty-four verses, called ‚Äúthe examination of cause and effect‚Äù in the Root Verses of the Middle Way, a commentary called ‚ÄúWisdom Lamp.‚Äù

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye
translated: The commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way called Wisdom Lamp, composed by the master BuddhapƒÅlita, is complete.

original: bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: The introduction is complete.

original: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la
analyzed: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la
translated: Now, in the same way, in order to teach the essencelessness of arising and ceasing by way of the meaning of the refutation of the specific attributes of the negation of emptiness, chapter twenty-one is begun.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúpower‚Äù in this context should be understood to refer to the power of the thesis and the power of the subject matter of the text that will be presented below.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //üîΩde la dam bca' ba la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no // de la dam bca' ba la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.üîΩWith respect to that, in terms of the power of the thesis,

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, in the same way, in order to teach the essencelessness of arising and ceasing by way of the meaning of the refutation of the specific attributes of the negation of emptiness,üîΩthe specific attributes of the negation of emptiness are refuted.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
translated: The treatise-writer, in the first chapter of the Examination of Conditions, made the assertion that all things are unproduced.

original: 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: So here, the treatise-writer, in terms of the meaning of the cause of engaging in that assertion, says this.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like that‚Äù means in accordance with the previously explained system.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Emptiness is one‚Äôs own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The position of the opponent is the position that is contrary to that.

original: 'di lta ste don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra pa yin no //
translated: That is to say, the opponent asserts that ultimately things exist by virtue of their own nature.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par 'og nas don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par 'og nas don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is the distinction of the opponent‚Äôs position that ultimately things exist by virtue of their own nature.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: Because they are the causes of emergence and destruction.üîΩThe negation of these is the negation of these.

original: de dgag pa zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pa zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The twenty-first chapter is begun in order to refute that.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya @148a * //üîΩba smras te ;
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya @148a * // ba smras te ;
translated: The twenty-first chapter is begun in order to demonstrate the essencelessness of emergence and destruction, in consideration of the meaning of the text that will be presented below.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba de'i don ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba de'i don ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: The meaning of the text that will be presented below in the twenty-first chapter, the chapter on emergence and destruction, is the demonstration of the essencelessness of emergence and destruction.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What is the result of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: By what mode does one attain that result?

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The teaching of the realitylessness of origination and destruction is its result.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas /
translated: And one attains that result by the mode of the refutation of the distinctions of the resistances to emptiness.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan te //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan te //
translated: Therefore, the author of the commentary, in this context of the introduction to the chapter, first teaches the method and the result that arises from the method.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚ÄúThe distinctions of the resistances to emptiness,‚Äù and so on.

original: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here, he says, Time exists in the ultimate,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is the cause of origination and destruction.

original: /'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: /'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not exist is not the cause of origination and destruction,

original: dper na sbrul gyi rkang pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbrul gyi rkang pa bzhin no //
translated: like the horns of a donkey.

original: dus ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i dus kyi rjes su 'byung ba dag gi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin pas des na de gsal ba yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba
analyzed: dus ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i dus kyi rjes su 'byung ba dag gi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin pas des na de gsal ba yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba
translated: Time is the cause of things that arise and disintegrate, and therefore time alone ultimately exists. Thus, since that which is to be clarified exists, the reason is established and the point to be proven is established.

original: smras te / de dag gi chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: smras te / de dag gi chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They say that the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the proposition, the example of the dissimilar class, the application, and the conclusion are respectively applied.

original: 'di na sbrul gyi rkang pa lta bu gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gi rgyu ma yin pas de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na sbrul gyi rkang pa lta bu gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gi rgyu ma yin pas de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: That which does not exist, like the foot of a snake, is not the cause of things that arise and disintegrate and follow after time. Therefore it does not exist.

original: dus ni dngos po 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gi rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: dus ni dngos po 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gi rgyu yin pas /
translated: Time is the cause of things that arise and disintegrate and follow after time.

original: de ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore it alone exists.

original: de ltar dus yod pa kho na yin pas don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dus gsum gsal bar byed pa yod pa'i phyir sngar kho bo cag gis dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang por don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngoüîΩbo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar dus yod pa kho na yin pas don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dus gsum gsal bar byed pa yod pa'i phyir sngar kho bo cag gis dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang por don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: chapter of our examination of time, we said that in reality things exist,üîΩbecause they are the causes of manifestation, just as, for example, a lampüîΩis. In the first chapter of our examination of cause and effect, we said that

original: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na mar me bzhin no zhes smras @148b pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na mar me bzhin no zhes smras @148b pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: time should be understood to exist in reality,

original: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: because it is the cause of the production of effects.

original: gtan tshigs grub pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs grub pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the reason is established, the point that we want to prove is established.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In order to refute those specific factors that are incompatible with emptiness, in order to teach that emergence and destruction are essenceless, it is said:üîΩIf emergence and destruction

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gang yang rung ba med par ram /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gang yang rung ba med par ram /
translated: Were to exist,üîΩThey would have to be established

original: lhan cig tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Either separately or together.

original: 'di la khyed gang gi phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag dus kyis sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di la khyed gang gi phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag dus kyis sgrub par byed cing /
translated: In this context, you might argue as follows: Since you have established emergence and destruction in terms of time,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pas dus kyang yod pa nyid du bsgrub pas de'i phyir gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag grub par gyur na de dag gi rgyu dus kyang 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pas dus kyang yod pa nyid du bsgrub pas de'i phyir gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag grub par gyur na de dag gi rgyu dus kyang 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
translated: and since time exists because emergence and destruction exist, therefore, if emergence and destruction were to exist, their cause, time, would also exist.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni 'jig pa 'byung ba med par yod pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni 'jig pa 'byung ba med par yod pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: But destruction does not exist without emergence.

original: 'jig pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig tu yang yod pa nyid ma yin //üîΩ'byung ba yang 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin la //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig tu yang yod pa nyid ma yin // 'byung ba yang 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin la //
translated: Destruction does not exist simultaneously with emergence.üîΩEmergence does not exist without destruction.

original: 'byung ba 'jig pa dang lhan cig tu yang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba 'jig pa dang lhan cig tu yang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Emergence does not exist simultaneously with destruction.

original: de ltar mu bzhi char gyi sgo nas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'grub pas de dag gi rgyu dus nyid yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don dbu ma pa'i phyogs la ma grub pa nyid do zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ltar mu bzhi char gyi sgo nas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'grub pas de dag gi rgyu dus nyid yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don dbu ma pa'i phyogs la ma grub pa nyid do zhes ston to //
translated: Thus, since emergence and destruction are not established in any of the four alternatives, since their cause does not exist at the time of the effect, the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established for the MƒÅdhyamika.üîΩTo explain the presentation of the position of the first two alternatives,

original: de la re zhig mu dang po gnyis kyi phyogs nye bar bzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩde la re zhig /'jig pa 'byung ba med par ram /
analyzed: de la re zhig mu dang po gnyis kyi phyogs nye bar bzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir // de la re zhig /'jig pa 'byung ba med par ram /
translated: first it is said:üîΩDestruction does not exist without emergence

original: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: or simultaneously with it.

original: de sgrub pa ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: de sgrub pa ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The proof of that will be explained below.

original: de dag gi tshig gi don bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi tshig gi don bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the specific meaning of those words,

original: 'jig pa ni 'gag pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'gag pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is a synonym for cessation.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚ÄúOrigination‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúarising.‚Äù

original: nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni rtsa ba bskang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni rtsa ba bskang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is used to complete the root text.

original: da ni mu phyi ma gnyis kyi phyogs nye bar bzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mu phyi ma gnyis kyi phyogs nye bar bzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the position of the latter two alternatives,üîΩhe says:

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
translated: destruction does not exist without origination.

original: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They do not exist simultaneously.

original: de'i sgrub pa yang 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa yang 'og nas ston to //
translated: The proof of this will be explained later.

original: phyogs nye bar bzhag pa de dag gi tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs nye bar bzhag pa de dag gi tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the validity of these positions,üîΩhe says:

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la'o //üîΩde'i @149a * //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la'o // de'i @149a * //
translated: In our position,üîΩthe two, origination and destruction,üîΩare not possible in the existent and the nonexistent.

original: phyir de dag gi rgyu de nyid yod pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don gzhan las ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyir de dag gi rgyu de nyid yod pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don gzhan las ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, since the cause of these two does not exist, the reason is not established as being other than the property to be proven.

original: de ltar mu bzhi pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de dag gi rgyu dus nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar mu bzhi pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de dag gi rgyu dus nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: As such, these four possibilities do not exist in our own system. Therefore, since the cause of their emergence and destruction does not exist,

original: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gzhan la ma grub pa nyid do //üîΩci ste rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rab tu ma bsgrubs par gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung bar mi nus so snyam na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pas rang gi dam bcas pa'i grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rab tu ma bsgrubs par kho bo
analyzed: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gzhan la ma grub pa nyid do // ci ste rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rab tu ma bsgrubs par gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung bar mi nus so snyam na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pas rang gi dam bcas pa'i grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rab tu ma bsgrubs par kho bo
translated: the opponent‚Äôs reason, ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of emergence and destruction,‚Äù is not established for the other.üîΩIf you think, ‚ÄúWithout establishing the mode of our own tenets, it is impossible to refute the position of others,‚Äù

original: cag gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung bar mi nus so snyam du sems pa yin no //
analyzed: cag gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung bar mi nus so snyam du sems pa yin no //
translated: the opponent thinks, ‚ÄúWithout establishing the mode of the Madhyamaka‚Äôs own tenets, it is impossible to refute the position of others.‚Äù

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rab tu bsgrub pa de bstan pa'i phyir re zhig / mu dang po gnyis kyi phyogs nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam par brtag pa snga ma'i dbang du bya ste /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rab tu bsgrub pa de bstan pa'i phyir re zhig / mu dang po gnyis kyi phyogs nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam par brtag pa snga ma'i dbang du bya ste /
translated: In response to that, in order to demonstrate the system of his own tenets, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúFirst, the two alternatives are posited as the two extremes, and they are analyzed in terms of the former.‚Äù

original: bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúexplained‚Äù is supplied.

original: de la re zhig mu dang po dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩ'jig pa 'byung ba med par ni //
analyzed: de la re zhig mu dang po dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / 'jig pa 'byung ba med par ni //
translated: First, in order to demonstrate the refutation of the first alternative, it is said:üîΩHow could destruction exist

original: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
translated: Without emergence?

original: yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the words is that it does not exist.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar bzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar bzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the thesis that is posited.

original: des ni 'jig pa 'byung ba med par yod pa nyid ma yin par dgag pa'i mu dang po'i dam bca' ba nye bar bzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'jig pa 'byung ba med par yod pa nyid ma yin par dgag pa'i mu dang po'i dam bca' ba nye bar bzhag pa bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates the thesis of the first alternative, which is the refutation of the existence of destruction without emergence.

original: de'i bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate its proof, it is said:

original: ji ltar 'chi ba skye ba med pa ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar 'chi ba skye ba med pa ltar //
translated: Just as death does not exist without birth,

original: de ltar / 'jig pa 'byung ba med par med //
analyzed: de ltar / 'jig pa 'byung ba med par med //
translated: Destruction does not exist without emergence.

original: de'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is that destruction does not exist without emergence because emergence is its condition.

original: ji ltar 'chi ba skye ba med par med pa ltar 'jig pa yang 'byung ba med par med de /
analyzed: ji ltar 'chi ba skye ba med par med pa ltar 'jig pa yang 'byung ba med par med de /
translated: Just as death does not exist without birth, so too destruction does not exist without emergence.

original: 'chi ba dang 'jig pa de'i rkyen skye ba dang 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang 'jig pa de'i rkyen skye ba dang 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is that death and destruction are the conditions of birth and emergence.

original: 'dir tshig gi don gsal bar bya ba'i tshig gzhan 'dod pa'i phyir smras te ji ltar dang de ltar zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis khong nas drangs te bstan par bya'o zhes bya bas ni //üîΩ'chi ba skye ba med pa ltar //
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don gsal bar bya ba'i tshig gzhan 'dod pa'i phyir smras te ji ltar dang de ltar zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis khong nas drangs te bstan par bya'o zhes bya bas ni // 'chi ba skye ba med pa ltar //
translated: Here, in order to clarify the meaning of the words, other words are stated because the two words ‚Äújust as‚Äù and ‚Äúso too‚Äù are drawn from within and should be applied.üîΩJust as death does not exist without birth,

original: 'jig pa 'byung ba med par med //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'byung ba med par med //
translated: destruction does not exist without emergence.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba de gnyis kyis tshig gi don gsal bar bya ba'i tshig gzhan 'dod pa'i phyir 'grel pa las ji ltar dang de ltar zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis khong nas drangs te /üîΩbstan par blta bar bya'o @149b zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba de gnyis kyis tshig gi don gsal bar bya ba'i tshig gzhan 'dod pa'i phyir 'grel pa las ji ltar dang de ltar zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis khong nas drangs te / bstan par blta bar bya'o @149b zhes bstan to //
translated: Since the root verses of this verse commentary are intended to clarify the meaning of the words, the commentary draws out the two words ‚Äúthus‚Äù and ‚Äúlikewise‚Äù from within the text.üîΩThe meaning of this is also well known, so here no inference is stated.

original: don 'di yang rab tu grags pa yin pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya bas ni ji ltar 'chi ba skye ba med par med pa de ltar 'jig pa yang 'byung ba med par med pa'i don 'di yang 'jig rten thams cad
analyzed: don 'di yang rab tu grags pa yin pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya bas ni ji ltar 'chi ba skye ba med par med pa de ltar 'jig pa yang 'byung ba med par med pa'i don 'di yang 'jig rten thams cad
translated: This shows that just as death does not exist without birth, so too this meaning, that destruction does not exist without arising, is also well known to everyone.

original: la rab tu grags pa yin pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni brjod par bya mi dgos so zhes bstan te //
analyzed: la rab tu grags pa yin pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni brjod par bya mi dgos so zhes bstan te //
translated: Therefore no inference need be stated here.

original: rab tu grags pa yin yang dpes drang bar bya ste zhes bya bas ni de ltar rab tu grags pa yin yang /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa yin yang dpes drang bar bya ste zhes bya bas ni de ltar rab tu grags pa yin yang /
translated: This meaning is well known, but it is drawn out by analogy.

original: 'ga' zhig log par sgrub pa yod na de la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig log par sgrub pa yod na de la 'di skad ces /
translated: If some say that this is wrongly established, then this is said to them:

original: 'jig pa ni 'byung ba med par med de /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'byung ba med par med de /
translated: Destruction does not exist without emergence,üîΩbecause it is the condition of emergence, just as death does not exist without birth.

original: de'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dper na 'chi ba skye ba med par med pa bzhin no zhes sgrub pa dpes drangs rnams kyang 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i dngos po rnams la 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid nam yang med pa ma yin pas
analyzed: de'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dper na 'chi ba skye ba med par med pa bzhin no zhes sgrub pa dpes drangs rnams kyang 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i dngos po rnams la 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid nam yang med pa ma yin pas
translated: Since the example is drawn from the proof, the impermanence of destruction of things that emerge never does not exist in things that emerge.

original: 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore emergence does not exist without destruction.üîΩThe other schools say: When it encounters the cause of destruction, impermanence causes destruction. Therefore impermanence does not exist at all times.

original: sde pa gzhan las gang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pas des na dus thams cad du mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de yang zhes bya bas ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba
analyzed: sde pa gzhan las gang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pas des na dus thams cad du mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de yang zhes bya bas ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is also‚Äù refers to the Vaibhashika

original: dag gi gzhung las 'jig pa la rgyu yod par smra ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: dag gi gzhung las 'jig pa la rgyu yod par smra ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: scriptures, which state that destruction has a cause.

original: de dag na re dper na gcod pa'i rgyu sta re dang phrad nas mis shing gcod par byed pas des na dus thams cad du mi nyid gcod pa po ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag na re dper na gcod pa'i rgyu sta re dang phrad nas mis shing gcod par byed pas des na dus thams cad du mi nyid gcod pa po ma yin gyi /
translated: They say: Just as a man cuts wood by contacting it with an axe, the cause of cutting, therefore a man is not a cutter at all times.

original: gcod pa'i rgyu nyid logs shig na yod pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i rgyu tho ba dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis bum pa 'jig par byed pas /
analyzed: gcod pa'i rgyu nyid logs shig na yod pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i rgyu tho ba dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis bum pa 'jig par byed pas /
translated: Similarly, impermanence causes a vase to disintegrate by contacting it with a hammer, the cause of disintegration.

original: des na dus thams cad du mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na dus thams cad du mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore impermanence does not exist at all times.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid logs shig na yod pas de'i phyir 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par yang yod pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid logs shig na yod pas de'i phyir 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par yang yod pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the cause of disintegration exists separately, therefore emergence exists without disintegration.

original: de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: To refute their texts, the author of the commentary states:

original: gal te de lta na aa ru ra dang phrad nas lhas 'khru bar byed pa lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na aa ru ra dang phrad nas lhas 'khru bar byed pa lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then it would be like a god bathing by contacting a myrobalan fruit.

original: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu yod na ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed na de lta na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'jig par byed kyi /üîΩmi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par mi byed de /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu yod na ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed na de lta na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'jig par byed kyi / mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par mi byed de /
translated: In that case, the cause of destruction itself causes destruction,

original: de yod kyang 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yod kyang 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: but impermanence does not cause destruction because even though it exists, it does not cause destruction.

original: gal te de ltar 'jig pa las rgyu gzhan logs shig na yod cing de dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed na de lta na kha cig na re 'khru ba'i rgyu aa ru ra logs shig yod pa dang phrad nas lhas @150a * //
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'jig pa las rgyu gzhan logs shig na yod cing de dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed na de lta na kha cig na re 'khru ba'i rgyu aa ru ra logs shig yod pa dang phrad nas lhas @150a * //
translated: If destruction exists separately from a cause of destruction and impermanence causes destruction by contacting it, then it would be like some who say that the cause of washing exists separately from washing and the god Indra causes washing by contacting it.

original: 'khru bar byed do zhes zer ba lta bur 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'khru bar byed do zhes zer ba lta bur 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ste /
translated: But that is illogical.

original: de ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'jig par byed kyi mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par mi byed pas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'jig par byed kyi mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par mi byed pas /
translated: In that case, the cause of destruction itself causes destruction, but impermanence does not cause destruction.

original: 'byung ba yang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad kyi bar du rang gi ngang gis mi 'jig pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'byung ba yang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad kyi bar du rang gi ngang gis mi 'jig pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: The error would arise that the elements would not be destroyed by their own intrinsic nature until they came in contact with the cause of destruction.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang 'dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang 'dri bar bya ste /
translated: This should be asked:

original: ci 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zhig 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zhig 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur ram /
translated: Does that which has the nature of destruction come to be destroyed in dependence on a cause of destruction?üîΩOr does that which does not have the nature of destruction come to be destroyed in dependence on a cause of destruction?

original: 'on te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa zhig 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag la gal te gnyis brtag par bya zhing gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: 'on te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa zhig 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag la gal te gnyis brtag par bya zhing gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: This shows that the two alternatives should be investigated and that both are untenable.

original: de la brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the first alternative is untenable,

original: de la gal te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni de'i 'jig pa de skyes ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni de'i 'jig pa de skyes ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: if it has the nature of destruction, then its destruction would occur immediately upon its arising.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it has the nature of that, like its own nature, it is not logical.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na 'jig pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i 'jig pa de skyes ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur bas de 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na 'jig pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i 'jig pa de skyes ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur bas de 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical argument, the example, and the conclusion are applied in order.üîΩFor example, the nature of destruction is the nature of that destruction, and because it arises immediately after that destruction, it is not logical that it is destroyed in dependence on another cause of destruction.

original: bdag nyid can yang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i 'jig pa de skyes ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur bas de 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid can yang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i 'jig pa de skyes ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur bas de 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, that which has the nature of destruction is the nature of destruction, and because it arises immediately after that destruction, it is not logical that it is destroyed in dependence on another cause of destruction.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the second analysis is also untenable,üîΩNƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin na yang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin na yang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if it is not of the nature of disintegration, it would not disintegrate.üîΩBecause it is not of that nature, like nirvana.

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is illogical.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These lines should be applied in order to the subject, the predicate, the proof, the example, and the conclusion.üîΩFor example, because nirvana is not of the nature of disintegration, it does not disintegrate. Therefore it is illogical to say that it disintegrates in dependence on another cause of disintegration.

original: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig par mi 'gyur bas 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i bdag nyid @150b can ma yin pa yang
analyzed: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig par mi 'gyur bas 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i bdag nyid @150b can ma yin pa yang
translated: In the same way, even if it is not of the nature of disintegration,

original: 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig par mi 'gyur bas 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig par mi 'gyur bas 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not the nature of disintegration, it is not logical that disintegration occurs in dependence on another cause of disintegration.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pas /
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pas /
translated: Thus, in general, this passage refutes the assertion of the Vaibhasikas that impermanence causes disintegration after it comes in contact with the cause of disintegration.

original: des na ji srid du 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad pa de srid du mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par yang yod pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i gzhung dgag pa spyir bstan to //
analyzed: des na ji srid du 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad pa de srid du mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par yang yod pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i gzhung dgag pa spyir bstan to //
translated: Therefore, as long as it does not come in contact with the cause of disintegration, it does not disintegrate through impermanence. Therefore, it is said that the primary elements exist without disintegration.

original: da ni de dag gis brtags pa'i 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de yang de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni de dag gis brtags pa'i 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de yang de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the refutation of the cause of disintegration imputed by them, it is said: That which is asserted to be the cause of the disintegration of something is not its cause.

original: de la khyad par yod kyang de khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la khyad par yod kyang de khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Although there is a difference in those, there is no difference in that, for example, like that from another.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical argument, the example, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: dper na tho ba bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de las gzhan pa me tog 'jig pa'i rgyur kha ba dang / tsha dang / me la sogs pa 'dod pa de dag ni rgyu de dag la khyad par yod de de dag gis bshig pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba me tog mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur pa de khyad par med pa'i phyir de dag me tog 'jig pa de'i rgyu ma
analyzed: dper na tho ba bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de las gzhan pa me tog 'jig pa'i rgyur kha ba dang / tsha dang / me la sogs pa 'dod pa de dag ni rgyu de dag la khyad par yod de de dag gis bshig pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba me tog mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur pa de khyad par med pa'i phyir de dag me tog 'jig pa de'i rgyu ma
translated: For example, a hammer is asserted to be the cause of the destruction of a pot, and from that, other things such as snow, heat, fire, and so on are asserted to be the cause of the destruction of a flower. Those are causes that have a difference, because the so-called destruction that is destroyed by those has a different attribute, and that is not different from the destruction of a flower.

original: yin pa de bzhin du tho ba bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de yang tho ba de la lcags tho dang shing tho la sogs pa dag gi khyad par yod kyang de dag gis bshig pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba bum pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar
analyzed: yin pa de bzhin du tho ba bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de yang tho ba de la lcags tho dang shing tho la sogs pa dag gi khyad par yod kyang de dag gis bshig pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba bum pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar
translated: Likewise, although the hammer has distinctions such as being an iron hammer or a wooden hammer, the so-called disintegration that it destroys is not a different attribute of the pot.

original: gyur pa de khyad par med pa'i phyir tho ba de bum pa 'jig pa de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gyur pa de khyad par med pa'i phyir tho ba de bum pa 'jig pa de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore the hammer is not the cause of the disintegration of the pot.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu yang de dang mthun pa'i khyad par can 'gyur ba las rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags pa yin na gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de ni
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu yang de dang mthun pa'i khyad par can 'gyur ba las rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags pa yin na gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de ni
translated: Thus in the world, cause and effect are designated as cause and effect when the effect is a different attribute that accords with the cause.

original: rgyu de la khyad par yod kyang nges bshig pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur pa de khyad par med pa'i phyir de de'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de la khyad par yod kyang nges bshig pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur pa de khyad par med pa'i phyir de de'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: But the so-called disintegration that is the cause of the disintegration of that object is not a different attribute of that object.üîΩTherefore the hammer is not the cause of the disintegration of the pot.

original: de ni 'jig pa rgyu can ma yin par dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'jig pa rgyu can ma yin par dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that destruction is not a result, he says:

original: yang na 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, destruction does not have a cause,

original: 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dus ma byas bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dus ma byas bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it does not possess destruction, like, for example, an unconditioned phenomenon.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par @151a * //üîΩgo rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par @151a * // go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na 'dus ma byas ni 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa yang rang gi ngang gis 'jig pas 'jig pa gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin no
analyzed: dper na 'dus ma byas ni 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa yang rang gi ngang gis 'jig pas 'jig pa gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin no
translated: For example, just as an unconditioned phenomenon does not have a cause because it does not possess destruction, in the same way, since destruction itself is destroyed, it does not possess another destruction and therefore does not have a cause.

original: // 'jig pa la rgyu yod par dam bca' ba dag la skyon gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // 'jig pa la rgyu yod par dam bca' ba dag la skyon gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is another error in the thesis that destruction has a cause, he says:

original: de ltar dbu ma pas 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyu dang ldan pa nyid bstsal ba'i phyir /üîΩpha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la chos can 'jig pa'i chos rgyu dang ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar dbu ma pas 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyu dang ldan pa nyid bstsal ba'i phyir / pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la chos can 'jig pa'i chos rgyu dang ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, because the Madhyamika has inferred that destruction does not have a cause, the opponent‚Äôs thesis is flawed because the very fact that it has a cause is refuted by the fact that it does not have a cause.

original: dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma des pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan to /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu brgyad pa /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma des pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan to / // / bam po drug cu brgyad pa /
translated: The previous inference of the Madhyamika demonstrates that the opponent‚Äôs thesis is flawed because the very fact that destruction has a cause is refuted.

original: gal te 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: If you say that destruction has a cause,

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na skye ba bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'jig pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rgyu dang bcas pa sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na skye ba bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'jig pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rgyu dang bcas pa sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: If you say that it is because it is a characteristic of the conditioned, like arising, this is a syllogistic statement that proves the reason that disintegration is a characteristic of the conditioned.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the reason, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na skye ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na skye ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Just as arising is a characteristic of the conditioned because it has a cause, so too disintegration is a characteristic of the conditioned because it has a cause.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis ;
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis ;
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The final moment of mind, mental factors, cognition, and sound are not ascertained.

original: des ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin par ston te /
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin par ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that the reason stated by the opponent, ‚Äúbecause it is a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon,‚Äù is not established.

original: 'di la sems dang sems las byung ba dang / blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin yang rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na skye ba bzhin du 'jig pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa
analyzed: 'di la sems dang sems las byung ba dang / blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin yang rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na skye ba bzhin du 'jig pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa
translated: Since mind, mental factors, thought, and the final moment of sound are characteristics of conditioned phenomena, but are not seen to possess causes, then is it that because they are characteristics of conditioned phenomena, like arising,

original: yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: cessation also possesses a cause?

original: 'on te 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir @151b dper na sems dang sems las byung ba dang / blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma dag bzhin du 'jig pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin par 'gyur ba nges pa nyid yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub po //
analyzed: 'on te 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir @151b dper na sems dang sems las byung ba dang / blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma dag bzhin du 'jig pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin par 'gyur ba nges pa nyid yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub po //
translated: Therefore the opponent‚Äôs reason, ‚Äúbecause it is the characteristic of the conditioned,‚Äù is not established.

original: dpe yang med de dngos po ma byung ba las 'byung bas dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa nyid skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dpe yang med de dngos po ma byung ba las 'byung bas dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa nyid skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Nor is there an example, because the arising of a thing from a nonthing is called the arising of the thing itself that obtains its status.üîΩEven conventionally, because a thing arises from a nonthing, arising is not substantially established.

original: tha snyad du yang dngos po nyid ma byung ba las 'byung bas skye ba rdzas su ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag na re dper na skye ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe de tha snyad du yang ma grub par
analyzed: tha snyad du yang dngos po nyid ma byung ba las 'byung bas skye ba rdzas su ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag na re dper na skye ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe de tha snyad du yang ma grub par
translated: This shows that the example that the opponent stated earlier, ‚Äúfor example, like arising,‚Äù is not established even conventionally.

original: ston to // 'di ltar skye ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po ma byung ba las 'byung bas dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa las logs shig na rdzas su grub pa med pa'i phyir pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar skye ba zhes bya ba'i rdzas dang dngos po las gzhan
analyzed: ston to // 'di ltar skye ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po ma byung ba las 'byung bas dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa las logs shig na rdzas su grub pa med pa'i phyir pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar skye ba zhes bya ba'i rdzas dang dngos po las gzhan
translated: a substance that exists separately from the attainment of the nature of aüîΩthing, as the opponent maintains.  It is not like the substance called ‚Äúarising,‚ÄùüîΩwhich is said to be different from a thing and to bring it into existence.

original: pa logs shig na yod la dngos po ni de sgrub par byed do zhes zer ba lta bu ma yin pas skye ba rdzas su yang med la de la rgyu gzhan yang logs shig na med de /
analyzed: pa logs shig na yod la dngos po ni de sgrub par byed do zhes zer ba lta bu ma yin pas skye ba rdzas su yang med la de la rgyu gzhan yang logs shig na med de /
translated: Therefore, arising does not exist as a substance, and there is no other causeüîΩof it.

original: dngos po ma byung ba las 'byung bas dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa nyid skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po ma byung ba las 'byung bas dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa nyid skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since a thing that did not previously exist comes into existence, the attainment of the nature of a thing is called ‚Äúarising.‚ÄùüîΩAlthough conventionally there is a cause of it, since it is not like the opponent‚Äôs

original: de la tha snyad du rgyu yod kyang pha rol po'i sgrub pa dang mi mthun pas dper mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la tha snyad du rgyu yod kyang pha rol po'i sgrub pa dang mi mthun pas dper mi rung ngo //
translated: position, it is not a suitable example.

original: gzegs zan pa gang dag blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa ni ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni mu stegs gzegs zan pa dag blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jigs pa dag
analyzed: gzegs zan pa gang dag blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa ni ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni mu stegs gzegs zan pa dag blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jigs pa dag
translated: If you say that the last moment of the mind and sound is destroyed without being seen by an agent,üîΩthe tƒ´rthika KƒÅ≈õyapƒ´ya say that the last moment of the mind and sound is destroyed without being seen by an agent.

original: ni / ma mthong ba zhes bya ba chos dang chos ma yin pa dbang po las 'das pa dag gi byed pa po dang ldan pas des na blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa'i rgyu ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa
analyzed: ni / ma mthong ba zhes bya ba chos dang chos ma yin pa dbang po las 'das pa dag gi byed pa po dang ldan pas des na blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa'i rgyu ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa
translated: Since it is an agent of invisible phenomena and nonphenomena that are beyond the senses, the cause of the destruction of the last moment of the mind and sound is phenomena and nonphenomena.

original: la rgyu yod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: la rgyu yod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Therefore they say that destruction has a cause.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig pa la rgyu med pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dag 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig pa la rgyu med pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dag 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par ston to //
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThat is illogical,‚Äù and so on. He teaches that destruction is without cause and that phenomena and nonphenomena are not the cause of destruction.

original: de la re zhig 'jig pa la rgyu med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'jig pa la rgyu med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: First, to demonstrate that destruction does not have a cause, he says:

original: zhig nas med pa la ni rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhig nas med pa la ni rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is destroyed and does not exist has no cause,üîΩbecause it does not exist, like, for example, the utterly nonexistent.

original: med pa'i phyir dper na gtan med pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩde dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin @152a * //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na gtan med pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin @152a * //
translated: This is stated because it is inferred that that which is destroyed and does not exist has no cause because it does not exist.

original: du sbyar te ;
analyzed: du sbyar te ;
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, utterly nonexistent things such as the horns of a rabbit and the son of a barren woman do not exist, and therefore they have no cause.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa gtan med pa dag ni med pa'i phyir de dag la rgyu yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma la 'jig pa zhig nas med pa yang med
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa gtan med pa dag ni med pa'i phyir de dag la rgyu yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma la 'jig pa zhig nas med pa yang med
translated: In the same way, that which is destroyed and does not exist at the end of the last moment of the mind and sound does not exist.

original: pa'i phyir de dag la rgyu yod pa ma yin pas rjes su dpag pa des na blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yin no zhes zer ba de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir de dag la rgyu yod pa ma yin pas rjes su dpag pa des na blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yin no zhes zer ba de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they do not have a cause, it is illogical to say that the final moment of the mind and the final moment of sound are the causes of disintegration.

original: da ni chos cang chos ma yin pa dag 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni chos cang chos ma yin pa dag 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that virtue and nonvirtue are not the causes of disintegration,

original: blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa ni ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa ni ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: the final moment of the mind and the final moment of sound do not possess an unseen agent of disintegration,

original: 'jig pa'i phyir dper na blo dang / sgra dang / me lce dag gi dang po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i phyir dper na blo dang / sgra dang / me lce dag gi dang po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because they disintegrate, like, for example, the first moment of the mind, sound, and a flame.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example should be applied in order.

original: dper na blo dang sgra dang me lce dag gi dang po ni 'jig pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa yang 'jig pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'i byed pa poüîΩdang ldan pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: dper na blo dang sgra dang me lce dag gi dang po ni 'jig pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa yang 'jig pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa ma yin pas /
translated: Likewise, the final moment of a mind or sound is not seen to possess an agent of cessation because it is ceasing.

original: rjes su dpag pa des na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ba de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ba de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that nonvirtue and virtue are the causes of cessation.üîΩHere, the earlier position that the opponent is bringing up is that since flowers, trees, fruits, and pots are destroyed by being struck by snow, salt, fire, and hammers, respectively, destruction has a cause.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re kha ba dang tshva dang me dang / tho ba dag gis phog pas me tog dang shing dang 'bras bu dang bum pa dag 'jig par 'gyur bas 'jig pa la rgyu yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis kha ba dang tshva
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re kha ba dang tshva dang me dang / tho ba dag gis phog pas me tog dang shing dang 'bras bu dang bum pa dag 'jig par 'gyur bas 'jig pa la rgyu yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis kha ba dang tshva
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here says that snow, salt,

original: dang me dang / tho ba dag gis phog pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dang me dang / tho ba dag gis phog pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Also, the striking of a flower by fire or a hammer causes a difference in the characteristics of the cause that is subsumed by conventional truth.

original: 'jig par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But it does not cause the destruction of the flower.

original: de dag gis phog pa ni me tog la sogs pa tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gis phog pa ni me tog la sogs pa tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The striking of a flower by fire or a hammer is the cause that generates a difference in the characteristics of the cause that is subsumed by conventional truth.

original: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: It is not the cause of the destruction of the flower.

original: des na kha nas phog pa yang me tog gi rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: des na kha nas phog pa yang me tog gi rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the striking of a flower by the wind is the cause that generates a difference in the characteristics of the cause that is subsumed by conventional truth.

original: me tog 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: me tog 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: It is not the cause of the destruction of the flower.

original: tshvas phog pa yang 'bras bu'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: tshvas phog pa yang 'bras bu'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The striking of a rice seed by water and warmth is the cause that generates a difference in the characteristics of the cause that is subsumed by conventional truth.

original: 'bras bu 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cause of the destruction of the rice seed.

original: mes phog pa yang shing gi rgyu sol ba dang thal ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i @152b rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: mes phog pa yang shing gi rgyu sol ba dang thal ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i @152b rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Also, the cause of the different characteristics of the ash and soot, etc.

original: shing 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: shing 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: of the burned wood is not the cause of the destruction of the wood.

original: tho bas phog pa yang bum pa'i rgyu gyo mo la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: tho bas phog pa yang bum pa'i rgyu gyo mo la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Also, the cause of the different characteristics of the potsherds, etc.

original: bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: of the broken pot is not the cause of the destruction of the pot.

original: de lta bas na tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skye ba la ni rgyu yod kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skye ba la ni rgyu yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, the cause of the production of different characteristics that belong to the conventional truth exists,

original: 'jig pa la ni rgyu med de /
analyzed: 'jig pa la ni rgyu med de /
translated: but the cause of destruction does not exist.

original: rang gi ngang gis mi rtag pa nyid kyis skad cig ma re re la rang 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis mi rtag pa nyid kyis skad cig ma re re la rang 'jig pa yin te /
translated: Because of impermanence by nature, each moment is destroyed by itself.

original: dper na bong ba gnam du 'phangs pa yar 'gro ba la ni rgyu lag pa la sogs pa 'phen pa'i shugs dag yod kyi /
analyzed: dper na bong ba gnam du 'phangs pa yar 'gro ba la ni rgyu lag pa la sogs pa 'phen pa'i shugs dag yod kyi /
translated: For example, the cause of the upward movement of a clod of earth thrown into the air is the force of the hand that threw it.

original: de nyid phyir lhung ba la ni rgyu gzhan med de /
analyzed: de nyid phyir lhung ba la ni rgyu gzhan med de /
translated: But the cause of its falling down is not another cause.

original: rang gi ngang gis lhung ba lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis lhung ba lta bu yin pas /
translated: It falls down by its own nature.

original: des na 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: des na 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //
translated: Therefore, the compound ‚Äúwithout destruction‚Äù means that the elements do not exist without destruction.

original: ci ste tho bas phog pa la sogs pa dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /üîΩde dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'jig pa'i rgyu yod na gzhig par bya ba ma snang bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyi tho bas phog pa la sogs pa dag 'jig pa'i
analyzed: ci ste tho bas phog pa la sogs pa dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin te / de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'jig pa'i rgyu yod na gzhig par bya ba ma snang bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyi tho bas phog pa la sogs pa dag 'jig pa'i
translated: But if you think that the hammer‚Äôs blow and so on are the cause of destruction,üîΩbecause when they exist, the object to be destroyed is not perceived,

original: rgyu nyid yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: the opponent‚Äôs statement that the hammer‚Äôs blow and so on are the cause of destruction is a statement that proves the reason that when the cause of destruction exists, the object to be destroyed is not perceived.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The hammer‚Äôs blow and so on are the subject, the property to be established, the property that establishes, and the example, respectively.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu tho bas phog pa la sogs pa de dag yod na gzhig pa bya ba bum pa la sogs pa dag gzung du med cing mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir tho bas phog pa la sogs pa dag ni bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyuüîΩnyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu tho bas phog pa la sogs pa de dag yod na gzhig pa bya ba bum pa la sogs pa dag gzung du med cing mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir tho bas phog pa la sogs pa dag ni bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, a hammer strike and so on are the causes of the destruction of a pot and so on.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says: That is illogical.

original: gtan tshigs kyi gzhi mi mthun pa'i phyir dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi gzhi mi mthun pa'i phyir dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /

original: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs 'jigs pa'i rgyu de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de phyogs dang / mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la thun mong du khyab pa ma yin te /

original: dper na sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni mi rtag ste /
