translated: But if you say that the cause of the nonexistence of a pot is the blow of a hammer,

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dper na mig yod na gzugs dmigs pa 'byung bas gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu ni mig yin pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'jig pa'i rgyu de yod na 'jig pa 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bum pa
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dper na mig yod na gzugs dmigs pa 'byung bas gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu ni mig yin pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'jig pa'i rgyu de yod na 'jig pa 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bum pa
translated: because it occurs when it exists, like the eye, for example, since the occurrence of the apprehension of form is due to the existence of the eye, the cause of the apprehension of form is the eye.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu tho bas phog pa yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu tho bas phog pa yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs statement is a syllogism that proves that the cause of the destruction of a pot is the blow of a hammer, because the cause of its destruction exists when destruction occurs.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na mig yod na gzugs dmigs pa 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu ni mig yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i rgyu de yod na 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir bum pa 'jig par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni tho bas phog pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na mig yod na gzugs dmigs pa 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu ni mig yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i rgyu de yod na 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir bum pa 'jig par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni tho bas phog pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, since destruction occurs when its cause exists, the cause of the destruction of a pot is the blow of a hammer.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las bum pa la tho bas phog pa yod na bum pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las bum pa la tho bas phog pa yod na bum pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: That is also illogical because according to our tenets, when a pot is struck by a hammer, the characteristics of the pot arise differently,

original: 'jigs pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir dang dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir dang dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: but it is not destroyed. Therefore the reason is not established in any way and there is no example.

original: khyod kyi gtan tshigs de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba tho bas phog pa yod na bum pa 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir tho bas phog pa ni bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyu yin par sgrub pa de kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las
analyzed: khyod kyi gtan tshigs de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba tho bas phog pa yod na bum pa 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir tho bas phog pa ni bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyu yin par sgrub pa de kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las
translated: Your reason, ‚Äúbecause it occurs when that exists,‚Äù is like proving that the blow of a hammer is the cause of the destruction of a pot because the destruction of the pot occurs when the blow of the hammer exists.üîΩIn our Madhyamaka tenet system,

original: bum pa la tho bas phog pa yod na bum pa'i rgyu gyo mo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba 'byung bas phog pa ni gyo mo la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gzhan skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: bum pa la tho bas phog pa yod na bum pa'i rgyu gyo mo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba 'byung bas phog pa ni gyo mo la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gzhan skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: when the blow of a hammer exists, the cause of the pot, such as shards, arises with a different attribute. Therefore the blow is the cause that generates another with a different attribute, such as shards.

original: bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs 'jig pa'i rgyu de yod na 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de kho bo cag gi phyogs @153b la med pas gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs 'jig pa'i rgyu de yod na 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de kho bo cag gi phyogs @153b la med pas gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cause of the destruction of the pot. Therefore your reason, ‚Äúbecause destruction occurs when that exists,‚Äù does not exist in our position. Therefore it is illogical because it is not established for either party.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyi dpe mig yod na gzugs dmigs pa 'byung bas gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu ni mig yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par ma grub pas khyed kyi dpe yang med pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyi dpe mig yod na gzugs dmigs pa 'byung bas gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu ni mig yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par ma grub pas khyed kyi dpe yang med pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin
translated: This is not a correct example for us because in our system, the eye is not ultimately established.

original: no // gzhan gyi phyogs la yang gyo mo la sogs pa tho bas phog pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can dag ni byed pa po phog pa dang ldan pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sangs rgyas pa dag las gzhan kha cig dang phyi rol pa
analyzed: no // gzhan gyi phyogs la yang gyo mo la sogs pa tho bas phog pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can dag ni byed pa po phog pa dang ldan pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sangs rgyas pa dag las gzhan kha cig dang phyi rol pa
translated: Also, in the system of others, such as some non-Buddhists and some other Buddhist schools, the effect of the action of striking, such as a pot, is asserted to be the agent of striking.

original: dag las gzhan kha cig gi phyogs la yang gyo mo la sogs pa tho bas phog pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can 'bras bu dag ni bdag nyid skyed pa'i byed pa po phog pa dang ldan pa ma yin par 'dod pa'i phyir des kyang tho bas phog pa
analyzed: dag las gzhan kha cig gi phyogs la yang gyo mo la sogs pa tho bas phog pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can 'bras bu dag ni bdag nyid skyed pa'i byed pa po phog pa dang ldan pa ma yin par 'dod pa'i phyir des kyang tho bas phog pa
translated: This is not a correct example for us because in our system, the effect of the action of striking, such as a pot, is not asserted to be the agent of striking that generates itself.

original: la sogs pa ni gyo mo la sogs pa tho bas phog pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can 'bras bu dag skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: la sogs pa ni gyo mo la sogs pa tho bas phog pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can 'bras bu dag skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: and so on refers to the causes of the effects such as potsherds that are generated by the causes of being struck by a hammer and so on.

original: bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par grub pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de dag gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par grub pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de dag gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Since it is established that they are not causes of the destruction of pots and so on, your reason, because it arises when it exists, is not established for either of the two parties.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces tho bas phog pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis bum pa yang 'jig par byed la /
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces tho bas phog pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis bum pa yang 'jig par byed la /
translated: Here, if the opponent says, that which is struck by a hammer destroys the pot and also generates potsherds,üîΩthen the error that our reason, because it arises when it exists, is not established for either of the two parties does not occur.

original: gyo mo yang skyed par byed pas des na kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i skyon med do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel
analyzed: gyo mo yang skyed par byed pas des na kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i skyon med do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel
translated: Here, in response to the opponent‚Äôs position that is drawn out from within, the Commentary states:

original: pa byed pa nyid kyis tho bas phog pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis bum pa yang 'jig par byed la /
analyzed: pa byed pa nyid kyis tho bas phog pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis bum pa yang 'jig par byed la /
translated: and the very action of the hammer‚Äôs striking destroys the pot and produces the potsherds.

original: gyo mo yang skyed par byed do zhes bya bar ni gcig gis dus gcig tu bya ba mi mthun pa gnyis byed par mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gyo mo yang skyed par byed do zhes bya bar ni gcig gis dus gcig tu bya ba mi mthun pa gnyis byed par mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is not logical for one thing to perform two incompatible actions at one time.

original: mar me gcig gis dus gcig tu snang ba dang mun pa'i bya ba mi mthun pa gnyis byed par mi rigs pa dang / mi gcig gis dus gcig phye 'gam pa dang gling bu bud pa'i bya ba mi mthun pa gnyis byed par mi rigs pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mar me gcig gis dus gcig tu snang ba dang mun pa'i bya ba mi mthun pa gnyis byed par mi rigs pa dang / mi gcig gis dus gcig phye 'gam pa dang gling bu bud pa'i bya ba mi mthun pa gnyis byed par mi rigs pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is not logical for one lamp to perform two incompatible actions at one time, such as illuminating and creating darkness, and it is not logical for one person to perform two incompatible actions at one time, such as eating gruel and playing a flute.üîΩBut don‚Äôt we see that one fire at one time both dispels darkness and produces the transformation of what is to be cooked?

original: 'o na me gcig gis dus gcig tu mun pa yang sel bar byed la btso ba'i rnam pa 'gyur ba yang skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngam zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'jig rten na byed pa po gcig gis dus gcig
analyzed: 'o na me gcig gis dus gcig tu mun pa yang sel bar byed la btso ba'i rnam pa 'gyur ba yang skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngam zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'jig rten na byed pa po gcig gis dus gcig
translated: The opponent says that in the world, one agent at one time

original: tu bya ba mi mthun pa gnyis byed pa'i tshul 'di lta bu ma mthong ngam zhes 'dri ba'i tshig yin @154a * //
analyzed: tu bya ba mi mthun pa gnyis byed pa'i tshul 'di lta bu ma mthong ngam zhes 'dri ba'i tshig yin @154a * //
translated: Or do you not see that fire performs two incompatible actions?

original: no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: btso ba'i rnam pa 'gyur bskyed pa ni mthong gi / mun pa sel ba ni ma mthong ste mun pa ni snang ba med pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: btso ba'i rnam pa 'gyur bskyed pa ni mthong gi / mun pa sel ba ni ma mthong ste mun pa ni snang ba med pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: We see that fire generates the aspect of cooking, but we do not see that it clears away darkness, because darkness is merely the absence of light.

original: mes 'bras chen la sogs pa btso ba'i rnam pa dros pa dang bshur ba dang / tshos pa la sogs par 'gyur ba skyed pa ni mthong gi mun pa sel ba ni ma mthong ste /
analyzed: mes 'bras chen la sogs pa btso ba'i rnam pa dros pa dang bshur ba dang / tshos pa la sogs par 'gyur ba skyed pa ni mthong gi mun pa sel ba ni ma mthong ste /
translated: We see that fire generates the aspect of cooking, such as boiling, bubbling, and boiling over, but we do not see that it clears away darkness,üîΩbecause darkness is merely the absence of light. Since it is not a substantial thing, it cannot be sought.

original: mun pa ni snang ba med pa tsam yin pa'i phyir rdzas kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin pas btsal du med pa'i phyir dang / me yang sngar me dang bud shing brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: mun pa ni snang ba med pa tsam yin pa'i phyir rdzas kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin pas btsal du med pa'i phyir dang / me yang sngar me dang bud shing brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: Also, fire was previously refuted in the chapter on fire and fuel.

original: mar me yang ni gang dag na ;
analyzed: mar me yang ni gang dag na ;
translated: And also a lamp illuminates itself,

original: / de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
analyzed: / de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
translated: When it is present, there is no darkness.

original: ces bya ba dang / skye mched brtag pa'i skabs su lta ba rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / skye mched brtag pa'i skabs su lta ba rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: And in the chapter on the analysis of the sense bases, in order to establish the view, it is said:

original: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin //üîΩzhes smras pa dag gis mar mes kyang mun pa mi sel la /
analyzed: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin // zhes smras pa dag gis mar mes kyang mun pa mi sel la /
translated: It is not possible by the example of fire.üîΩThus, it is explained that the butterlamp does not dispel darkness,

original: mes kyang bud shing mi sreg go zhes bshad pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mes kyang bud shing mi sreg go zhes bshad pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: and that fire does not burn fuel.

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dad yang 'gal te /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dad yang 'gal te /
translated: The conclusion of the activity is also contradictory.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la mun pa zhes brjod pa'i gzugs kyi gnyen po snang ba shar na mun pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma ni rkyen med pas mi skye la skad cig ma snga ma ni rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa nyid kyis 'gags pas mun pa
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la mun pa zhes brjod pa'i gzugs kyi gnyen po snang ba shar na mun pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma ni rkyen med pas mi skye la skad cig ma snga ma ni rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa nyid kyis 'gags pas mun pa
translated: In our system, when the antidote of the so-called darkness, that is, light, arises, the subsequent moment of darkness does not arise because there are no conditions for it to do so. The previous moment of darkness ceases by itself.üîΩThe butterlamp is not the agent of its cessation.

original: de 'gag pa'i byed pa po ni me ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i phyogs la snang ba dang mun pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas gzhan med de /
analyzed: de 'gag pa'i byed pa po ni me ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i phyogs la snang ba dang mun pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas gzhan med de /
translated: Thus, in our system, that is, in the Madhyamaka, there is no other substance called light and darkness.

original: gzugs kyi gnas skabs tsam du zad pas mun pa zhes brjod pa'i gzugs kyi gnyen po snang ba shar ba na mun pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma ni rkyen med pas mi skye la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi gnas skabs tsam du zad pas mun pa zhes brjod pa'i gzugs kyi gnyen po snang ba shar ba na mun pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma ni rkyen med pas mi skye la /
translated: Since it is merely the state of form, when the antidote to the form called darkness arises, the subsequent moment of darkness does not arise because it lacks conditions.üîΩSince the prior moment of darkness ceases due to its own intrinsic state, fire is not the agent that causes the cessation of darkness.

original: skad cig ma snga ma ni rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa nyid kyis 'gags pas mun pa de 'gag pa'i byed pa po ni me ma yin pa'i phyir mes mun pa sel bar byed do zhes bya ba de mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bas mi rung ngo zhes
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma ni rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa nyid kyis 'gags pas mun pa de 'gag pa'i byed pa po ni me ma yin pa'i phyir mes mun pa sel bar byed do zhes bya ba de mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bas mi rung ngo zhes
translated: Therefore it is illogical to say that fire clears darkness because that contradicts the conclusion of the treatise.

original: bstan to // gzhan yang de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de yang gzung du med pa ni mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyun skye ba la 'grub kyi /
analyzed: bstan to // gzhan yang de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de yang gzung du med pa ni mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyun skye ba la 'grub kyi /
translated: Moreover, it was said that if they exist, the object to be cleared is not apprehended. That which is not apprehended is established as the arising of a continuum that has a different attribute.

original: kha ba dang tshva dang me dang tho ba la sogs pa dag yod na me tog dang 'bras bu dang shing dang bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs gzung du med pa ni de dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mi 'grub po zhes bya bas ni sngarüîΩpha rol po dag gis tho bas phog pa la @154b sogs pa dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: kha ba dang tshva dang me dang tho ba la sogs pa dag yod na me tog dang 'bras bu dang shing dang bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs gzung du med pa ni de dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mi 'grub po zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag gis tho bas phog pa la @154b sogs pa dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: If snow, salt, fire, hammers and so on existed, then the unapprehended form of flowers, fruits, trees, pots and so on would not be established as the cause of their disintegration.

original: de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de yang gzung du med pa zhes bya ba de ni bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyun skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na gtan tshigsüîΩsu 'grub kyi /
analyzed: de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de yang gzung du med pa zhes bya ba de ni bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyun skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na gtan tshigs su 'grub kyi /
translated: This is because previously the opponent said, ‚ÄúThe cause of disintegration is the hammer and so on because when they exist, the object to be destroyed is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: kha ba la sogs pa de dag yod pa me tog la sogs pa'i gzugs de dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs su mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: kha ba la sogs pa de dag yod pa me tog la sogs pa'i gzugs de dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs su mi 'grub ste /
translated: The reason that ‚Äúit is not apprehended‚Äù is established as the cause of the arising of a different type of continuum of the pot and so on, but it is not established as the reason that the existence of snow and so on is the cause of the disintegration of the form of flowers and so on.

original: kha ba la sogs pa de dag yod na me tog la sogs pa gzung du med pa ni de dag me tog la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyun gzhan skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi me tog la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan
analyzed: kha ba la sogs pa de dag yod na me tog la sogs pa gzung du med pa ni de dag me tog la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyun gzhan skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi me tog la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan
translated: If snow and so on exist, then flowers and so on that are not apprehended are the cause generating another continuum that is a different attribute from those flowers and so on, but they are not the cause of the disintegration of flowers and so on.

original: to // de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: to // de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate another inference of that, he says:

original: gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de dag ni de 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de dag ni de 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Those that are asserted to be the cause of the disintegration of something are not the cause of its disintegration,

original: rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smra ste /
analyzed: rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smra ste /
translated: because they are causes, like, for example, the intrinsic nature of fire.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na me gang zhig shing gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa'i me de'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rgyu can yin pa'i phyir me de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du me de shing de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na me gang zhig shing gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa'i me de'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rgyu can yin pa'i phyir me de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du me de shing de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: For example, the fire that is the cause of the destruction of a particular piece of wood is not the cause of the destruction of its own self, because it is a product. In the same way, that fire is not the cause of the destruction of that wood.

original: de bzhin du kha ba dang tshva dang tho ba la sogs pa gang dag me tog dang 'bras bu dang bum pa la sogs pa gang dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de dag kyang rgyu can yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin
analyzed: de bzhin du kha ba dang tshva dang tho ba la sogs pa gang dag me tog dang 'bras bu dang bum pa la sogs pa gang dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de dag kyang rgyu can yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin
translated: In the same way, snow, salt, a hammer, etc., that are asserted to be the cause of the destruction of a flower, fruit, pot, etc., are not the cause of the destruction of their own selves, because they are products.üîΩIn the same way, they are not the cause of the destruction of a flower, fruit, pot, etc.

original: pa de bzhin du de dag me tog dang 'bras bu dang bum pa la sogs pa dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no zhes 'jig pa'i rgyu thams cad dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa de bzhin du de dag me tog dang 'bras bu dang bum pa la sogs pa dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no zhes 'jig pa'i rgyu thams cad dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of all causes of destruction should be stated in this way.

analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de dag 'grub pa mu bzhi dgag pa sngar bstan pa dag ma gtogs par mu lnga pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pas don dam par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de dag 'grub par yod pa nyid ma yin

analyzed: no zhes bsnan pa bstan to //

translated: Thus, ultimately, the establishment of emergence and destruction does not exist. Therefore, previously the opponent said, ‚ÄúTime definitely exists ultimately.

analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /

analyzed: dus ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dus kyi rjes su 'brang pa dag gi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin pas des na de gsal ba yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don 'grub po zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin pas bstan bcos mdzad pas sngar don dam par dus ngo bo nyid med pas de gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ngo bo
translated: Since time is the cause of emergence and destruction that follow time, therefore time definitely exists in the ultimate. Thus, since that which is to be clarified exists, the reason is established. Therefore the meaning to be proven is established.

original: nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since the meaning of the reason is not established, the author of the treatise previously stated, ‚ÄúSince time does not intrinsically exist in the ultimate, the reason ‚Äòbecause it is the cause of that which is to be clarified‚Äô is not established.‚Äù Therefore the intended meaning of the thesis ‚ÄúUltimately, internal things do not intrinsically exist‚Äù is established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

original: dngos po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Although things have the nature of disintegrating, they do not disintegrate immediately after arising.üîΩThus, immediately after arising, endurance arises and after that, disintegration arises.

analyzed: de dag na re dngos po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi rim pa'i tshul gyis na dang por skye zhing de'i 'og tu gnas la de'i 'og tu 'jig par 'gyur ba yin pas des na khyed dbu ma pas 'jig pa
translated: They say, ‚ÄúAlthough things have the nature of disintegration, due to the order of the characteristics of conditioned phenomena, first they arise, then they endure, and after that they disintegrate.üîΩTherefore, you MƒÅdhyamikas cannot say that disintegration

original: ni 'byung ba med par yod pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: ni 'byung ba med par yod pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: does not exist without arising,üîΩand that arising does not exist without disintegration.

original: 'byung ba yang 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i mu de gnyis mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba yang 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i mu de gnyis mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus the two possibilities that you state are not tenable.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci ste dngos po 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin na zad pa'i ngang can yin pas de la 'byung ba yod pa dang / ci ste skyes ma thag tu 'jig na zad pa'i ngang can ma yin pas de la yang 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci ste dngos po 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin na zad pa'i ngang can yin pas de la 'byung ba yod pa dang / ci ste skyes ma thag tu 'jig na zad pa'i ngang can ma yin pas de la yang 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúHere it is said,‚Äù and so on. If things had the nature of disintegration, they would have the nature of cessation, and so emergence would exist for them. But if they disintegrated immediately after arising, they would not have the nature of cessation, and so emergence would not exist for them.

original: de bzhin du ci ste dngos po 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin na zad pa'i ngang can yin pas de la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / ci ste skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig na zad pa'i ngang can ma yin pas de la yang 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci ste dngos po 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin na zad pa'i ngang can yin pas de la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / ci ste skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig na zad pa'i ngang can ma yin pas de la yang 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, if things had the nature of disintegration, they would have the nature of cessation, and so destruction would not exist for them. But if they did not disintegrate immediately after arising, they would not have the nature of cessation, and so destruction would not exist for them.

original: de ltar mu bzhis 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par mi 'thad pas pha rol po dag gis brtags pa de ni gyi na'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ltar mu bzhis 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par mi 'thad pas pha rol po dag gis brtags pa de ni gyi na'o zhes ston to //
translated: Thus, since emergence and destruction are untenable in the four alternatives, the analysis of others is nonsense.

analyzed: de la re zhig mu dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: First, to demonstrate that the first possibility is untenable, he says:

original: @156a * // zad la 'byung ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: @156a * // zad la 'byung ba yod ma yin //
translated: An existent that is exhausted does not arise.

original: chos mi mthun pa gnyis dus gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir dper na skye ba dang 'chi ba dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa gnyis dus gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir dper na skye ba dang 'chi ba dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because two mutually exclusive attributes do not occur at the same time, like, for example, birth and death.

analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na skye ba dang / 'chi ba dag ni chos mi mthun pa gnyis dus gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po 'chi ba'i bdag nyid can zad pa'i ngang can la skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du zad pa dang 'byung ba dag kyang chos mi mthun pa gnyis dus
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, because birth and death are two mutually exclusive attributes that do not occur at the same time, birth does not exist for a thing that is by nature dying and has the nature of exhaustion.

original: gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zad pa'i ngang can la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zad pa'i ngang can la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, because exhaustion and arising are two mutually exclusive attributes that do not occur at the same time, arising does not exist for a thing that is by nature disintegrating and has the nature of exhaustion.

original: mu gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the second possibility is untenable,

original: ci ste skyes ma thag tu zad par mi 'gyur na ni 'o na de lta na zad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas des na kun rdzob tu yang ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste skyes ma thag tu zad par mi 'gyur na ni 'o na de lta na zad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas des na kun rdzob tu yang ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: if it did not immediately cease after arising, then in that case, since it would not have the nature of cessation, it would not be established as the aspect of the statement ‚Äúarising of the unceased‚Äù because it would not be established as the aspect of the statement ‚Äúarising of the ceased.‚Äù

original: ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med //üîΩces gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med // ces gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Arising does not exist for the unceased.

original: ci ste pha rol po dag mu dang pos brtags pa'i skyon de mi 'dod pas dngos po skyes ma thag tu zad par mi 'gyur bas des na zad pa la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na 'o na de lta
analyzed: ci ste pha rol po dag mu dang pos brtags pa'i skyon de mi 'dod pas dngos po skyes ma thag tu zad par mi 'gyur bas des na zad pa la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na 'o na de lta
translated: If the opponent says that because they do not assert the error of the first possibility, things do not immediately cease after arising, and therefore the error of ‚Äúarising of that which has not ceased‚Äù does not exist, then in that case, since it would not have the nature of cessation, it would not be established as the aspect of the statement ‚Äúarising of the ceased.‚Äù

original: na dngos po de zad pa dang 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin pas rtag pa yin pa'i phyir de la kun rdzob tu yang sngar pha rol po dag gis dngos po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur teüîΩ/ 'di ltar skyes ma thag tu gnas pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de'i 'og tu 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: na dngos po de zad pa dang 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin pas rtag pa yin pa'i phyir de la kun rdzob tu yang sngar pha rol po dag gis dngos po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur te / 'di ltar skyes ma thag tu gnas pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de'i 'og tu 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that thing is permanent because it is not the nature of exhaustion and destruction, it is not tenable to say that it is impermanent.

original: ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med//
analyzed: ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med//
translated: Therefore, previously the opponent said that although things have the nature of destruction, they do not disintegrate as soon as they are produced.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: It is said:üîΩThings that are not exhausted do not arise.

original: mu gsum pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mu gsum pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the third possibility is untenable, it is said:

original: de bzhin du /üîΩzad la 'jig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de bzhin du / zad la 'jig pa yod ma yin //
translated: Likewise,

original: zad par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can //üîΩ'jig pa dang ldan pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zad par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can // 'jig pa dang ldan pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: destruction does not exist for that which is exhausted.üîΩThat which has the character of exhaustionüîΩdoes not have destruction.

original: der brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'chi ba'i ngang tshul can bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: der brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'chi ba'i ngang tshul can bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That which has the character of death does not have death because it would be pointless to investigate it.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na dngos po 'chi ba'i ngang tshul can la ni yang 'chi bar brtags pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de la 'chi ba yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du @156b dngos po zad par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can 'jig pa dang ldan pa
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na dngos po 'chi ba'i ngang tshul can la ni yang 'chi bar brtags pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de la 'chi ba yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du @156b dngos po zad par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can 'jig pa dang ldan pa
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, it is meaningless to investigate whether or not that which has the character of death dies again, and so death does not exist there.

original: la yang / yang 'jig par brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de la yang 'jig pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: la yang / yang 'jig par brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de la yang 'jig pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, it is meaningless to investigate whether or not that which has the character of the destruction of things, that is, that which possesses destruction, is destroyed again, and so destruction does not exist there.

original: mu bzhi pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the fourth alternative is untenable, it says:

original: ma zad pa la'ang 'jig pa med //
analyzed: ma zad pa la'ang 'jig pa med //
translated: That which is not exhausted is not destroyed.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin pas de ni gyi na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin pas de ni gyi na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is not of the nature of that, like liberation.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na thar pa ni 'jig pa de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de la 'jig pa med pa de bzhin du dngos po skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig pa zad par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa de yang 'jig pa de'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na thar pa ni 'jig pa de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de la 'jig pa med pa de bzhin du dngos po skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig pa zad par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa de yang 'jig pa de'i ngo bo nyid
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: ma yin pa'i phyir de la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyir de la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, just as liberation is not subject to destruction because it is not by nature subject to destruction, so too, since a thing that does not disintegrate immediately after it arises is not by nature subject to cessation, it is not subject to destruction.

original: de ltar mu bzhis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par mi 'thad pas pha rol po dag gis brtags pa de ni gyi na'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar mu bzhis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par mi 'thad pas pha rol po dag gis brtags pa de ni gyi na'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, since it is untenable that arising and destruction exist in any of the four ways, the assertions of the opponent are nonsense.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩ'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúArising and destruction definitely exist because they are properties of things.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni dngos po'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni dngos po'i chos ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not exist is not a property of a thing.

original: dper na sbal ba'i ze ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbal ba'i ze ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the crest of a turtle.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni dngos po'i chos yin pas /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni dngos po'i chos yin pas /
translated: Since emergence and destruction are qualities of things,üîΩtherefore they definitely exist.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag dngos po'i chos yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis yod pa kho nar sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag dngos po'i chos yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis yod pa kho nar sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs statement that since emergence and destruction are qualities of things, they definitely exist.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i chos can dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i chos can dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: This is the thesis, the property of the subject, the reason, the similar example, the property of the subject in the similar example, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: 'di na sbal pa'i ze ba lta bu gang med pa dngos po'i chos ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na sbal pa'i ze ba lta bu gang med pa dngos po'i chos ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, that which does not exist, like the crest of a turtle, is not a quality of a thing.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yin pas de'i phyir de dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yin pas de'i phyir de dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: But since emergence and destruction are the qualities of the characterized basis, a thing, therefore they definitely exist.

original: de dag yod na dus kyang de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag yod na dus kyang de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: If they exist, time also exists because it is the cause of those.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary states:üîΩHere it is said:

original: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med pas /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med pas /
translated: Since emergence and destruction do not exist,üîΩnonthing and thing do not exist.

original: dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pas 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag med pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan @157a * //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pas 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag med pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan @157a * //
translated: Since nonthing and thing do not exist, emergence and destruction do not exist.üîΩTherefore the opponent‚Äôs reason, ‚Äúbecause it is a thing,‚Äù is not established.

original: tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mi 'grub bo zhes chos can dang / chos dgag pa'i brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mi 'grub bo zhes chos can dang / chos dgag pa'i brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: Thus he teaches two kinds of analysis, the refutation of the property of the subject and the property of the subject itself.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the first of those two analyses, he says:

original: gal te don dam par 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na ni de dngos po zhes brjod par yang rigs par 'gyur grang na de dag med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te don dam par 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na ni de dngos po zhes brjod par yang rigs par 'gyur grang na de dag med pas de'i phyir /
translated: If ultimately emergence and destruction existed for something, then it would be tenable to call it a thing. But since they do not exist,

original: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
translated: Without the destruction of the elements,

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: an existent thing does not occur.

original: dngos po ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is: because a thing has the nature of origination and destruction.

original: de yod pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since that is not existent, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: des ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med pas dngos po med pa'i phyir chos can ma grub pas /
analyzed: des ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med pas dngos po med pa'i phyir chos can ma grub pas /
translated: Since origination and destruction do not exist, a thing does not exist.

original: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Since the subject is not established, he demonstrates that the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is a quality of an existent thing,‚Äù is not established.

original: brtags pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtags pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the second hypothetical, he says,

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
translated: Without an existent thing,

original: 'byung dang 'jig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jig pa yod ma yin //
translated: origination and destruction do not exist.

original: rten med pa kho na'i phyir brten pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rten med pa kho na'i phyir brten pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning is: because the support itself is not established, the supported is not established.

original: dper na rtsig pa med par ri mo yod pa ma yin pa bzhin pas des ni dngos po med pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med pa'i phyir chos ma grub pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de maüîΩgrub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: dper na rtsig pa med par ri mo yod pa ma yin pa bzhin pas des ni dngos po med pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med pa'i phyir chos ma grub pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, since emergence and destruction do not exist because things do not exist, the reason ‚Äúbecause things are phenomena‚Äù is not established.üîΩOr, this is another path of refutation: ‚ÄúBecause things are phenomena,‚Äù this reason is not established.

original: yang na dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan 'di yang yod do zhes bya bas ni dngos po med pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad pa dang / dngos po yod pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mi 'grub bo zhes sun dbyung ba'i lam rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: yang na dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan 'di yang yod do zhes bya bas ni dngos po med pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad pa dang / dngos po yod pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mi 'grub bo zhes sun dbyung ba'i lam rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: This shows two paths of refutation: Emergence and destruction are untenable in the absence of things, and emergence and destruction are untenable in the presence of things. Therefore the reason ‚Äúbecause things are phenomena‚Äù is not established.

original: de la re zhig sun dbyung ba'i lam dang po bstan pa'i phyir de la re zhig smra ba gang dag dngos po yod par gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par ston pa de dag gi phyirüîΩ'di bshad de /üîΩstong la 'byung dang 'jig pa dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig sun dbyung ba'i lam dang po bstan pa'i phyir de la re zhig smra ba gang dag dngos po yod par gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par ston pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de / stong la 'byung dang 'jig pa dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: With respect to emptiness, arising andüîΩcessation are not tenable.

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te stong pa la 'byung ba dang @157b 'jig pa dag mi 'thad de dmigs su med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te stong pa la 'byung ba dang @157b 'jig pa dag mi 'thad de dmigs su med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Because they are undermined by inference. He demonstrates that arising and cessation are not tenable with respect to emptiness because they are not observed, just like, for example, a sky flower.

original: sun dbyung ba'i lam gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sun dbyung ba'i lam gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the second path of refutation, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smra ba gang dag dngos po yod par gyur ba ngo bo nyid mi stong pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par ston pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: smra ba gang dag dngos po yod par gyur ba ngo bo nyid mi stong pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par ston pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: With respect to non-emptiness, arising andüîΩcessation are not tenable.

original: mi stong pa la'ang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi stong pa la'ang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, emergence and destruction are not tenable for that which is not empty.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ba med pa ni de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ba med pa ni de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That which is not empty does not exist by way of its own intrinsic reality because it is not endowed with those and because it is undermined by inference.

original: mi stong pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi stong pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad de /
translated: Emergence and destruction are not tenable for that which is not empty.

original: de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no zhes bstan te /
translated: Because it is not endowed with those, it is like nirvana.üîΩTherefore, the error of the meaning of the reason not being established and the error of the meaning of the reason contradicting itself would ensue.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon dang don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon dang don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pas 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba de'i don dam par ni ma grub la kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba'i skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pas 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba de'i don dam par ni ma grub la kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba'i skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The root of the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of emergence and destruction,‚Äù is not established ultimately, and the error of contradiction occurs conventionally.

original: yang na sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: yang na sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
translated: Or, there is another path of refutation.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: Emergence and destruction would be the same or different.

original: de la gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad de zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan ston te /
analyzed: de la gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad de zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúNeither is tenable‚Äù teaches another path of refutation of the reason stated by the opponent, ‚Äúbecause it is a quality of an existent thing.‚Äù

original: des kyang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag dngos po'i chos yin na gcig pa nyid dam /
analyzed: des kyang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag dngos po'i chos yin na gcig pa nyid dam /
translated: If emergence and destruction are qualities of an existent thing, they would be the same or different.

original: gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: But if they were different, neither would be tenable.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate the first hypothesis, he says:

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Emergence and destruction are not tenable as identical.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyir dper na shes pa dang / mi shes pa dag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyir dper na shes pa dang / mi shes pa dag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: Because they are incompatible, like, for example, consciousness and ignorance.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Here, the subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be connected in order, respectively.

original: dper na shes pa dang mi shes pa dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do /
analyzed: dper na shes pa dang mi shes pa dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do /
translated: For example, just as consciousness and ignorance are not tenable as identical because they are incompatible, so too emergence and destruction are not tenable as identical because they are incompatible.

original: @158a * // brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: @158a * // brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the second hypothesis, he says:

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: It is also untenable that emergence and destruction are different.

original: dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they are based on one thing, like the intrinsic reality of any one of them.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang ; dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang ; dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na 'byung ba'am /
translated: And in this regard, the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, it is untenable that any one of emergence or destruction is different, because they are based on one thing.

original: 'jig pa gang yang rung ba gcig gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag kyang dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'jig pa gang yang rung ba gcig gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag kyang dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: In the same way, it is untenable that emergence and destruction are different, because they are based on one thing.

original: des kyang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: des kyang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Also, the meaning of the reason is not established, and the fault of the meaning being contradictory is the same, so this is a summary and the result of valid knowledge.

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba de'i don dam par ni ma grub la /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba de'i don dam par ni ma grub la /
translated: Because the reason of the opponent is a quality of an existent thing, since that is not established, the root of the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of emergence and destruction,‚Äù is not established ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba'i skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //üîΩci ste brgyal /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba'i skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to // ci ste brgyal /
translated: And, ‚Äúthe fault of the meaning being contradictory is the same,‚Äù is taught conventionally.

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúEmergence and destruction are seen,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas pha rol po dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshigs yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas pha rol po dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshigs yin te /
translated: This is a verse of the MƒÅdhyamika anticipating the qualms of the opponent.

original: ci ste brgyal khyed 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag da ltar mngon sum du mthong na ci'i phyir med snyam du sems na'o //
analyzed: ci ste brgyal khyed 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag da ltar mngon sum du mthong na ci'i phyir med snyam du sems na'o //
translated: But if you think that since you see origination and destruction right now, they must exist,

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis byis pa phal pa'i blos mthong ba ni bden gyi /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis byis pa phal pa'i blos mthong ba ni bden gyi /
translated: the author of the commentary himself says, ‚ÄúThe seeing of ordinary people is true,

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: but not ultimately,

original: don dam par 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / ma byung ba la 'jig pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: don dam par 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / ma byung ba la 'jig pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because ultimately origination is refuted and destruction is impossible in what has not originated.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gti mug gnyid kyis mthong ba yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gti mug gnyid kyis mthong ba yin //
translated: Therefore, origination and destruction are seen by the sleep of delusion.

original: zhes bya ba ni byis pa phal pa'i blos mthong ba nyid du bstan to //üîΩci ste de dag gi gti mug gis mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byis pa phal pa'i blos mthong ba nyid du bstan to // ci ste de dag gi gti mug gis mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: This teaches that origination and destruction are seen by the mind of ordinary people.üîΩBut if you think, ‚ÄúThey are seen by the delusion of ordinary people, but not ultimately,‚ÄùüîΩhow do you know that?

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ji ltar nges par shes she na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ji ltar nges par shes she na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a question from the opponent.

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary explains:

original: de'i lan btab zin mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i lan btab zin mod kyi /
translated: The response to that has already been given.

original: gal te de tsam gyis kyang yongs su mi mgu na yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de tsam gyis kyang yongs su mi mgu na yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: If one is not satisfied with just that, then I will explain.

original: 'di ltar don dam par 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dngos po la brten pa zhig yod na @158b mthong bar yang 'gyur grang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dngos po la brten pa zhig yod na @158b mthong bar yang 'gyur grang ste /
translated: Thus, if ultimately emergence and destruction were to exist in dependence on things, then they would be seen.

original: de la dngos po dngos po las skye ba'am /üîΩdngos po med pa dngos po las skye ba'am /
analyzed: de la dngos po dngos po las skye ba'am / dngos po med pa dngos po las skye ba'am /
translated: In that regard, would things arise from things,üîΩwould things arise from nonthings,üîΩwould things arise from nonthings,

original: dngos po dngos po med pa las skye ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po dngos po med pa las skye ba'am /
translated: or would nonthings arise from nonthings?

original: dngos po med pa dngos po med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na zhes bya bas skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mu bzhis gcig la gcig skye ba med pas de dag mthong ba ni gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dngos po med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na zhes bya bas skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mu bzhis gcig la gcig skye ba med pas de dag mthong ba ni gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: Since arising and destruction do not arise from each other through the four possibilities, seeing them is seeing them through delusion,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes ston to //üîΩde la re zhig mu dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes ston to // de la re zhig mu dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but not ultimately.üîΩIn that regard, in order to demonstrate that the first possibility is untenable,

original: de la re zhig don dam par /
analyzed: de la re zhig don dam par /
translated: in that regard, first,

original: dngos po dngos las mi skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po dngos las mi skye ste /
translated: A thing does not arise from a thing,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is a thing, like a thing that has already arisen.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na skyes zin pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir dngos po las mi skye ba de bzhin du dngos po yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir dngos po las mi skye'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes zin pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir dngos po las mi skye ba de bzhin du dngos po yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir dngos po las mi skye'o //
translated: For example, just as a thing that has already arisen does not arise from a thing because it is a thing, so too a thing does not arise from a thing because it is a thing.

original: mu gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the opponent‚Äôs position that the second possibility is untenable, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: ci ste skye ba'i snga rol na ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba'i snga rol na ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if it does not exist prior to arising,

original: phyis 'byung ba'i ming gi dngos po zhes bya'o zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i ming gi dngos po zhes bya'o zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is called a nonthing that later appears.

original: da ni pha rol dag na re dngos po ni skye ba'i snga rol na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni pha rol dag na re dngos po ni skye ba'i snga rol na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Now opponents say that a thing does not exist prior to arising.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i ming gi dngos po zhes brjod pas des na khyod kyi sgrub pa snga ma'i dpe skyes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i ming gi dngos po zhes brjod pas des na khyod kyi sgrub pa snga ma'i dpe skyes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Since the thing that is the later name non-existent is expressed, your former proof, like a born man, is not correct.

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary himself says:

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: Even so,

original: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
translated: a non-thing does not arise from a thing.

original: myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa 'bru'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las mi skye ste /
analyzed: myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa 'bru'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las mi skye ste /
translated: The non-existence of a thing called a sprout does not arise from a thing characterized by a seed,

original: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because it does not exist prior to arising,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: or because it is inexpressible, for example, like that which is other than that.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proving property, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa de las gzhan pa bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa ni skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ram /üîΩyod pa dang med par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'bru'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las mi skye ba de bzhin du myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa yang skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir @159a * //
analyzed: dper na myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa de las gzhan pa bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa ni skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ram / yod pa dang med par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'bru'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las mi skye ba de bzhin du myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa yang skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir @159a * //
translated: For example, a non-thing called a sprout does not arise from a thing characterized by a seed, because it does not exist prior to arising,üîΩor because it cannot be said to exist or not exist.üîΩSimilarly, a non-thing called a sprout does not arise from a thing characterized by a seed, because it does not exist prior to arising,

original: ram ; yod pa dang / med par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'bru'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la mi skye'o //
analyzed: ram ; yod pa dang / med par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'bru'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la mi skye'o //
translated: or because it cannot be said to exist or not exist.

original: yang na / dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
analyzed: yang na / dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
translated: A non-thing does not arise from a thing.

original: zhes bya ba ni med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mu gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mu gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another inference that demonstrates the untenability of the second possibility, because it does not exist, like the horn of an ass.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva ni med pa'i phyir dngos po las mi skye ba de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang med pa'i phyir dngos po las mi skye'o //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva ni med pa'i phyir dngos po las mi skye ba de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang med pa'i phyir dngos po las mi skye'o //
translated: For example, since the rabbit‚Äôs horns do not exist, they do not arise from things. In the same way, since nonthings do not exist, they do not arise from things.

original: ci ste bum pa med pa med bzhin du tho bas bsnun pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba des ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pas dngos po las mi skye ste /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa med pa med bzhin du tho bas bsnun pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba des ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pas dngos po las mi skye ste /
translated: But if a non-vase arises from the striking of a hammer, even though it does not exist, then your reason is not established.

original: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs response to the MƒÅdhyamika‚Äôs argument that things do not arise from things because they do not exist, like the horns of a rabbit. This is a critique of the reason, saying that it is not established.

original: de dag na re 'di na bum pa zhig nas med pa ni snga na dngos po med pa nyid yin yang phyis tho bas bsnun pa'i dngos po las 'byung bar 'gyur ba mthong bas des na ci re zhig med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhinüîΩdu dngos po med pa dngos po las mi skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de dag na re 'di na bum pa zhig nas med pa ni snga na dngos po med pa nyid yin yang phyis tho bas bsnun pa'i dngos po las 'byung bar 'gyur ba mthong bas des na ci re zhig med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin du dngos po med pa dngos po las mi skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, is it that a nonthing does not arise from a thing because it does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit?üîΩOr is it that a nonthing arises from a thing because it does not exist, like the thing that is destroyed by a hammer?

original: 'on te med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa med pa tho bas bsnun pa'i dngos po las 'byung ba bzhin du dngos po med pa dngos po las skye bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma'i gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'on te med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa med pa tho bas bsnun pa'i dngos po las 'byung ba bzhin du dngos po med pa dngos po las skye bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma'i gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is not ascertained, the Madhyamaka reason is not suitable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is not ascertained.

original: bum pa skye ba dang 'gag pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyang phyogs su byas pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bum pa skye ba dang 'gag pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyang phyogs su byas pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the arising and ceasing of a pot is refuted, and because that very example is not a position, there is no counter-position.

original: don dam par bum pa skye ba dang 'gag pa bkag pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dpe med pa dang / dbu ma pas bum pa med par tho bas bsnun pa'i dngos po las 'byung ba de nyid kyang phyogs su byas pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par bum pa skye ba dang 'gag pa bkag pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dpe med pa dang / dbu ma pas bum pa med par tho bas bsnun pa'i dngos po las 'byung ba de nyid kyang phyogs su byas pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because the arising and ceasing of a pot is refuted ultimately, the example of the opponent does not exist, and because the Madhyamika‚Äôs example of a pot being destroyed by a hammer is not a position, there is no counter-position. Therefore the reason of the Madhyamika is not indeterminate.

original: mu gsum pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin du /
analyzed: mu gsum pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / de bzhin du /
translated: To demonstrate that the third possibility is untenable,üîΩhe says:

original: dngos po dngos med mi skye ste //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med mi skye ste //
translated: Likewise, a thing does not arise from a non-thing,

original: skyon bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skyon bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because the error has been demonstrated.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon @159b bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon @159b bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error of the incompatibility of the negation of a thing and a non-thing has been demonstrated.

original: yang de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate another inference, he says,

original: yang na dngos po med pa ni dngos po'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na dngos po med pa ni dngos po'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Or, a non-thing is not the cause of a thing,

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is non-arisen, like the horn of an ass.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva ni ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva ni ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: For example, just as the horn of an ass is not the cause of a thing because it is non-arisen, in the same way, a non-thing is not the cause of a thing because it is non-arisen.

original: mu bzhi pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the fourth alternative is untenable, he says,

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: dngos med dngos med mi skye'o ;
analyzed: dngos med dngos med mi skye'o ;
translated: A non-thing does not arise from a non-thing.

original: / rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: / rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is undermined by inference and by what is commonly acknowledged.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa las mi skye ste ri bong gi rva mo gsham gyi bu las mi skye ba bzhin nam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa las mi skye ste ri bong gi rva mo gsham gyi bu las mi skye ba bzhin nam /
translated: A nonthing does not arise from a nonthing, just as a rabbit‚Äôs horns do not arise from the horns of a donkey.

original: nam mkha'i me tog rus sbal gyi spu las mi skye bar grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog rus sbal gyi spu las mi skye bar grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A non-entity does not arise from a non-entity, just as a rabbit‚Äôs horns do not arise from the barren woman‚Äôs son, or just as it is well known that sky-flowers do not arise from the hair of a tortoise.

original: de ltar skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mu bzhis gcig la gcig skye ba med pas de dag mthong ba ni gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mu bzhis gcig la gcig skye ba med pas de dag mthong ba ni gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin gyi /
