translated: Thus, since arising and destruction are not mutually arisen in any of the four alternatives, their perception is a perception due to delusion alone.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //üîΩgzhan yang bdag las sam /üîΩgzhan las sam /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bstan to // gzhan yang bdag las sam / gzhan las sam /
translated: It is not ultimately.üîΩMoreover, if becoming and destruction exist,

original: gnyi ga las skye bar 'gyur grang na zhes bya bas ni gzhan yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa bzhi yod na de bdag las sam /
analyzed: gnyi ga las skye bar 'gyur grang na zhes bya bas ni gzhan yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa bzhi yod na de bdag las sam /
translated: do they arise from themselves,

original: gzhan las sam /
analyzed: gzhan las sam /
translated: from another, or from both?

original: gnyi ga las skye bar 'gyur grang na de dag rnam pa thams cad las skye bar mi 'thad pas 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: gnyi ga las skye bar 'gyur grang na de dag rnam pa thams cad las skye bar mi 'thad pas 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: If becoming and destruction exist, do they arise from themselves, from another, or from both? Since their arising in any way is untenable, becoming and destruction do not exist.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: de la yang ;
analyzed: de la yang ;
translated: In that regard,

original: dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
analyzed: dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
translated: Things do not arise from themselves,

original: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
translated: Nor do they arise from another.üîΩArising from both is also illogical,

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ni //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ni //
translated: And arising causelessly is illogical.

original: yod min / ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: yod min / ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de ltar dang po nyid du rgyas par bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar dang po nyid du rgyas par bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat has already been extensively explained.‚Äù

original: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: Previously, in the chapter on conditions,

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: It is not from itself, nor from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //üîΩdngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Nor from both, nor causelessly.üîΩNowhere do any things

original: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Ever arise.

original: zhes smos pas bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes smos pas bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, it has already been explained.üîΩWell then, tell us how they arise!

original: 'o na ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba de smros shig / skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba de smros shig / skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthey do not arise‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: de'i phyir de ltar @160a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar @160a * //
translated: Therefore, in that way,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The result of valid knowledge is the statement, ‚ÄúThe root of the reason is not established because emergence and destruction do not exist.‚Äù

original: de ltar don dam par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir sngar rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol po dag gis don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir sngar rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol po dag gis don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, because ultimately emergence and destruction do not exist, in the first chapter the opponent said, ‚ÄúTime definitely exists ultimately.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of emergence and destruction.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: That which does not exist is not the cause of emergence and destruction,

original: dper na sbrul gyi rkang pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbrul gyi rkang pa bzhin no //
translated: like the foot of a snake.

original: dus ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir dus ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin pas des na de gsal ba yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub bo zhes smras pa'i
analyzed: dus ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir dus ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin pas des na de gsal ba yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub bo zhes smras pa'i
translated: Time is the cause of emergence and destruction that follow time. Therefore time definitely exists ultimately. Therefore, because it is clear that the reason is established, the object of assertion is established.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i don ma grub pa nyid yin pas bstan bcos mdzad pas sngar don dam par dus ngo bo nyid med pas de gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i don ma grub pa nyid yin pas bstan bcos mdzad pas sngar don dam par dus ngo bo nyid med pas de gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams
translated: Since the meaning of the root of the reason is not established, the author of the treatise says, ‚ÄúThe reason ‚Äòbecause it is the cause that illuminates it‚Äô is not established, because ultimately time does not intrinsically exist.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub pa nyid do /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu dgu pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub pa nyid do / // / bam po drug cu dgu pa /
translated: Since the root of the reason is not established, the treatise master has already established the intended meaning of the thesis, ‚ÄúUltimately, internal things do not arise, because they are devoid of intrinsic reality,‚Äù since the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is the cause that illuminates it,‚Äù is not established.üîΩNow, in order to demonstrate the error that if one accepts that things ultimately exist by their intrinsic reality, as the opponent wishes, then the views of eternalism and nihilism would follow, the text says:

original: da ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par khas blangs na rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir don dam par ni dngos po yod par khas blangs na /
analyzed: da ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par khas blangs na rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir don dam par ni dngos po yod par khas blangs na /
translated: If one accepts that things ultimately exist,

original: rtag pa dang chad par lta bar ni thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad par lta bar ni thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the views of eternalism and nihilism would follow.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dngos de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos de ni /
translated: Because that thing

original: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: would be both permanent and impermanent.

original: de la rtag pa ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la rtag pa ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it is permanent, then it follows it is permanent because it does not disintegrate.

original: mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa'i phyir chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa'i phyir chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it is impermanent, then it follows it is annihilated because it disintegrates.

original: 'di ltar dngos po ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas de khas blangs na 'jig pa dang / mi 'jig par lta ba'i sgo nas rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas de khas blangs na 'jig pa dang / mi 'jig par lta ba'i sgo nas rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since things have the nature of being both permanent and impermanent, if you accept that, it follows that you would have a view of annihilation and a view of eternalism in terms of disintegration and nondisintegration.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
translated: Even though you accept that things exist,

original: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
translated: you do not have annihilation or eternalism.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar / 'bras bu'i rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / 'bras bu'i rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the continuum of the arising and disintegration of the cause and effect is existence.

original: de la rgyu 'gag bzhin pa la 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir chad par mi @160b 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la rgyu 'gag bzhin pa la 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir chad par mi @160b 'gyur la /
translated: In that regard, because the effect arises when the cause is in the process of cessation, there is no annihilation.

original: 'bras bu skyes pa ni rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir rtag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa ni rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir rtag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The opponent says: Even though we accept that things exist, it is not logical to conclude that we are proponents of eternalism or nihilism.

original: dngos por lta ba yod na srid pa 'thad de /
analyzed: dngos por lta ba yod na srid pa 'thad de /
translated: If one has the view that things exist, then existence is tenable.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu 'byung ba dang rgyu 'jig pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni srid pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu 'byung ba dang rgyu 'jig pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni srid pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, the cause of the arising of the effect and the cause of the cessation of the cause are existence.

original: de la gang gi phyir rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtag pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur la gang gi phyir rgyu 'gag bzhin pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtag pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur la gang gi phyir rgyu 'gag bzhin pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin
translated: Because the cause ceases, the error of eternalism does not follow. Because the effect arises from the cause that is in the process of ceasing, the error of nihilism does not follow.

original: no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: gal te 'bras rgyu'i 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'bras rgyu'i 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na //
translated: If the continuum of the arising and ceasing of cause and effect were existence,

original: 'jig la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
translated: then because arising does not exist for that which is ceasing,

original: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: the view of annihilation would follow for the cause.

original: zad pa la skye ba med pa'i phyir sa bon tshig pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zad pa la skye ba med pa'i phyir sa bon tshig pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the statement is that because arising does not exist for that which is ceasing, it is like a burned seed.

original: de lta na 'jig pa ni 'gags pa zad pa yin pas de la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyu chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: de lta na 'jig pa ni 'gags pa zad pa yin pas de la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyu chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: Thus it demonstrates that if destruction is cessation, then because arising does not exist for that which is ceasing, the view of annihilation would follow for the cause.

original: de la rgyu 'jig pa ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: de la rgyu 'jig pa ni chos can yin la /
translated: In this context, the cause that is destroyed is the subject.

original: chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: The view of annihilation that would follow is the predicate of the probandum.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: Because arising does not exist is the proving property.

original: sa bon tshig pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: sa bon tshig pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
translated: Like a burned seed is the example.

original: dper na sa bon tshig pa dngos por khas blangs na de la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rgyu 'jig pa yang dngos por khas blangs na de la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir chad par lta bar
analyzed: dper na sa bon tshig pa dngos por khas blangs na de la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rgyu 'jig pa yang dngos por khas blangs na de la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir chad par lta bar
translated: Likewise, if the disintegration of the cause is asserted to be a thing, then because it would not arise again, it would follow that the view of annihilation would ensue.

original: thal bar 'gyur ro zhes mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ro zhes mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: This is the intention of the author of the s≈´tra.

original: ji ste sngar /
analyzed: ji ste sngar /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúPreviously,üîΩyou accepted the statement,

original: gang la brten te gang byung ba //üîΩde ni re zhig de nyid yin //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang byung ba // de ni re zhig de nyid yin //
translated: ‚ÄòWhatever arises in dependence on another,üîΩthat is not that

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin la //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin la //
translated: nor is it different

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //üîΩzhes khas blangs la /
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin // zhes khas blangs la /
translated: therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal,‚ÄôüîΩand now you are not correct to fault us with the consequence of eternalism and nihilism,‚Äù

original: da ni rtag pa dang chad par thal bar skyon 'dogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: da ni rtag pa dang chad par thal bar skyon 'dogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re /
translated: then the response to that is as follows:

original: khyed dbu ma pas sngar bdag dang chos brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas sngar bdag dang chos brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: You Proponents of Entity say, ‚ÄúPreviously, you Followers of the Middle Way said,üîΩ‚ÄòWhatever arises in dependence on another,üîΩthat is not thatüîΩnor is it different

original: rtag pa dang chad pa ma yin par sgrub pa de skad khas blangs la /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa ma yin par sgrub pa de skad khas blangs la /
translated: therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.‚Äô

original: da ni kho bo cag la rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bar skyon 'dogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //üîΩde skad @161a * //
analyzed: da ni kho bo cag la rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bar skyon 'dogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no // de skad @161a * //
translated: Now, the response to the objection that we would incur the views of eternalism and nihilism is as follows.

original: ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The author of the commentary responds to this statement:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good.

original: de ni tha snyad pa'i de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni chad pa ma yin pa dang rtag pa ma yin par bstan pa la /
analyzed: de ni tha snyad pa'i de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni chad pa ma yin pa dang rtag pa ma yin par bstan pa la /
translated: The definition of conventional reality is taught to be neither annihilation nor permanence.

original: don dam pa'i bden par ni skye ba med pa kho na'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bas de snying po ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden par ni skye ba med pa kho na'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bas de snying po ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But since ultimate reality is only non-arisen, it is not tenable that the error of eternalism or nihilism would ensue.

original: kho bo cag gi sngar /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi sngar /
translated: We have already said:

original: gang la brten nas gang byung ba //üîΩre zhig de ni de nyid min //
analyzed: gang la brten nas gang byung ba // re zhig de ni de nyid min //
translated: That which arises in dependence on somethingüîΩis not that,

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
translated: and it is not different from that.

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: zhes bstan pa der ni kun rdzob pa'i de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni chad pa ma yin pa dang rtag pa ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa der ni kun rdzob pa'i de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni chad pa ma yin pa dang rtag pa ma yin par bstan te /
translated: In that teaching, the characteristic of conventional reality is shown to be neither annihilation nor permanence.

original: de yang dngos por mi lta ba la kun rdzob tu yang /
analyzed: de yang dngos por mi lta ba la kun rdzob tu yang /
translated: Moreover, it is shown that for one who does not view things as real, even conventionally,

original: rtag pa dang chad par lta par thal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad par lta par thal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: the views of annihilation and permanence do not follow.

original: kho bo cag gis sngar /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis sngar /
translated: We have already taught:üîΩNot known from elsewhere, peaceful,

original: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: not fabricated by mental fabrications,

original: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
analyzed: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
translated: without conceptualization, not a different object,

original: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: that is the characteristic of reality.

original: zhes bstan pa de yang don dam par de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni skye ba med pa kho na'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bar ston te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa de yang don dam par de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni skye ba med pa kho na'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bar ston te /
translated: That teaching shows that the characteristic of reality in the ultimate sense is only non-arising, and therefore that the errors of permanence and annihilation do not arise.

original: de yang dngos por mi lta ba la don dam par yang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dngos por mi lta ba la don dam par yang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is shown that for one who does not view things as real, even in the ultimate sense, the views of permanence and annihilation do not follow.

original: khyed ni dngos por lta ba yin pas dngos por khas blangs na kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyi gar yang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas khyed kyi klan ka de ni snying po ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed ni dngos por lta ba yin pas dngos por khas blangs na kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyi gar yang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas khyed kyi klan ka de ni snying po ma yin no //
translated: Since you view things as real, if you accept things, then it follows that you would have the views of eternalism and nihilism in both the conventional and the ultimate. Therefore your criticism is pointless.

original: grangs can dag na re /
analyzed: grangs can dag na re /
translated: The Samkhyas say:

original: rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since the cause itself transforms into the effect, even though we accept that things exist, we do not incur the error of eternalism or nihilism.

original: grangs can yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: grangs can yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba dag na re /
translated: The Samkhyas, who advocate transformation, say:

original: dper na 'o ma nyid zho'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas 'o ma nyid zho ma yin pas rtag pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na 'o ma nyid zho'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas 'o ma nyid zho ma yin pas rtag pa yang ma yin la /
translated: For example, since milk itself transforms into yogurt, milk is not yogurt, so it is not eternal.

original: 'o ma las zho gzhan nyid ma yin pas chad pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu da dag nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o ma las zho gzhan nyid ma yin pas chad pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu da dag nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, since the cause itself transforms into the effect, cause and effect are not to be described as either the same or different.

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Thus, even though you accept that things exist, you do not incur the errors of eternalism and nihilism.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de yang @161b bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang @161b bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / de dgag pa rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / de dgag pa rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because you have no inference to demonstrate that transformation exists and because we have already extensively refuted that.

original: khyed la yongs su 'gyur ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed la yongs su 'gyur ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because you have no inference to demonstrate that transformation exists,

original: kho bo cag gas de dgag pa rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag gas de dgag pa rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: we have already extensively refuted that.

original: yongs su ma gyur pa yongs su 'gyur bar rtog na yang zhes bya bas ni rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su gyur zin pa yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bar ni grangs can dag kyang mi 'dod pas gal te 'dir grangs can dag
analyzed: yongs su ma gyur pa yongs su 'gyur bar rtog na yang zhes bya bas ni rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su gyur zin pa yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bar ni grangs can dag kyang mi 'dod pas gal te 'dir grangs can dag
translated: If you imagine that which has not transformed transforms,üîΩthen even that which has already transformed into the nature of the effect would transform into the nature of the effect.

original: rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du da dung  yongs su ma gyur pas phyis yongs su 'gyur bar rtog na de yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du da dung  yongs su ma gyur pas phyis yongs su 'gyur bar rtog na de yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: Since even the SƒÅ·πÉkhya do not assert that, if here the SƒÅ·πÉkhya imagine that that which has not yet transformed into the nature of the effect transforms later, then that is untenable.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says:

original: yongs su ma gyur pa ni yongs su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su ma gyur pa ni yongs su mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which has not transformed does not transform.üîΩBecause it has not transformed, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: yongs su ma gyur pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: yongs su ma gyur pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: This is stated because it is undermined by inference.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su ma gyur pa'i phyir yongs su mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rgyu yongs su ma gyur pa yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su ma gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su ma gyur pa'i phyir yongs su mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rgyu yongs su ma gyur pa yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su ma gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, a cause that does not transform does not become the nature of a result.

original: yongs su mi 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa des gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa des gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Since it is not tenable that a cause that does not transform becomes a result, that is also untenable.

original: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces gang gi phyir gdu bu zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan gser gyi rdzas de'i bag la zha bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtag pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces gang gi phyir gdu bu zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan gser gyi rdzas de'i bag la zha bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtag pa ma yin la /
translated: If SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say, ‚ÄúBecause the phenomenon called a bracelet is the latent state of the substance of gold, it is not permanent.

original: gang gi phyir gser de nyid las dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i chos gzhan skye ba de'i phyir chad pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gser de nyid las dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i chos gzhan skye ba de'i phyir chad pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: Because the phenomenon called a bracelet arises from that gold, it is not annihilated,‚Äù

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary on this text presents the following response from the SƒÅ·πÉkhya perspective.

original: bag la zha ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzhan ldog pa ni bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'gyur ba dgag pa bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bag la zha ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzhan ldog pa ni bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'gyur ba dgag pa bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is impossible to teach the cessation of other phenomena that are latent characteristics, and because the cessation of complete transformation has already been taught.

original: chos nges par gnas pa 'ga' yang yongs su 'gyur ba med pas de bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang de dgag pa bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nges par gnas pa 'ga' yang yongs su 'gyur ba med pas de bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang de dgag pa bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since no phenomenon that definitely endures undergoes complete transformation, it is impossible to teach that. And because the cessation of that has already been taught.

original: gzhan yang gal te dngos po ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yang @162a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dngos po ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yang @162a * //
translated: Moreover, if things existed inherently, etc.

original: gzhan yang gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar don dam par dngos po ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar don dam par dngos po ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, if things existed ultimately as the opponent believes, since an essence does not relinquish its own nature,

original: nam yang dngos po med par mi 'gyur bas de lta na yang rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: nam yang dngos po med par mi 'gyur bas de lta na yang rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: it would never become nonexistent. Thus it follows that it would be a permanent thing.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: de la / dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: de la / dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If things existed through their own intrinsic reality,

original: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It would not be tenable that they become nonthings.

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na zhes bya bar ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na zhes bya bar ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, ‚Äúif things existed through their own intrinsic reality‚Äù is the subject.

original: dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: ‚ÄúIt would not be tenable that they become nonthings‚Äù is the predicate to be proven.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they would not be empty of their own essence.

original: dper na me grang bar 'gyur ba mi rigs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ba ni /
analyzed: dper na me grang bar 'gyur ba mi rigs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ba ni /
translated: For example, it is not tenable that fire becomes cold.

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par sbyar te /
translated: The example is supplied from within the proof statement.

original: dper na me ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir grang bar 'gyur bar mi rigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na me ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir grang bar 'gyur bar mi rigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, because fire does not relinquish its own essence, it is not tenable that it becomes cold.

original: dngos po yang ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs pas des na rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po yang ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs pas des na rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if things existed through their own intrinsic reality, it would not be tenable that they become nonthings because they would not relinquish their own essence. Therefore it follows that they would be eternal.

original: da ni dngos po skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med par grub pas gang gis de ltar mthong ba la rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar skabs kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos po skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med par grub pas gang gis de ltar mthong ba la rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar skabs kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and that one should see them in that way without falling into the errors of eternalism and nihilism, it says:

original: skyes pa ni dngos po yod pa yin la zhig pa ni dngos po med pa yin pa de yang mthong bas de'i phyir dngos po ngo bo nyid med par grub ste /
analyzed: skyes pa ni dngos po yod pa yin la zhig pa ni dngos po med pa yin pa de yang mthong bas de'i phyir dngos po ngo bo nyid med par grub ste /
translated: That which arises is an existent thing, and that which ceases is a nonexistent thing. Since this is seen, therefore things are established as lacking entityness.üîΩBecause they are phenomena that arise and cease.

original: de skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: des ni dngos po ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni dngos po ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: This demonstrates that things are without entityness,

original: rang gi ngo bo yongs su gtong ba'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin pas gang gis de ltar mthong ba la rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yongs su gtong ba'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin pas gang gis de ltar mthong ba la rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan te /
translated: because they relinquish their own entity, like something else. Therefore, one should see things in this way without falling into the errors of eternalism and nihilism.

original: gzhan yang / mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
translated: Moreover: At the time of nirvana, there is no annihilation.

original: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
analyzed: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum of existence is completely pacified.

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma rkyen phyi ma med pas mi skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i lan gdab dka'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma rkyen phyi ma med pas mi skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i lan gdab dka'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The response that it is difficult to respond to the statement that it is like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, which do not arise due to the absence of subsequent conditions, is as follows.

original: gzhan yang gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar don dam par dngos po ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir chad par 'gyur ba'i lan gdab dka' bas de lta na yang chad
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar don dam par dngos po ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir chad par 'gyur ba'i lan gdab dka' bas de lta na yang chad
translated: Moreover, if things existed essentially in reality, as the opponent asserts, it would be difficult to respond to the statement that it would follow that nirvana would be nihilism because the continuum of existence would be completely pacified at the time of nirvana.

original: @162b par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston te /
analyzed: @162b par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston te /
translated: Thus, it would follow that nirvana would be nihilism.

original: de la dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na zhes bya ba ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: de la dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na zhes bya ba ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, ‚Äúif things existed essentially‚Äù is the subject.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be nihilism at the time of nirvana‚Äù is the predicate to be proven.

original: srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the continuum of existence would be completely pacified‚Äù is the reason.

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma rkyen phyi ma med pas mi skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma rkyen phyi ma med pas mi skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
translated: The example is like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, which do not arise again because there are no subsequent conditions.

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs na dper na dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma rkyen phyi ma med pas mi skye ba ni srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par 'gyur ba'i lan gdab dka'
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs na dper na dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma rkyen phyi ma med pas mi skye ba ni srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par 'gyur ba'i lan gdab dka'
translated: If one asserts that things exist, then it is difficult to respond to the consequence that at the time of nirvana, since the continuum of existence would be completely pacified, it would be annihilated, like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, which do not arise again because there are no subsequent conditions.

original: ba de bzhin du dngos po yod par khas blangs na /
analyzed: ba de bzhin du dngos po yod par khas blangs na /
translated: Likewise, if one asserts that things exist,üîΩit is difficult to respond to the consequence that at the time of nirvana, since the continuum of existence would be completely pacified, it would be annihilated, like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, which do not arise again because there are no subsequent conditions.

original: 'gags pa na srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir 'gags shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par 'gyur ba'i lan gdab dka' bas de lta na chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //üîΩci ste 'di snyam du gal te mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par gyur na gyur kyang sla ste /
analyzed: 'gags pa na srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir 'gags shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par 'gyur ba'i lan gdab dka' bas de lta na chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //üîΩci ste 'di snyam du gal te mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par gyur na gyur kyang sla ste /
translated: If one asserts that things exist, then it is difficult to respond to the consequence that at the time of nirvana, since the continuum of existence would be completely pacified, it would be annihilated, like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, which do not arise again because there are no subsequent conditions.üîΩIf one asserts that things exist, then it is difficult to respond to the consequence that at the time of nirvana, since the continuum of existence would be completely pacified, it would be annihilated, like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, which do not arise again because there are no subsequent conditions.üîΩIf one asserts that things exist, then it is difficult to respond to the consequence that at the time of nirvana, since the continuum of existence would be completely pacified, it would be annihilated, like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, which do not arise again because there are no subsequent conditions.üîΩIf one asserts that things exist, then it is difficult to respond to the consequence that at the time of nirvana, since the continuum of existence would be completely pacified, it would be annihilated, like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, which do not arise again because there are no subsequent conditions.üîΩIf one asserts that things exist, then it is difficult to respond to the consequence that at the time of nirvana, since the continuum of existence would be completely pacified, it would be annihilated, like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, which do not arise again because there are no subsequent conditions.

original: srid pa'i rgyun gyi dus na chad pa de med pas skyon med par sems na zhes bya ba ni ji ste pha rol po dag 'di snyam du 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na chad par gyur na skyon du 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun gyi dus na chad pa de med pas skyon med par sems na zhes bya ba ni ji ste pha rol po dag 'di snyam du 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na chad par gyur na skyon du 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: then this is the statement of the opponent‚Äôs position, which is as follows: Since annihilation would be an error if it occurred at the time of cyclic existence,

original: 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na chad pa'i skyon der ma gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na chad par gyur kyang gnod pa med do snyam du sems shing de skad ces zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na chad pa'i skyon der ma gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na chad par gyur kyang gnod pa med do snyam du sems shing de skad ces zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: if the error of annihilation does not occur at the time of cyclic existence, then even if annihilation occurred at the time of nirvana, there would be no problem.

original: des ni pha rol po dag dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod pas chad par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'i bsamüîΩpa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod pas chad par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'i bsam pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the thought of the opponent, who thinks that although he accepts that things exist, since there is a connection between the final mind of the present existence and the first mind of the next existence at the time of cyclic existence, there is no annihilation.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: sngar srid pa'i rgyun nyid la chad pa'i skyon bstan zin pas chad par lta ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar srid pa'i rgyun nyid la chad pa'i skyon bstan zin pas chad par lta ba'i phyir /
translated: Previously, the error of nihilism was taught in regard to the continuum of existence.

original: phyis chad pa yang thar pa'i gegs yin pas skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyis chad pa yang thar pa'i gegs yin pas skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Later, nihilism is also an obstacle to liberation. Therefore, it is not without fault.

original: srid pa'i rgyun gyi dus na chad pa de med pas skyon med do zhes bya bar sngar kho bos /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun gyi dus na chad pa de med pas skyon med do zhes bya bar sngar kho bos /
translated: Previously, I said:üîΩIf the continuum of the arising and

original: gal te / 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na //üîΩ'jig @163a * //
analyzed: gal te / 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na // 'jig @163a * //
translated: cessation of effects and causes were existence,

original: la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
translated: then, since there would be no arisingüîΩat the time of cessation,

original: rgyun ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyun ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: the continuum would be annihilated.

original: zhes bshad pas dngos po yod par lta na srid pa'i rgyun nyid la chad pa'i skyon bstan zin pas chad par lta ba'i phyir khyed la srid pa'i rgyun gyi dus na chad pa de med pa ma yin pas skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas dngos po yod par lta na srid pa'i rgyun nyid la chad pa'i skyon bstan zin pas chad par lta ba'i phyir khyed la srid pa'i rgyun gyi dus na chad pa de med pa ma yin pas skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it was explained that if one views things as existent, the error of nihilism is taught in regard to the continuum of existence, then, since you view nihilism, nihilism would not be absent at the time of the continuum of existence. Therefore, it is not without fault.

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you may say:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par gyur na gyur kyang sla ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa zer bas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par gyur na gyur kyang sla ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa zer bas /
translated: If you say that it is easy to say that it is annihilated at the time of nirvana,

original: khyed phyis chad par lta ba 'di yang thar pa'i gegs yin pas 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag bzhin du mtho ris dang byang grol mi 'thob pas skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed phyis chad par lta ba 'di yang thar pa'i gegs yin pas 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag bzhin du mtho ris dang byang grol mi 'thob pas skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: then you are still a nihilist. Since this view is an obstacle to liberation, you will not attain high status or liberation, just like the Lokayatas. Therefore, your view is not faultless.

original: ci ste de tsam gyis kyang yongs su mi mgu na gzhan yang nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar dngos po yod par khas len pa la rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon dag bstan nas /
analyzed: ci ste de tsam gyis kyang yongs su mi mgu na gzhan yang nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar dngos po yod par khas len pa la rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon dag bstan nas /
translated: If you are not satisfied with just that, then listen to this and so on, which shows that if one accepts that things exist, the error of eternalism and nihilism would follow.

original: de tsam gyis kyang pha rol po gang dag dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pas chad par mi 'gyur ro snyam du
analyzed: de tsam gyis kyang pha rol po gang dag dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pas chad par mi 'gyur ro snyam du
translated: Even with just that, some opponents think that although they accept that things exist, they do not become nihilists because the mind of the final phase of cyclic existence links with the mind of the first phase of cyclic existence.

original: sems pa de dag yongs su mi mgu na 'dir dngos po yod par khas len pa dag la 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi gnas skabs na da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pas de
analyzed: sems pa de dag yongs su mi mgu na 'dir dngos po yod par khas len pa dag la 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi gnas skabs na da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pas de
translated: If those minds are not completely satisfied, then those who assert that things exist here would have the fault of the view of annihilation, because in the context of the continuum of cyclic existence, the mind at the end of the present existence would not link with the mind at the beginning of the next existence.

original: dag la chad par lta ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba dang / dbu ma pa lta bu gang dag dngos po ngo bo nyid med par lta ba dag la 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po ni sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba sgyu ma tsam du yodüîΩpas chad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dag la chad par lta ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba dang / dbu ma pa lta bu gang dag dngos po ngo bo nyid med par lta ba dag la 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po ni sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba sgyu ma tsam du yod pas chad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Those who view things as essenceless, like the Followers of the Middle Way, would not have the fault of the view of annihilation, because in the context of cyclic existence, the mind at the end of the present existence and the mind at the beginning of the next existence would be linked in a merely illusory way.

original: don dam par ni de dag ngo bo nyid med pas nying mtshams sbyor ba yang med la /
analyzed: don dam par ni de dag ngo bo nyid med pas nying mtshams sbyor ba yang med la /
translated: However, ultimately, since those minds are essenceless, they do not link, and

original: rtag par lta bar 'gyur ba yang med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: rtag par lta bar 'gyur ba yang med do zhes ston to //
translated: there is no view of permanence either.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, the text says:

original: 'di la da ltar gyi srid pa'i mjug gi srid pa ni srid pa tha ma zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'di la da ltar gyi srid pa'i mjug gi srid pa ni srid pa tha ma zhes bya ba /
translated: Here, the existence at the end of the present existence is called the final existence.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa'i sems pa skye ba dang po ni srid pa dang po yin pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa'i sems pa skye ba dang po ni srid pa dang po yin pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The first moment of the intention to exist in the future is the first existence.

original: des ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma pa'i sems dang / ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bstan nas da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gag pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / 'gag bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems @163b dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i mu rnam pa gsum gyis dngos po yod par khas len pa rnams la chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma pa'i sems dang / ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bstan nas da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gag pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / 'gag bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems @163b dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i mu rnam pa gsum gyis dngos po yod par khas len pa rnams la chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, since the characteristic of the final mind of the present existence and the first mind of the future existence are taught, it follows that those who assert the existence of things would have the view of annihilation through the three modes of the cessation of the final mind of the present existence, the noncessation of the first mind of the future existence, and the noncessation of the first mind of the future existence that is in the process of ceasing.

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: This teaches that the error of the views of eternalism and nihilism does not apply to those who propound that things lack intrinsic reality.

original: de re zhig mu dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de re zhig mu dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the first mode, he says:

original: de la / tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: de la / tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
translated: The first line of the root verse states:

original: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
translated: The final state of existence would not connect to the first.

original: zhes bya ba'i dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the statement of the thesis.

original: de ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa bstan te /
analyzed: de ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the statement of the thesis that the cessation of the mind of the final state of existence does not link with the first state of existence.

original: de ni phyogs yin no ;
analyzed: de ni phyogs yin no ;
translated: This is the position.üîΩThe second line of the root verse states:üîΩA phenomenon that has ceased does not link with another.

original: /'gags pa'i chos ni 'gags pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni 'gags pa nyid yin par bstan te
analyzed: /'gags pa'i chos ni 'gags pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni 'gags pa nyid yin par bstan te
translated: This teaches the reason that a phenomenon that has ceased does not link with another.

original: de ni phyogs kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyogs kyi chos yin no //
translated: This is the property of the position.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Therefore, ultimately the final state of an existent does not link with the first moment of the next life because it has ceased.üîΩ

original: srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ultimately the final state of existence that has ceased does not link with the first moment of existence in the future because it has ceased or because it is the final state of existence.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma 'gags pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma 'gags pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the final state of existence of an arhat that has ceased.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: These are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason and the example.üîΩFor example, the final state of existence of an arhat that has ceased does not link with the first moment of existence in the future because it has ceased or because it is the final state of existence.

original: srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa de bzhin du da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yang 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa de bzhin du da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yang 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: In the same way, the final state of existence that has ceased in the present does not link with the first moment of existence in the future because it has ceased or because it is the final state of existence.

original: srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
translated: Because it is the final existence, it does not link with the first existence of the future.

original: mu gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the former position that was taught in the second possibility,

original: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar dam bcas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar dam bcas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: if you assert that the final existence that has ceased links with the first existence of the future, there is no error.

original: de ni pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: de ni pha rol po dag na re /
translated: This is because the opponent says:

original: kho bo cag gi da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar dam bcas pa'i phyir /üîΩkhyed kyi sgrub pa snga ma'i skyon @164a * //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar dam bcas pa'i phyir / khyed kyi sgrub pa snga ma'i skyon @164a * //
translated: We assert that the mind of the present final existence that has not ceased links with the mind of the first existence of the future.

original: de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Therefore the error of the former proof does not exist in our position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says here:

original: ma 'gags pa yang rgyu srid pa tha ma ma nyams pa'i phyir skyon 'og nas 'byung ba lta bur 'gyur bas skyon med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa yang rgyu srid pa tha ma ma nyams pa'i phyir skyon 'og nas 'byung ba lta bur 'gyur bas skyon med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the cause, the final existence, would not cease, the error that will be stated below would ensue.

original: rgyu ma 'gags par 'bras bu skye mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'og mas gnod par 'gyur bas skyon med pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rgyu ma 'gags par 'bras bu skye mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'og mas gnod par 'gyur bas skyon med pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Since it is impossible for a result to arise when its cause has not ceased, the subsequent syllogism will show that this is also not free of error.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that very point, he says:

original: 'di ltar / tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa //
translated: Thus, the final moment of consciousness would not cease,

original: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
translated: and it would not link with the first moment of consciousness in the next existence.

original: 'dir yang de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir yang de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, he states the thesis.

original: des ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa bstan te de ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: des ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa bstan te de ni phyogs yin no //
translated: He demonstrates the thesis that the final moment of consciousness in the present life does not cease and does not link with the first moment of consciousness in the next life. That is the position.

original: ma 'gags pa'i chos ni ma 'gags pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni ma 'gags pa nyid
analyzed: ma 'gags pa'i chos ni ma 'gags pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma'i sems ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po'i sems dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni ma 'gags pa nyid
translated: This teaches that the unceased mind of the final phase of cyclic existence is the reason that proves the non-linking of the first moment of consciousness of the next life.

original: yin par bstan te de ni phyogs kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: yin par bstan te de ni phyogs kyi chos yin no //
translated: The unceased itself is the property of the subject.

original: de'i phyir 'dir yang rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir yang rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de /
translated: Here, the inference is stated as follows: Ultimately, the ceased final phase of cyclic existence does not link with the first moment of the next life,

original: ma 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is unceased.

original: dper na da ltar gyi srid pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi srid pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, this is like the present life.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the property to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na da ltar gyi srid pa ni ma 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa de bzhin du da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yang ma 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi srid pa ni ma 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa de bzhin du da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yang ma 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, because the present existence does not cease, it does not link with the first moment of future existence.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
translated: Similarly, because the final moment of present existence does not cease, it does not link with the first moment of future existence.

original: mu gsum pa bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: mu gsum pa bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: To demonstrate the opponent‚Äôs position, which is the third possibility,

original: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the final moment of existence that is in the process of ceasing links with the first moment of existence of the next life.‚Äù

original: de ni pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: de ni pha rol po dag na re /
translated: The opponent says:

original: srid pa tha ma pa'i sems 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dag srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa'i sems 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dag srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is true that the final mind of existence does not link with the first moment of existence of the next life, whether it has ceased or not.

original: 'on @164b kyang srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gag bzhin pa nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'on @164b kyang srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gag bzhin pa nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: But the mind at the end of existence links with the next existence while it is ceasing.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the Subcommentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te //üîΩgal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te // gal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
translated: That is not good.üîΩIf the first moment

original: dang po skye bar gyur na ni //
analyzed: dang po skye bar gyur na ni //
translated: arose when the last moment was ceasing,

original: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
translated: then the one that is ceasing would be one thing

original: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: and the one arising would be another.

original: 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa dag ni tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i srid pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa dag ni tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i srid pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because that which is ceasing and that which is arising are different, they would be like two different existences.üîΩThus it is said that the error of two existences would ensue, and that is unacceptable.

original: de ltar na srid pa gnyis su thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do zhes ston te /
analyzed: de ltar na srid pa gnyis su thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do zhes ston te /
translated: The Subcommentary explains:üîΩThe subject, the one that is ceasing,üîΩthe predicate, the one that is arising,üîΩthe reason, the mind at the end of existence,

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and the example, the mind at the beginning of existence, are applied in order.

original: dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i srid pa ni tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir srid pa gnyis su 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i srid pa ni tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir srid pa gnyis su 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, since the two lives of different continua are different, there would be two lives.

original: srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang por skye ba yang tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir srid pa gnyis su 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang por skye ba yang tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir srid pa gnyis su 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Similarly, since the final life that is ceasing and the first life that is arising are different, there would be two lives.üîΩBut that is unacceptable.

original: gal te de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya bas ni /
translated: If you say that there is no error because you assert that,

original: pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re /
translated: the opponent says:

original: srid pa tha ma dang dang po gnyis tha dad pa yang yin la /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma dang dang po gnyis tha dad pa yang yin la /
translated: The final life and the first life are different,

original: nying mtshams kyang sbyor ba de ni kho bo cag 'dod pa'i phyir khyed kyis skyon btags pa de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: nying mtshams kyang sbyor ba de ni kho bo cag 'dod pa'i phyir khyed kyis skyon btags pa de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: but we do assert that they are linked. Therefore the error you attribute to us does not apply to our position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: lhas byin gyi srid pa tha ma ni lhas byin gyi srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi srid pa tha ma ni lhas byin gyi srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The final existence of Devadatta is not linked to the first existence of Devadatta because it is different from it,

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi srid pa tha ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi srid pa tha ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: just like the final existence of Yaj√±adatta.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi srid pa tha ma ni lhas byin gyi srid pa dang po de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi srid pa tha ma ni lhas byin gyi srid pa dang po de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the final existence of Yaj√±adatta is different from the first existence of Devadatta.üîΩBecause of that, the final existence of Yaj√±adatta is not linked to the first existence of Devadatta.

original: lhas byin gyi srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi srid pa tha ma yang /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi srid pa tha ma yang /
translated: In the same way, the final existence of Devadatta is different from the first existence of Devadatta.

original: lha sbyin gyi srid pa dang po de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir de gnyis nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: lha sbyin gyi srid pa dang po de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir de gnyis nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
translated: Because of that, those two are not linked.

original: gzhan yang 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dag ni 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas kyang /üîΩsngar pha rol po dag na re /üîΩsrid pa @165a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dag ni 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas kyang / sngar pha rol po dag na re / srid pa @165a * //
translated: Moreover, because it is illogical that that which has ceased and that which has not ceased are in the process of cessation,üîΩthis also teaches another reply to the opponent‚Äôs earlier statement:

original: tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do zhes zer ba'i lan gzhan bstan te /
analyzed: tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do zhes zer ba'i lan gzhan bstan te /
translated: The final moment of life connects with the first moment of life in the future while it is in the process of cessation.

original: 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa ma gtogs par 'gag bzhin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa ma gtogs par 'gag bzhin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is in the process of cessation does not exist apart from that which has ceased and that which has not ceased,

original: de la nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: de la nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
translated: there is no connection.

original: gal te 'gag bzhin pa ni 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin pa ni 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that that which is in the process of cessation is that which is about to cease,

original: pha rol po dag 'gag bzhin pa yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'gag bzhin pa yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: this is a statement that proves that which is in the process of cessation exists.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They say:

original: 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dag ma yin yang 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa yin pas de ni yod pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dag ma yin yang 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa yin pas de ni yod pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúin the process of cessation‚Äù is not that which has ceased or that which has not ceased, but it is that which is about to cease. Therefore it definitely exists.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis mi rung ste /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis mi rung ste /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of this commentary says:

original: de'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩ'gag bzhin pa 'gags pa la mngon par phyogs pa ma yin par dgag pa gong du gnas skabs thams cad du bstan zin pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa med pas de srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: de'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / 'gag bzhin pa 'gags pa la mngon par phyogs pa ma yin par dgag pa gong du gnas skabs thams cad du bstan zin pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa med pas de srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
translated: That is unacceptable because the response has already been given.üîΩBecause it has already been demonstrated above that that which is in the process of ceasing does not approach cessation, that which is in the process of ceasing does not exist and therefore it does not link with the first moment of existence.

original: de bzhin du skye bzhin pa yang skye bzhin nyid yin par mi rigs pas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gag bzhin pa mi rigs pa de bzhin du srid pa dang po'i sems skye bzhin pa yang skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang
analyzed: de bzhin du skye bzhin pa yang skye bzhin nyid yin par mi rigs pas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gag bzhin pa mi rigs pa de bzhin du srid pa dang po'i sems skye bzhin pa yang skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang
translated: Similarly, it is illogical that that which is in the process of arising is in the process of arising.

original: skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa gang yang ma yin pas yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po'i sems skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba yang med par bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa gang yang ma yin pas yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir srid pa tha ma'i sems 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po'i sems skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba yang med par bstan to //
translated: Since it is not tenable that it exists because it is not at all approaching arising, it is explained that the final mind of existence does not link with the first mind of existence that is arising or has arisen, whether it has ceased, has not ceased, or is in the process of ceasing.

original: de'i phyir / gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
translated: If that which is in the process of ceasing and that which is in the process of arising do not make mutual contact,

original: 'o na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na //
translated: how could they link?

original: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
translated: In whatever component the death state occurs,

original: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: there the birth state would also occur.

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.
