original: gcig la dus gcig tu mi mthun pa'i bdag nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: gcig la dus gcig tu mi mthun pa'i bdag nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Because it is impossible for two mutually incompatible natures to exist simultaneously in one thing.

original: de ltar gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin pa bzhin du yang pha rol po dag srid pa tha ma dang /
analyzed: de ltar gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin pa bzhin du yang pha rol po dag srid pa tha ma dang /
translated: In the same way, if the dying state of existence does not link with the arising state of existence, then the dying state of existence that has ceased, not ceased, or is in the process of ceasing would not link with the arising state of existence that is in the process of arising.

original: dang po nying mtshams sbyor zhing srid pa'i rgyun yod pas chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur @165b bar 'dod na /
analyzed: dang po nying mtshams sbyor zhing srid pa'i rgyun yod pas chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur @165b bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the dying state of existence and the arising state of existence link and the continuum of existence exists, then it follows that you would not have the view of annihilation.

original: 'o na da ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na da ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what would happen?

original: de lta na phung po gang dag kho na la 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag kho na la skye ba yang 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na phung po gang dag kho na la 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag kho na la skye ba yang 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that birth would occur in the aggregates in which death occurs.

original: 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad par sngar bstan pa las gzhan pa'i skye ba mi srid pas phung po gcig la 'chi ba dang skye ba gnyi ga 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di khas blangs
analyzed: 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad par sngar bstan pa las gzhan pa'i skye ba mi srid pas phung po gcig la 'chi ba dang skye ba gnyi ga 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di khas blangs
translated: This is because it is untenable that that which has ceased, not ceased, or is in the process of ceasing links with that which is in the process of arising. Since it is impossible for birth to occur in any other way than that which has been explained, you would have to accept that both death and birth occur in the same set of aggregates.

original: pa las 'bros khung gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa las 'bros khung gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other escape from samsara.

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable,

original: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu mi mthun pa'i bdag nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu mi mthun pa'i bdag nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for two incompatible natures to exist simultaneously in a single thing.

original: de lta bas na dngos por lta ba yod na srid pa'i rgyun yang mi 'thad pas chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos por lta ba yod na srid pa'i rgyun yang mi 'thad pas chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one has the view that things are real, the continuum of existence is untenable, and so the consequence of the view of annihilation would follow.

original: dbu ma pa la ni dngos po brten nas gdags pa ngo bo nyid stong pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang gzugs brnyan lta bu rnams la gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de med pas rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur
analyzed: dbu ma pa la ni dngos po brten nas gdags pa ngo bo nyid stong pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang gzugs brnyan lta bu rnams la gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de med pas rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur
translated: But for the Madhyamikas, who believe that things are dependently originated, empty of intrinsic reality, like illusions, mirages, and reflections, there is no such thing as sameness or difference, and so the consequence of the views of eternalism and annihilationism does not follow.

original: ro zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: ro zhes bstan to ;
translated: This is the point.

original: / yang na gang dag 'di skad ces srid pa tha ma srid pa dang pho dang 'di ltar nying mtshams sbyor ro zhes brjod par mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: / yang na gang dag 'di skad ces srid pa tha ma srid pa dang pho dang 'di ltar nying mtshams sbyor ro zhes brjod par mi nus mod kyi /
translated: Or else, it is said that one cannot say that the final existence is connected with the prior existence, or that the prior existence is connected with the final existence.

original: 'on kyang re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba mthong bas de yang gang las rigs par 'gyur ba de las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba mthong bas de yang gang las rigs par 'gyur ba de las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained for them.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na pha rol po gang dag 'di skad ces srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do zhes bya ba des kho bo cag la ci bya /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na pha rol po gang dag 'di skad ces srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do zhes bya ba des kho bo cag la ci bya /
translated: Or, in another way, what does it matter to us if the last moment of existence ceases, does not cease, or is in the process of ceasing, since it does not link with the first moment of existence?

original: yod ni re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba ni yod de /
analyzed: yod ni re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba ni yod de /
translated: But the arising of the first moment of existence does exist.

original: de yang gang las rigs par 'gyur ba de las 'byung bar 'gyur bas des na srid pa'i rgyun yang 'thad pas dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: de yang gang las rigs par 'gyur ba de las 'byung bar 'gyur bas des na srid pa'i rgyun yang 'thad pas dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir /
translated: Since it will arise from whatever is logical, the continuum of existence is tenable. Therefore, even though we accept that things exist, it does not follow that we fall into the errors of eternalism and nihilism.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: This is explained for them by the author of the treatise.

original: gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //üîΩphung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na // phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
translated: Do not make mutual contact,üîΩThen in what appropriated

original: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Would birth occur?

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma 'di bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma 'di bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This earlier verse is explained by the following.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,üîΩIt is untenable that the final existenceüîΩThat is ceasing or has ceasedüîΩOr that is in the process of ceasing

original: srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang // ma 'gags pa dag srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad @166a * //üîΩdo zhes ni bstan zin to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang // ma 'gags pa dag srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad @166a * // do zhes ni bstan zin to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Would link with the first existence.üîΩThis is explained by the following.

original: de ni sngar /
analyzed: de ni sngar /
translated: That was previously explained by the following:

original: tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
translated: The final existence that has ceased

original: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
translated: Would not link with the first existence.

original: tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa //
analyzed: tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa //
translated: The final existence that has not ceased

original: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba dag gis bstan zin to //
analyzed: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba dag gis bstan zin to //
translated: Would not link with the first existence.üîΩIf you say that the final existence that is in the process of ceasing links with the first existence, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩIf the final existenceüîΩWere to link with the first existence,üîΩThen the appropriated

original: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Would link with the appropriated.

original: de la yang rjes su dpag pa bstan zin to zhes bya ba yang sngar /
analyzed: de la yang rjes su dpag pa bstan zin to zhes bya ba yang sngar /
translated: Also, it was previously explained that

original: gal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
analyzed: gal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
translated: if the final moment were to cease

original: dang por skye bar gyur na ni //
analyzed: dang por skye bar gyur na ni //
translated: and the first moment were to arise,

original: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
translated: then the one who is ceasing would be one,

original: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ;üîΩ/ zhes bya bas bstan zin to //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ; / zhes bya bas bstan zin to //
translated: and the one who is arising would be another.

original: yang na srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ni srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de 'gag bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ni srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de 'gag bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, the final moment of existence that is ceasing does not link with the first moment of existence because it is ceasing,üîΩjust like the final mind of an arhat.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa'i sems pa tha ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang por nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i rjes su dpag pa sngar bstan pa las gzhan ston te /
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa'i sems pa tha ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang por nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i rjes su dpag pa sngar bstan pa las gzhan ston te /
translated: This teaches an inference that is different from the one previously explained, that the final moment of existence that is ceasing does not link with the first moment of existence.

original: de dag ni chos can dag /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dag /
translated: These are the subject,

original: bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the predicate that is to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma ni 'gag bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir srid pa dang por nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa de bzhin du srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa yang 'gag bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyorüîΩba med do //
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma ni 'gag bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir srid pa dang por nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa de bzhin du srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa yang 'gag bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do //
translated: Likewise, because the final life is in the process of ceasing, it does not link with the first life.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Therefore, as it has been taught,üîΩIf that now ceasing and now arising

original: gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
translated: Do not link together,

original: 'o na de cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Then what will occur?

original: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
translated: The aggregates in which death occurs

original: der ni skye ba 'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: der ni skye ba 'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Would be the aggregates in which birth occurs.

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba las skye bar 'dod na de dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad par yang bstan zin to zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba las skye bar 'dod na de dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad par yang bstan zin to zhes bya bas ni /
translated: If you assert that birth occurs through linking with the first life, then it has already been explained that linking with that is untenable.

original: de ltar gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: person‚Äîwhether it has ceased, has not ceased, or is in the process of ceasing‚ÄîüîΩin the same way, the final moment of consciousness of a nonexistentüîΩperson does not link with the first moment of consciousness of a nonexistentüîΩperson‚Äîwhether it has ceased, has not ceased, or is in the process of ceasing.

original: pha rol po dag srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do zhes bya ba des kho bo cag la ci bya /
analyzed: pha rol po dag srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med do zhes bya ba des kho bo cag la ci bya /
translated: What does this have to do with us?üîΩIf the arising of the first moment of consciousness of an existent person

original: yod ni re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba ni @166b yod de ;
analyzed: yod ni re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba ni @166b yod de ;
translated: exists,üîΩthen it would arise from that from which it is logically possible. Therefore,üîΩsince the continuum of cyclic existence is tenable, even though one acceptsüîΩthat things exist, it does not follow that one falls into the errors of reification

original: de yang gang las rigs par 'gyur ba de las 'byung bar 'gyur ba des na srid pa'i rgyun yang 'thad pas dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: de yang gang las rigs par 'gyur ba de las 'byung bar 'gyur ba des na srid pa'i rgyun yang 'thad pas dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: and nihilism.

original: 'o na da ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na da ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be otherwise?

original: de lta na phung po gang dag kho na la 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag kho na la skye ba yang 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na phung po gang dag kho na la 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag kho na la skye ba yang 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would follow that birth would occur in the very aggregates that die.

original: 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad par sngar bstan pa las gzhan pa'i skye ba mi srid pas phung po gcig la 'chi ba dang skye ba gnyis ka 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di khas blangsüîΩpa las 'bros khung gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag skye bzhin pa dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad par sngar bstan pa las gzhan pa'i skye ba mi srid pas phung po gcig la 'chi ba dang skye ba gnyis ka 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di khas blangs pa las 'bros khung gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is impossible for that which has ceased, not ceased, or is in the process of ceasing to be born or to link with birth, and apart from that, birth is impossible. Therefore, it is impossible to escape the consequence that both death and birth occur in the same single aggregate.

original: de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable.üîΩIf you assert that birth occurs in the first moment of existence and that which links with birth, then it is also untenable that that which links with birth occurs in the first moment of existence.

original: yong ni srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba las skye bar 'dod na de dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad par yang sngar bstan zin pas de lta bas na srid pa dang po'i skye ba yod pa'i rgyun yang 'thad do zhes zer ba de ni
analyzed: yong ni srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba las skye bar 'dod na de dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad par yang sngar bstan zin pas de lta bas na srid pa dang po'i skye ba yod pa'i rgyun yang 'thad do zhes zer ba de ni
translated: This is because it has already been explained. Therefore it is said that it is also untenable that the continuum exists when birth occurs in the first moment of existence.

original: mi rung ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: mi rung ngo zhes ston to //
translated: This is untenable.

original: de la brtag pa snga mas ni srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / 'gag bzhin pa'i phyogs gsum rnam par gzhag nas srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med par bstan to //
analyzed: de la brtag pa snga mas ni srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / 'gag bzhin pa'i phyogs gsum rnam par gzhag nas srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med par bstan to //
translated: The former analysis refutes the first life linking with the final life, having presented three positions: the final life having ceased, not having ceased, and ceasing.

original: brtag pa phyi ma 'dis ni phyogs gsum po de dag nyid mi 'thad bzhin du pha rol po dag srid pa dang po'i skye ba yod pas srid pa'i rgyun yang 'thad do zhes zer ba dgag pa bstan te /
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma 'dis ni phyogs gsum po de dag nyid mi 'thad bzhin du pha rol po dag srid pa dang po'i skye ba yod pas srid pa'i rgyun yang 'thad do zhes zer ba dgag pa bstan te /
translated: This latter analysis refutes the opponent‚Äôs claim that since the first life arises, the continuum of existence is tenable, even though those three positions are untenable.

original: khyad par ni de yod de /
analyzed: khyad par ni de yod de /
translated: The difference is that.üîΩTherefore, as taught,

original: de'i phyir sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa'i dbang gis /
translated: the continuum of the world is illogical

original: de ltar dus gsum dag tu yang //
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum dag tu yang //
translated: in the three times.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyun ni mi rigs na //üîΩdus gsum dag tu gang med pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyun ni mi rigs na // dus gsum dag tu gang med pa //
translated: How could there be a continuum of existence

original: de na ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun //
analyzed: de na ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun //
translated: of that which does not exist in the three times?

original: zhes mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: This is the summary.

original: de ltar srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir rgyun la chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med de zhes bya ba'i tshig ni don dam par ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir rgyun la chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med de zhes bya ba'i tshig ni don dam par ma yin la /
translated: Thus, because it is untenable that the final and first moments of existence link, the continuum is not interrupted and it is not permanent.

original: khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa dang sun dbyung ba'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa dang sun dbyung ba'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The words ‚Äúin reality‚Äù and ‚Äúit is not tenable‚Äù are a summary of the refutation and the thesis.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus gsum dag tu yang srid pa'i rgyun mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus gsum dag tu yang srid pa'i rgyun mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, when this is fully investigated, since it is untenable that the final moment of existence ceases, does not cease, or both ceases and does not cease and links with the first moment of existence, the continuum of existence is illogical in the three times.

original: dus gsum dag tu srid pa'i rgyun gang med pa de da ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun du 'thad /üîΩsrid pa'i rgyun yod pa @167a * //
analyzed: dus gsum dag tu srid pa'i rgyun gang med pa de da ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun du 'thad / srid pa'i rgyun yod pa @167a * //
translated: How could that continuum of existence that does not exist in the three times be tenable as the continuum of existence?

original: ma yin na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: ma yin na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the continuum of existence does not exist, how could emergence and destruction exist?

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin na pha rol po dag gis dus la sogs pa dag 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin na pha rol po dag gis dus la sogs pa dag 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If emergence and destruction do not exist, then time and so on are not established for the opponent.

original: de lta bas na pha rol po dag gi rgyun la chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med do zhes smras pa'i tshig de ni don dam pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na pha rol po dag gi rgyun la chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med do zhes smras pa'i tshig de ni don dam pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúThe continuum of the opponent is neither interrupted nor permanent‚Äù is not ultimate.

original: dbu ma pas don dam par srid pa'i rgyu na mi 'thad par bshad pa ni khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbu ma pas don dam par srid pa'i rgyu na mi 'thad par bshad pa ni khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The statement by the Madhyamaka that ultimately the continuum of existence is untenable does not contradict the opponent‚Äôs assertion.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here the meaning of the chapter is as follows: The opponent says in the first chapter that time definitely exists ultimately because it is the cause of emergence and destruction.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas dus ma grub pa'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas dus ma grub pa'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras
translated: The reply is that because the fault of the reason has been stated, time is not established, and therefore emergence and destruction are shown to be essenceless. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: bu yin te /
analyzed: bu yin te /
translated: It is a son.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In this chapter, the twenty-first chapter on emergence and destruction, the meaning of the chapter is viewed as the result of valid knowledge. The opponent says, ‚ÄúTime definitely exists ultimately,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par smras pa dgag pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par smras pa dgag pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: because it is the cause of emergence and destruction.‚Äù This is a special assertion of the opponent that is discordant with emptiness. By refuting this, emergence and destruction are shown to be essenceless.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re /
translated: What is the good quality of showing that emergence and destruction are essenceless?

original: rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, some say that this is merely a treatise of dry logic, established by mere words. In order to dispel that, it is also established by authoritative statements.

original: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa las /
translated: Therefore, the questions of SubƒÅhu, the son of the Bhagavatƒ´ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ, are established.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la 'chi ba'am skye ba med do //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la 'chi ba'am skye ba med do //
translated: SubƒÅhu, there is no death or birth in form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'chi ba 'am skye ba med do ;
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'chi ba 'am skye ba med do ;
translated: Similarly, there is no death or birth in feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.

original: / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'chi ba 'am skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'chi ba 'am skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That which is no death or birth in form, feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i @167b lung de dag grub pa ni 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i @167b lung de dag grub pa ni 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin no //
translated: The establishment of those passages of trustworthy scripture is the source and quality of the teaching of the essencelessness of arising and disintegration.

original: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The fact that they are the very objects to be explained by this treatise is demonstrated by the fact that the master [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] himself knew them and was skilled in composing commentaries.üîΩThe chapter on origination and cessation is found in the Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on the Root Verses on the Middle Way composed by the master BhƒÅviveka.

original: rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: This is the commentary on the twenty-first chapter of the Treatise on the Middle Way called ‚ÄúExamination of Origination and Cessation.‚Äù

analyzed: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku btsal ba'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir
translated: Now, in order to refute the specific objections to emptiness and to search for the ultimate body of the TathƒÅgata, chapter twenty-two is begun.

Therefore, in terms of that, it is said.üîΩWhat is the result of this chapter?

translated: By what aspects is that result attained?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa dang / gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa yang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsal ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /üîΩstong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa dang / gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa yang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsal ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la / stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir /
translated: The result of this is the clarification that the ultimate truth is the dharmakaya of the Tathagata and that the conventional truth is the rupakaya of the Tathagata, both of which are devoid of any essence in the ultimate.üîΩThe attainment of this result is by way of the refutation of the specific counter positions to emptiness.

original: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the author of the commentary, at the very beginning of this chapter, teaches the method and the result of the method.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the specific counter positions to emptiness,

original: mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'dir smras pa don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'dir smras pa don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sems kyi skad cig ma'i mjug thogs su skyes pa rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sems kyi skad cig ma'i mjug thogs su skyes pa rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma'o //
translated: The ultimate reality of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs Dharma Body is the moment of transcendent wisdom called the ‚Äúpath of liberation,‚Äù which arises immediately after the mind‚Äôs moment of the vajra-like concentration.

original: gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa yang de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa yang de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: The conventional reality of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs form body is also called the ‚Äúbody of the TathƒÅgata‚Äù because it is the basis of the ultimate reality of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs Dharma Body.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, the example, the application of the reason, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don @168b dam pa dang / gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don @168b dam pa dang / gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: For example, just as the ultimate truth, the dharmakƒÅya of the TathƒÅgata, and the conventional truth, the r≈´pakƒÅya of the TathƒÅgata, are entities and therefore have an essence, so too form and so on are entities and therefore have an essence.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa pa ni slob pa thams cad tha ma'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba'i mjug thogs su mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ye shes skyes pa yin pas de yang deüîΩbzhin gshegs pa'i sku yin la /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa pa ni slob pa thams cad tha ma'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba'i mjug thogs su mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ye shes skyes pa yin pas de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yin la /
translated: The ultimate truth, the dharmakƒÅya of the TathƒÅgata, is the gnosis of the path of no further learning that arises after the vajralike samƒÅdhi, the final samƒÅdhi of the learner.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la sogs pas mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la sogs pas mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The conventional truth, the r≈´pakƒÅya of the TathƒÅgata, is indicated by the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great being.

original: de yang chos kyi sku de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang chos kyi sku de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, since the dharmakƒÅya is their basis, they are called ‚Äúthe tathƒÅgatas‚Äô bodies.‚Äù

original: de dag dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they are things, they alone have intrinsic reality ultimately. In the same way, since things such as form are things,

analyzed: don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: they alone have intrinsic reality ultimately.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To refute those specific counter positions to emptiness, the Commentary explains that ultimately the two bodies of the TathƒÅgata are devoid of intrinsic reality.

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /

translated: If you assert that things and the TathƒÅgata alone have intrinsic reality from the perspective of a conventional mind, then you are simply proving what is already established.

translated: But if you are speaking ultimately, then you must first analyze the TathƒÅgata himself.üîΩThe opponent asserts that things such as form and the two kinds of bodies of the TathƒÅgata exist inherently, on the basis of an intellect that is confined to conventional expressions.

original: pha rol po dag kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo gros kyis gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam gnyis ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar 'dod na ni kho bo cag dbu ma pas kyang lung las /

translated: And:

analyzed: bu don thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba byung ste /

analyzed: 'on te don dam par de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar 'dod na ni mi 'grub ste /

translated: it says, ‚ÄúHere, since the wisdom of the Tathagata is included within the aggregates, by refuting the Tathagata who has the nature of the aggregates, that is also refuted. Therefore, it says, ‚ÄòIt is not the body,‚Äô and so on.

analyzed: gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa phung po'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bkag pas chos kyi sku don dam pa ba ye shes de yang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bkag par 'gyur bas
translated: Therefore, because the refutation of the ultimate nonentityness of the form kƒÅyas, which are the aggregates, also refutes the ultimate nonentityness of the gnosis of the ultimate dharmakƒÅya,üîΩthe author of the treatise

analyzed: de'i phyir / bstan bcos mdzad pas / sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
translated: says:üîΩNot body, not other than body,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //

translated: Since the Abhidharma states that the meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúheap,‚Äù it means the five aggregates that have the nature of form, feeling, conception, formation, and consciousness.

analyzed: gzugs kyi sku dang / chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa de tshig tsam zhig smos na de bzhin gshegs pa dgag pa'i tshig gi don yin par mi mngon gyi /
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa de tshig tsam zhig smos na de bzhin gshegs pa dgag pa'i tshig gi don yin par mi mngon gyi /
translated: If the term ‚ÄútathƒÅgata‚Äù were not mentioned, and the words ‚Äúnot the aggregates,‚Äù ‚Äúnot different from the aggregates,‚Äù and so on were stated, then only the words would be stated, and it would not be clear that the meaning of the words is to refute the TathƒÅgata.

original: phung po rnams nyi tshe dgag pa'i tshig gi don yin par go bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po rnams nyi tshe dgag pa'i tshig gi don yin par go bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if the term ‚ÄútathƒÅgata‚Äù is mentioned, it would be understood that the meaning of the words is to refute only the aggregates.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i skabs kyi don 'di ni /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i skabs kyi don 'di ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgag pa'i tshig gi don gsal bar 'dod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di so sor brjod par bya ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgag pa'i tshig gi don gsal bar 'dod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di so sor brjod par bya ba yin par bstan to //
translated: Because it is associated with the desire to clarify the meaning of the words that refute the TathƒÅgata, it is taught that the term ‚ÄútathƒÅgata‚Äù should be stated.

original: des na 'dir phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa dang / phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan ma yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams med pa dang / phung po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa med pa dang /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma @170a * //
analyzed: des na 'dir phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa dang / phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan ma yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams med pa dang / phung po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma @170a * //
translated: Therefore, here the aggregates are the TathƒÅgata, the TathƒÅgata is not other than the aggregates, the TathƒÅgata does not possess the aggregates, the TathƒÅgata does not exist in the aggregates,üîΩand the TathƒÅgata is not complete in the aggregates.

original: yin par dam bca' ba rnam pa lnga ston to //
analyzed: yin par dam bca' ba rnam pa lnga ston to //
translated: Therefore, here the five theses are taught: the aggregates are not the TathƒÅgata, the TathƒÅgata is not other than the aggregates, the TathƒÅgata does not possess the aggregates, the TathƒÅgata does not exist in the aggregates, and the TathƒÅgata does not exist in the aggregates.

original: de la re zhig dam bca' ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig dam bca' ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The first thesis is taught in order to demonstrate that.

original: phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The aggregates are not the TathƒÅgata means that the TathƒÅgata is not the intrinsic reality of the aggregates.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is called the establishment of the thesis.

original: de ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyogs yin no //
translated: This is the position.

original: phung po rnams kyi chos ni phung po nyid dang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid dang byas pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi chos ni phung po nyid dang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid dang byas pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The properties of the aggregates are the aggregates themselves, the properties of arising and disintegrating, being produced, and so on.üîΩThe reason is that

original: de ni gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni de dag yin par bstan te ;üîΩde ni phyogs kyi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni de dag yin par bstan te ; de ni phyogs kyi chos ma yin no //
translated: those are the properties of the aggregates.üîΩThe example is the aggregates of ordinary beings,üîΩby the power of those.

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis so so'i skye bo'i phung po la sogs pa dag go zhes bya bas ni phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i dpe ni phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos de'i dbang gis rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ka la
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis so so'i skye bo'i phung po la sogs pa dag go zhes bya bas ni phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i dpe ni phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos de'i dbang gis rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ka la
translated: The example that proves that the aggregates are not the TathƒÅgata is the aggregates of ordinary beings, by the power of the position and the property of that.

original: grags pa'i chos can so so'i skye bo'i phung po la sogs pa dag yin par bstan te /
analyzed: grags pa'i chos can so so'i skye bo'i phung po la sogs pa dag yin par bstan te /
translated: The subject that is renowned to both parties in a debate is the aggregates of ordinary beings.

original: de ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: That is the example of the similar class.

original: de ltar phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos dang dpe dag ngo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos dang dpe dag ngo bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having presented the position, the property of the position, and the example,

original: da ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach inference as a valid means of knowledge,

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHere, the inference is this: ultimately, the aggregates are not the tathƒÅgata

original: phung po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because of being the aggregates and because of being subject to production and disintegration.

original: dper na so so'i skye bo'i phung po rnams bzhin nam phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo'i phung po rnams bzhin nam phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, like the aggregates of an ordinary being or like external earth and so on.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the property of the position, the property of the proof, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na so so'i skye bo'i phung po rnams sam /
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo'i phung po rnams sam /
translated: For example, the aggregates of an ordinary being

original: phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa dag ni phung po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa dag ni phung po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: or external earth and so on are the aggregates and are subject to production and disintegration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas mtshan pa'i phung po rnams kyang phung po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas mtshan pa'i phung po rnams kyang phung po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the aggregates are not the TathƒÅgata, in the same way, the aggregates characterized by the marks and signs of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs body are not the TathƒÅgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no //
translated: because they are aggregates and because they are subject to production and destruction.

original: de bzhin du byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par @170b bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par @170b bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, it should be said that they are not the TathƒÅgata because of the reasons of being produced and so on.

original: don dam par phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Ultimately, the aggregates are not the TathƒÅgata,

original: byas pa nyid dang / mig gi yul nyid dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang / mig gi yul nyid dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are produced, because they are objects of the eye, because they are obstructive, because they are the cause of joy and sorrow, and so on.

original: dper na so so'i skye bo'i phung po rnams bzhin nam /
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo'i phung po rnams bzhin nam /
translated: They are like the aggregates of ordinary beings.

original: phyi rol gyis la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyis la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust like external things like a field‚Äù is applied to this.

original: yang na don dam par phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, the aggregates are not the TathƒÅgata ultimatelyüîΩbecause their arising is refuted and because the substantial reality of form and so on is refuted.

original: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / gzugs la sogs pa dag gi rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dam bcas pa dang ; dpe snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di gnyis kyang yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / gzugs la sogs pa dag gi rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dam bcas pa dang ; dpe snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di gnyis kyang yin par sbyar te /
translated: The two reasons of the former example are also applied to this.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni phung po rnams phyogs su bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni phung po rnams phyogs su bya ste /
translated: First, the aggregates are posited as the subject,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgag pa bstan to //üîΩda ni ye shes phyogs su bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgag pa bstan to // da ni ye shes phyogs su bya ste /
translated: and the TathƒÅgata is refuted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the refutation of the TathƒÅgata,üîΩwisdom is posited as the subject.

original: yang na ye shes 'ba' zhig phyogs su byas nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ye shes 'ba' zhig phyogs su byas nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Or, wisdom alone is posited as the subject and it is said:üîΩWisdom is not the TathƒÅgata ultimately

original: don dam par ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is a knower,üîΩjust like the wisdom of an ordinary being.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is subject to arising and destruction and because it is consciousness, like the consciousness of an ordinary being.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na so so'i skye bo'i shes pa ni 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na so so'i skye bo'i shes pa ni 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, the consciousness of an ordinary being is not a tathƒÅgata because it is subject to arising and destruction and because it is consciousness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the gnosis of liberation of a tathƒÅgata is not a tathƒÅgata because it is subject to arising and destruction and because it is consciousness.

original: 'dir gal te mu stegs can dag 'di skad ces khyed sangs rgyas pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas mtshan pa'i phung po rnams dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes dag de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par bsgrub pa de ni bden te /
analyzed: 'dir gal te mu stegs can dag 'di skad ces khyed sangs rgyas pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas mtshan pa'i phung po rnams dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes dag de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par bsgrub pa de ni bden te /
translated: Here, if tƒ´rthikas say, ‚ÄúYou Buddhists prove that the TathƒÅgata is not the aggregates that are characterized by the major and minor marks of a buddha, nor is he the wisdom of liberation.

original: des na kho bo cag gi ston pa 'od srungs rdzogs byed la sogs pa'i lus g-yang gzhi dang / ral pa dang / shing shun la sogs pas @171a * //
analyzed: des na kho bo cag gi ston pa 'od srungs rdzogs byed la sogs pa'i lus g-yang gzhi dang / ral pa dang / shing shun la sogs pas @171a * //
translated: Therefore our teacher P≈´ra·πáa KƒÅ≈õyapa and so on is the TathƒÅgata because he is characterized by the aggregates of the body with its matted hair, beard, and bark-cloth garment,

original: mtshon pa'i phung po rnams dang / de dag ni chos dang / chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: mtshon pa'i phung po rnams dang / de dag ni chos dang / chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes zer na /
translated: and he is the one who has the wisdom that realizes what is Dharma and what is not Dharma,‚Äù

original: de dag la 'di skad ces tha snyad du yang rdzogs byed la sogs pa'i phung po dang shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces tha snyad du yang rdzogs byed la sogs pa'i phung po dang shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: to them it should be said, ‚ÄúEven conventionally, P≈´ra·πáa and so on is not the TathƒÅgata because he is the aggregates and consciousness.

original: rgyus 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i lus can yin pa'i phyir dang / log par lta ba la sogs pa'i blo can yin pa'i phyir dper na smad 'tshong ma'i lus dang / glang bu'i sems bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyus 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i lus can yin pa'i phyir dang / log par lta ba la sogs pa'i blo can yin pa'i phyir dper na smad 'tshong ma'i lus dang / glang bu'i sems bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because they are embodied beings who live by means of their body, and because they are intelligent beings who have wrong views, they are like the body of a prostitute and the mind of a bull.

original: dam bca' ba gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the second thesis,

original: mu stegs can dag ni phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin par bsams nas bdag tu sgrub par 'dod pas de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /üîΩsku las gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: mu stegs can dag ni phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin par bsams nas bdag tu sgrub par 'dod pas de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de / sku las gzhan ma yin /
translated: since tƒ´rthikas think that the TathƒÅgata is different from the aggregates, they assert that the TathƒÅgata is established as a self.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is not different from the aggregates.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is not different from the aggregates.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag dgag pa bzhin du de yang bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag dgag pa bzhin du de yang bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because there is no inference that teaches that the TathƒÅgata exists as different from them, and because, like the self that is different from the aggregates, he is refuted.

original: sngar dam bca' ba dang pos phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par bkag pa dang / 'dir mu stegs can dag phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin par sems shing /
analyzed: sngar dam bca' ba dang pos phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par bkag pa dang / 'dir mu stegs can dag phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin par sems shing /
translated: The first thesis refutes the aggregates being the TathƒÅgata, and here the tƒ´rthikas think the TathƒÅgata is different from the aggregates.

original: de yang bdag tu sgrub par 'dod pas de dag dgag pa'i phyir dam bca' ba gnyis pa 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang bdag tu sgrub par 'dod pas de dag dgag pa'i phyir dam bca' ba gnyis pa 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since they assert that the TathƒÅgata is established as a self, this second thesis is explained in order to refute them.

original: 'di yang phung po rnams las ci zhig gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang phung po rnams las ci zhig gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: What is not different from the aggregates?üîΩThe TathƒÅgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this, he says,

original: sku las gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: sku las gzhan ma yin /
translated: ‚Äúnot different from the body,‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚Äúthe TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mu stegs can dag las sar skya dang rkang mig dang gzegs zan la sogs pa de dag gi phung po de dag las gzhan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba bdag yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / dbu ma pa la phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa /üîΩgal te phung po rnams las gzhan //üîΩphung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mu stegs can dag las sar skya dang rkang mig dang gzegs zan la sogs pa de dag gi phung po de dag las gzhan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba bdag yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / dbu ma pa la phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa / gal te phung po rnams las gzhan // phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa bzhin du /
translated: The tirthikas, such as the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, Aul≈´kyas, and KƒÅ≈õyapƒ´yas, do not have an inference that reveals the existence of a self, a tathƒÅgata who is different from the aggregates.üîΩAnd the MƒÅdhyamikas do not have an inference that refutes a self that is different from the aggregates.üîΩIf it were different from the aggregates,üîΩit would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.üîΩüîΩ

analyzed: zhes bya bas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin te /

analyzed: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: dper na gangs la sman yod pa las bzlog pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: dam bca' ba bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir der de med /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir der de med ces gsungs te ;
translated: To demonstrate that it is the TathƒÅgata, he says, He does not exist there.

translated: The TathƒÅgata does not exist in the aggregates, just as a lion, the king of beasts, exists in a forest of ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ trees.

original: gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dir yang rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is: The TathƒÅgata does not exist in reality in the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the TathƒÅgata is not different from the aggregates,

original: dper na nags tshal na seng ge yod pa las bzlog pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na nags tshal na seng ge yod pa las bzlog pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: dam bca' ba lnga pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba lnga pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the fifth thesis,üîΩthe treatise states:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not possess a body.

original: ji ltar nor can nor dang ldan @172a * //üîΩpa de ltar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar nor can nor dang ldan @172a * // pa de ltar ro zhes bya ba smras te /

original: 'dir yang de bzhin gshegs pa ci zhig dang ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin gshegs pa ci zhig dang ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Here, what does the TathƒÅgata not possess?

original: sku ldan min zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sku ldan min zhes gsungs te /
translated: The treatise states: ‚ÄúHe does not possess a body.‚Äù

original: ji ltar nor lha nor can nor dang ldan pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nor lha nor can nor dang ldan pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is not like a wealthy person who possesses wealth in the form of the aggregates.

original: bdag po bzhin gshegs pa nyid ma grub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po bzhin gshegs pa nyid ma grub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self does not exist.

original: 'dir yang rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is: ultimately, the TathƒÅgata is not the appropriator of the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the TathƒÅgata is not other than the aggregates,

original: dper na nor can nor dang ldan pa las bzlog pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na nor can nor dang ldan pa las bzlog pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: da ni dam bca' ba rnam pa lnga po de dag gi mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dam bca' ba rnam pa lnga po de dag gi mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the conclusion of those five theses,

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa lngas yongs su brtags na gang mi srid pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa lngas yongs su brtags na gang mi srid pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin /
translated: he says, Therefore, when thoroughly investigated in these five ways, what TathƒÅgata is there who is not impossible?

original: sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa dag gis yongs su brtags na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa dag gis yongs su brtags na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning of the words is this: when thoroughly investigated by the proofs as they have been taught, the so-called TathƒÅgata does not exist at all.

original: de nyid dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point by means of an example,üîΩhe says,

original: dper na chom rkun pa nyid la mngon par brtson pa dag la yongs su brtags pa na gang yang de yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir chom rkun pa gang zhig yin zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na chom rkun pa nyid la mngon par brtson pa dag la yongs su brtags pa na gang yang de yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir chom rkun pa gang zhig yin zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, when you examine those who are renowned as thieves, since it is not tenable that anyone is a thief, it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is a thief?‚Äù

original: dper na chom rkun pa nyid du grags pa dag la yongs su brtags na gang yang chom rkun pa yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na chom rkun pa nyid du grags pa dag la yongs su brtags na gang yang chom rkun pa yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, when you examine those who are renowned as thieves, since it is not tenable that anyone is a thief,

original: chom rkun pa gang zhig yin te med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: chom rkun pa gang zhig yin te med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: what is a thief? There is none.

original: mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba de bzhin gshegs pa dngos por 'dod pa dag la rnam pa lngas yongs su brtags na gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba de bzhin gshegs pa dngos por 'dod pa dag la rnam pa lngas yongs su brtags na gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, when you examine the TathƒÅgata in five ways, since it is not tenable that anyone is the TathƒÅgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin te /
translated: what is the TathƒÅgata?

original: don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that ultimately he is essenceless.

original: yang dpe gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dpe gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To illustrate this point with another example,

original: yang dper na phung po rnams ma gtogs par skyes bu'am dbang phyug ces bya ba gang zhig yin zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yang dper na phung po rnams ma gtogs par skyes bu'am dbang phyug ces bya ba gang zhig yin zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, apart from the aggregates, what is a person or a god?

original: dper na skyes bu dang dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag la rigs pas brtags na phung po rnams ma gtogs par skye bu'am phyug ces bya ba med pas de gang yin zhes bya ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu dang dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag la rigs pas brtags na phung po rnams ma gtogs par skye bu'am phyug ces bya ba med pas de gang yin zhes bya ba de bzhin du //
translated: For example, when reason analyzes those who assert a person or a god as a cause, since apart from the aggregates there is no person or god, one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dngos por 'dod pa dag la yang @172b regs pas brtags na rnams pa lnga po dag ma gtogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba med pas de gang zhig yin zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dngos por 'dod pa dag la yang @172b regs pas brtags na rnams pa lnga po dag ma gtogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba med pas de gang zhig yin zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: In the same way, when reason analyzes those who assert the TathƒÅgata as a thing, since apart from the five aggregates there is no so-called TathƒÅgata, one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù This teaches the conclusion.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the result of valid knowledge, he says:

original: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma grub pas sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma grub pas sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, since the TathƒÅgata is not established in that way, the example has the fault of being incomplete.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lngas brtags na ma grub pa sngar mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lngas brtags na ma grub pa sngar mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Previously, the SautrƒÅntikas and VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas said, ‚ÄúUltimately, things such as form exist inherently because they are things.üîΩFor example, it is like the body of the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa'i dpe ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par dam
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa'i dpe ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par dam
translated: Since the example in their proof is not established, their proof has the fault of an incomplete example. Therefore, ultimately, things such as form exist inherently.

original: bca' ba ma grub pas /
analyzed: bca' ba ma grub pas /
translated: This is their thesis.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas sngar don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dang dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub po /üîΩ// / bam po bdun cu pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas sngar don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dang dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub po / // / bam po bdun cu pa'o //
translated: Since this is not established, the intention of the treatise‚Äôs earlier statement, ‚ÄúUltimately, things such as form are natureless,‚Äù is established.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas 'grub pa'i phyir kho bo cag la sgrub pa des mi gnod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir rang gi sde pa dag las gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas 'grub pa'i phyir kho bo cag la sgrub pa des mi gnod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir rang gi sde pa dag las gzhan dag na re /
translated: Our argument does not undermine your position.üîΩHere, some Buddhist schools say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams kyang ma yin la /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is not the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams kyang gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyang gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: He is also not different from the aggregates.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: He is not described as the same or different.

original: khyed kyis / sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: khyed kyis / sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
translated: Your statement, ‚ÄúThe Buddha is not the body, nor is he different from the body,‚Äù

original: zhes shad pa de ni bden no //
analyzed: zhes shad pa de ni bden no //
translated: is correct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas 'grub pa'i phyir kho bo can la khyed kyis de nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i sgrub pa ji skad smras pa des mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas 'grub pa'i phyir kho bo can la khyed kyis de nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i sgrub pa ji skad smras pa des mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is established in dependence on the aggregates. Therefore, our argument that the TathƒÅgata is neither the same nor different from the aggregates does not undermine your position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: gal te sangs rgyas phung po la /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas phung po la /
translated: If the Buddha is not the aggregates,

original: brten nas gdags par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: brten nas gdags par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that the TathƒÅgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates,

original: 'o na de ltar na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na /

original: ngo bo nyid las med /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las med /
translated: the TathƒÅgata does not exist due to his own intrinsic reality.

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'dis ni gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par 'dod na 'o na de lta na gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags pa yin pas bdag gi dngos po las 'grub pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs @173a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par 'dod na 'o na de lta na gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags pa yin pas bdag gi dngos po las 'grub pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs @173a * //
translated: This demonstrates that if you assert that the TathƒÅgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates, then in that case, since he is imputed in dependence on an extraneous entity, he is not established due to his own intrinsic reality.

original: pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore the TathƒÅgata is essenceless and does not substantially exist.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: the root text says, ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata does not exist due to his own intrinsic reality. He does not substantially exist.‚Äù

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the statement of the thesis.

original: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par 'dod na ngo bo nyid las ngo bo nyid med pa dang rdzas nyid du rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa bstan te de ni phyogs yin no
analyzed: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par 'dod na ngo bo nyid las ngo bo nyid med pa dang rdzas nyid du rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa bstan te de ni phyogs yin no
translated: This presents the thesis: ‚ÄúIf the TathƒÅgata is asserted to be imputed in dependence on the aggregates, he does not exist inherently, that is, he is not substantially existent.‚Äù This is the position.

original: // phyogs kyi chos ni khongs na yod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // phyogs kyi chos ni khongs na yod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The property of the position is contained within it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa de nyid kyi khongs na yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa de nyid kyi khongs na yod de /
translated: The reason that proves that the TathƒÅgata is essenceless and not substantially existent is contained within the thesis itself.

original: rten nas gdags par bya ba dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rten nas gdags par bya ba dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The reason is applied to the thesis: ‚ÄúHe is dependently imputed and not substantially existent.‚Äù

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis mgal me'i 'khor lo dang bum pa dag yin no zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i dpe ni phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos de'i dbang gis rgol ba dang phyir rgol pa gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos mgal me'i 'khor lo dang bum pa yin te /
