analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis mgal me'i 'khor lo dang bum pa dag yin no zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i dpe ni phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos de'i dbang gis rgol ba dang phyir rgol pa gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos mgal me'i 'khor lo dang bum pa yin te /
translated: The example that proves the Tathagata is essenceless and does not substantially exist is the wheel of fire and the pot, which are phenomena that are renowned to both parties in the debate, because of the position and the property of the position.

original: de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: This is a similar example.

original: de ltar phyogs dang / phyogs kyi chos dang / dpe dag ngo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs dang / phyogs kyi chos dang / dpe dag ngo bstan nas /
translated: Having thus presented the position, the property of the position, and the example,

original: da ni rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to present the inference,üîΩthe root text says:

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is: The Tathagata is ultimately essenceless and does not substantially exist,

original: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin nam /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin nam /
translated: because he is an object of designation, just like, for example, the circle of a firebrand or

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it does not substantially exist, like a pot.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos rnam pa gnyis dang / sgrub pa'i chos rnam pa gnyis dang / dpe rnam pa gnyis yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos rnam pa gnyis dang / sgrub pa'i chos rnam pa gnyis dang / dpe rnam pa gnyis yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the two subjects, the two properties to be established, the two properties that establish, and the two examples, respectively.

original: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo ni gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa dang / bum pa ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo ni gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa dang / bum pa ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa /
translated: For example, a firebrand wheel is imputed, and therefore it is essenceless, and a pot does not substantially exist, because it does not substantially exist.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su med pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su med pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the TathƒÅgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates, and therefore he is essenceless, and he does not substantially exist, because he does not substantially exist.

original: mi mkhas pa kha cig gis 'dir @173b smras pa /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa kha cig gis 'dir @173b smras pa /
translated: Here, some unwise people say,

original: gal te re zhig mtshan nyid las //üîΩgang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la //
analyzed: gal te re zhig mtshan nyid las // gang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la //
translated: If the TathƒÅgata is essenceless,üîΩthen how could the TathƒÅgataüîΩbe said to exist?

original: de blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
analyzed: de blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
translated: If the TathƒÅgata is essenceless,üîΩthen how could he be said to exist?

original: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //
translated: That is conventional existence.

original: don dam yod pa don bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam yod pa don bzhin no //
translated: Ultimate existence is as the meaning.

original: zhes 'byung ba des rdzas su yod pa nyid 'gog par byed na ni de kho bo cag la mi gnod de /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba des rdzas su yod pa nyid 'gog par byed na ni de kho bo cag la mi gnod de /
translated: If that passage refutes substantial existence, it does not contradict us.

original: 'di ltar bum pa ni zhig pa dang blos gzhan sel ba na de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs dag la de dag ni blo yod pas de dag rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir chos mngon pa pa dag / sngar rdzas dbuüîΩma pas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa ni zhig pa dang blos gzhan sel ba na de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs dag la de dag ni blo yod pas de dag rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir chos mngon pa pa dag / sngar rdzas dbu ma pas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because when a vase is destroyed or the mind eliminates other things, the mind exists in relation to those things that are other than them, those are substantially existent.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe des bum pa yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par mi 'grub la /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe des bum pa yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par mi 'grub la /
translated: Here, the Abhidharma masters say that the reason and example stated by the Madhyamika, ‚ÄúThe Tathagata does not substantially exist ultimately because he does not substantially exist, like a vase,‚Äù do not establish that a vase does not substantially exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par mi 'grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par mi 'grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: Nor do they establish that the Tathagata does not substantially exist.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They say:

original: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pa bum pa lta bu dang / blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pa bum pa lta bu dang / blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ma yin la /
translated: and that for which the mind does not exist due to the exclusion of other by the mind, like water, do not exist conventionally.

original: don dam par yod pa ni de dag las gzhan pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ni de dag las gzhan pa'i don yin te /
translated: Ultimate existence is a different object from those.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa ni btags par yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa ni btags par yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Conventional existence is called imputed existence.

original: don dam par yod pa ni rdzas su yod pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ni rdzas su yod pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Ultimate existence is called substantial existence.

original: de la gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pa bum pa lta bu kun rdzob tu yod pa de'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /üîΩdngos po gang zhig pa la dngos po de'i blo mi skye ba dper na bum pa zhig pa la bum pa de'i blo yang mi skye la /
analyzed: de la gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pa bum pa lta bu kun rdzob tu yod pa de'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na / dngos po gang zhig pa la dngos po de'i blo mi skye ba dper na bum pa zhig pa la bum pa de'i blo yang mi skye la /
translated: What is the definition of that which is destroyed and for which the mind does not exist, like a pot, that is conventionally existent?üîΩAny thing that is destroyed for which the mind of that thing does not arise, for example, when a pot is destroyed, the mind of that pot does not arise and the mind of another thing does not arise.

original: blo gzhan yang mi skye ba lta bu de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: blo gzhan yang mi skye ba lta bu de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
translated: That is conventionally existent.

original: btags par yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btags par yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called imputed existence.

original: blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu kun rdzob tu yod pa de'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu kun rdzob tu yod pa de'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of that which exists conventionally, such as water, which is the absence of the cognition of something else by the cognition of that?

original: blos dngos po gzhan btsal ba la dngos po de'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: blos dngos po gzhan btsal ba la dngos po de'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of that which exists conventionally, such as water, which is the absence of the cognition of something else by the cognition of that?

original: dngos po gang zhig pa dang / blo mi skye ba dper na rgya mtsho 'am lteng ka nas bcus pa'i chu la rgya mtsho dang lteng ka'i blo yang mi skye la /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig pa dang / blo mi skye ba dper na rgya mtsho 'am lteng ka nas bcus pa'i chu la rgya mtsho dang lteng ka'i blo yang mi skye la /
translated: That which, when destroyed or when the mind is directed to something else, the cognition of it does not arise, for example, when the water of a lake or a pool is stirred up, the cognition of the lake or the pool does not arise,

original: blo gzhan yang mi skye ba lta bu de yang kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: blo gzhan yang mi skye ba lta bu de yang kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
translated: nor does any other cognition arise. That also exists conventionally,

original: btags par yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btags par yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: for it is said to exist as a designation.

original: don dam par yod pa ni dag las gzhan pa'i don yin te zhes bya ba de'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ni dag las gzhan pa'i don yin te zhes bya ba de'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of that which exists ultimately, which is a different object from those?

original: dngos po gang zhig pa dang blos bstsal kyang de las gzhan pa'i blos skye ba dper na bum pa zhig kyang de las gzhan pa gyi mo'i @174a * //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig pa dang blos bstsal kyang de las gzhan pa'i blos skye ba dper na bum pa zhig kyang de las gzhan pa gyi mo'i @174a * //
translated: That which, when destroyed or when the mind is directed to something else, arises from that by another cognition, for example, when a pot is destroyed, the cognition of a pot does not arise,üîΩbut the cognition of form, etc.,

original: blo skye ba lta bu dang / rgya mtsho'am ldeng ka nas bcus pa'i chu la blos rgya mtsho dang lteng ka bstsal kyang de dag las gzhan pa chu'i blo skye ba lta bu de ni don dam par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: blo skye ba lta bu dang / rgya mtsho'am ldeng ka nas bcus pa'i chu la blos rgya mtsho dang lteng ka bstsal kyang de dag las gzhan pa chu'i blo skye ba lta bu de ni don dam par yod pa yin te /
translated: For example, when one thinks of the mind or of water drawn from the ocean or a pond, the mind is of water and of the ocean or pond, but the mind is not of anything other than that water.üîΩThat is ultimate existence,

original: rdzas su yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and it is called substantial existence.

original: de lta bas na khyed dbu ma pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa de /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyed dbu ma pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa de /
translated: Therefore, you Madhyamikas say, ‚ÄúIt is like a pot, because it does not substantially exist.‚Äù

original: gal te re zhig kho bo cag gi chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid de'i sgo nas rdzas su yod pa nyid 'gog par byed na ni des kho bo cag la mi gnod de /
analyzed: gal te re zhig kho bo cag gi chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid de'i sgo nas rdzas su yod pa nyid 'gog par byed na ni des kho bo cag la mi gnod de /
translated: If you refute substantial existence in terms of the definition of the Abhidharma of us Vaibhasikas, then that does not harm us.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar bum pa zhig pa dang / blos gzhan sel ba na de dag la de dag nyid kyi blo skye ba med pas de dag kun rdzob tu btags par yod pa yin du zin kyang bum pa zhig pa dang / blos gzhan bstsal ba de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs gyo mo dang chu dag la de dag gi blo skye ba yod pas de dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa zhig pa dang / blos gzhan sel ba na de dag la de dag nyid kyi blo skye ba med pas de dag kun rdzob tu btags par yod pa yin du zin kyang bum pa zhig pa dang / blos gzhan bstsal ba de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs gyo mo dang chu dag la de dag gi blo skye ba yod pas de dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, when a vase is destroyed and when the mind eliminates other things, the mind that conceives of those things does not arise. Therefore, although they are imputedly existent conventionally, since the mind that conceives of those things arises in relation to the form of the vase‚Äôs shards and the water, they are ultimately substantially existent.

original: des na ji ltar gyo mo dang chu dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du bum pa ma zhig pa dang / rgya mtsho dang lteng ka blos ma bstsal ba de dag kyang don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir khyed kyis rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe de dag ma grub pas don
analyzed: des na ji ltar gyo mo dang chu dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du bum pa ma zhig pa dang / rgya mtsho dang lteng ka blos ma bstsal ba de dag kyang don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir khyed kyis rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe de dag ma grub pas don
translated: Therefore, just as the shards and the water are ultimately substantially existent, so too the vase that is not destroyed and the ocean and the pond that are not eliminated by the mind are ultimately substantially existent.

original: dam par bum pa yang rdzas su yod pa yin la /
analyzed: dam par bum pa yang rdzas su yod pa yin la /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the vase is substantially existent and

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rdzas su yod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rdzas su yod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: the TathƒÅgata is substantially existent.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThat is not good

original: rdzas su yod pa la mtshan nyid kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa la mtshan nyid kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because substantial existence is undermined by its characteristics.‚ÄùüîΩPreviously, the opponents said that in the Abhidharma characteristics,üîΩthat which is destroyed is not perceived by the mind, like a vase, and thatüîΩwhich is not perceived by the mind when another is eliminated by the mind,

original: de ni sngar pha rol po dag gis chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pa bum pa lta bu blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni sngar pha rol po dag gis chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pa bum pa lta bu blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin la /
translated: like water, is conventionally existent.

original: gang zhig pa dang blos bstsal kyang de las gzhan pa'i blo skye ba dper na bum pa zhig kyang de las gzhan pa gyo mo'i blo skye ba lta bu dang / rgya mtsho 'am lteng ka nas bcus pa'i chu la blos rgya mtsho dang ldeng ka bstsal kyang de dag la gzhan pa chu'i blo skye ba lta bu de ni don dam par yod pa yin par 'byung bas /üîΩkhyed dbu ma pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa de gal te re zhig kho bo cag gi chos mngon pa'i mtshan @174b nyid de'i sgo nas rdzas su yod pa nyid 'gog par byed na ni des kho
analyzed: gang zhig pa dang blos bstsal kyang de las gzhan pa'i blo skye ba dper na bum pa zhig kyang de las gzhan pa gyo mo'i blo skye ba lta bu dang / rgya mtsho 'am lteng ka nas bcus pa'i chu la blos rgya mtsho dang ldeng ka bstsal kyang de dag la gzhan pa chu'i blo skye ba lta bu de ni don dam par yod pa yin par 'byung bas / khyed dbu ma pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa de gal te re zhig kho bo cag gi chos mngon pa'i mtshan @174b nyid de'i sgo nas rdzas su yod pa nyid 'gog par byed na ni des kho
translated: Therefore, since it is said that the mind that thinks of the water is generated, it is ultimately existent.

original: bo cag la mi gnod de /
analyzed: bo cag la mi gnod de /
translated: You Followers of the Middle Way say that phenomena are not substantially existent, using as an example a vase. If you are refuting substantial existence in the sense of the substantial existence defined in our Abhidharma, then your refutation does not undermine us.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar bum pa zhig pa dang blos gzhan sel ba na de dag la de dag nyid kyi blo skye ba med pas de dag kun rdzob tu btags par yod yin du zin kyang bum pa zhig pa dang / blos gzhan bstsal ba de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs gyo mo dang chu dag la de dag gi blo skye ba yod pas de don dam par rdzas su yod pa'i phyir te des na ji ltar gyo mo dang chu dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa de
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa zhig pa dang blos gzhan sel ba na de dag la de dag nyid kyi blo skye ba med pas de dag kun rdzob tu btags par yod yin du zin kyang bum pa zhig pa dang / blos gzhan bstsal ba de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs gyo mo dang chu dag la de dag gi blo skye ba yod pas de don dam par rdzas su yod pa'i phyir te des na ji ltar gyo mo dang chu dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa de
translated: Thus, when a vase is destroyed and when the mind eliminates other things, the mind that conceives of those things does not arise. Therefore, although they exist as imputedly existent conventional things, the mind that conceives of those things arises in relation to the form of the vase‚Äôs fragments and the water, which are other than the destroyed vase and the mind that eliminates other things. Therefore they exist as ultimately substantially existent things.

original: bzhin du bum pa ma zhig pa dang / rgya mtsho dang lteng ka blos ma bstsal ba dag kyang don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes smras pa des ji ltar gyo mo dang chu dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du bum pa ma zhig pa dang /
analyzed: bzhin du bum pa ma zhig pa dang / rgya mtsho dang lteng ka blos ma bstsal ba dag kyang don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes smras pa des ji ltar gyo mo dang chu dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du bum pa ma zhig pa dang /
translated: Thus, just as the fragments and the water are ultimately substantially existent things, the undestroyed vase and the ocean and the pool that are not eliminated by the mind are not ultimately substantially existent things.

original: rgya mtsho dang lteng ka blos ma bstsal ba dag kyang don dam par rdzas su yod do zhes dam bcas pa'i rdzas su yod pa de la chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pa bum pa lta bu dang blo gzhan sel ba
analyzed: rgya mtsho dang lteng ka blos ma bstsal ba dag kyang don dam par rdzas su yod do zhes dam bcas pa'i rdzas su yod pa de la chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pa bum pa lta bu dang blo gzhan sel ba
translated: and that the ocean and a pond that are not mentally distinguished are ultimately substantially existent.üîΩThe definition of substantial existence in the Abhidharma is that which does not have the cognition of that when it is destroyed, like a pot, and that which does not have the cognition of that when another cognition is eliminated, like water.

original: la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu de ni kun rdzob tu btags par yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu de ni kun rdzob tu btags par yod pa yin gyi /
translated: That is imputedly existent in the conventional sense,üîΩbut it is not ultimately substantially existent.

original: don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid des gnod pa'i phyir bum pa ma zhig pa dang / rgya mtsho dang lteng ka blos ma bstsal ba dag dang gyo mo dang chu dag spyir mtshan nyid 'dra bar rdzas su yod par mi 'grub pas pha rol po dag gi rtog pa de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid des gnod pa'i phyir bum pa ma zhig pa dang / rgya mtsho dang lteng ka blos ma bstsal ba dag dang gyo mo dang chu dag spyir mtshan nyid 'dra bar rdzas su yod par mi 'grub pas pha rol po dag gi rtog pa de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Since that definition contradicts the non-destruction of a pot, the ocean and a pond that are not mentally distinguished, and a shard and water in general, it is not tenable that they are established as substantially existent.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that, he says:

original: gang zhig pa de rdzas su yod pa la gnod pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang zhig pa de rdzas su yod pa la gnod pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But if it is destroyed, it is undermined as substantially existent.üîΩThis shows that the characteristics of the Abhidharma undermine the assertion that when a pot is destroyed, the cognition of potsherds arises because potsherds substantially exist.

original: des ni pha rol po dag bum pa zhig pa na gyo mo la gyo mo'i blo skye bas gyo mo de rdzas su yod par 'dod pa la chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las bum pa zhig pa la bum pa'i blo skye ba med pas bum pa zhig pa
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag bum pa zhig pa na gyo mo la gyo mo'i blo skye bas gyo mo de rdzas su yod par 'dod pa la chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las bum pa zhig pa la bum pa'i blo skye ba med pas bum pa zhig pa
translated: The Abhidharma states that when a pot is destroyed, the cognition of a pot does not arise.

original: de kun rdzob tu btags par yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de kun rdzob tu btags par yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, a destroyed potüîΩexists as a conventional designation.

original: don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid des gnod pa nyid do zhes ston to //
analyzed: don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid des gnod pa nyid do zhes ston to //
translated: It does not substantially exist ultimately.

original: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te /üîΩde gang gi tshe bum pa zhig pa de la bum pa'i blo mi skye bas de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phyis gyo mo de zhig par gyur pa na yang de la gyo mo'i blo mi skye bas de yang rdzas su yod pa
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te / de gang gi tshe bum pa zhig pa de la bum pa'i blo mi skye bas de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phyis gyo mo de zhig par gyur pa na yang de la gyo mo'i blo mi skye bas de yang rdzas su yod pa
translated: This is how it should be applied.üîΩWhen a pot is destroyed, the cognition of a pot does not arise, so it does not substantially exist.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, when potsherds are destroyed later, the cognition of potsherds does not arise, so they also do not substantially exist.

original: de bzhin du phyis nam zhig na gyo mo de'i gyo du ma zhig par gyur pa na yang de la de'i blo mi skye bas de yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /üîΩtshul 'dis bsgres nas gyo du ma de'i cha @175a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyis nam zhig na gyo mo de'i gyo du ma zhig par gyur pa na yang de la de'i blo mi skye bas de yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin te / tshul 'dis bsgres nas gyo du ma de'i cha @175a * //
translated: Likewise, later when the pot is destroyed and the shards are reduced to dust, the cognition of a pot does not arise. Therefore, it does not substantially exist.üîΩBy this method, when the pot is destroyed and the shards are reduced to dust, the cognition of shards does not arise.üîΩTherefore, they do not substantially exist.üîΩWhen the pot is destroyed, the opponent asserts that the pot is destroyed and that the form that is different from that, such as the shards,

original: shas dum grugs dang / rdul dang rdul phra mo dang rdul phra rab dang / phyogs cha med pa'i rdul gyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag zhig par gyur pa na yang de dag la de dag gi blo mi skye bas de dag kyang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gis bum pa zhig pa de las gzhan pa'i gzugs
analyzed: shas dum grugs dang / rdul dang rdul phra mo dang rdul phra rab dang / phyogs cha med pa'i rdul gyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag zhig par gyur pa na yang de dag la de dag gi blo mi skye bas de dag kyang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gis bum pa zhig pa de las gzhan pa'i gzugs
translated: substantially exist ultimately, because the cognition of those arises.

original: gyo mo la sogs pa gang dag la de dag gi blo skye ba yod pa de dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du bum pa ma zhig pa yang rdzas su yod par dam bcas pa de la chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid des gnod pa'i
analyzed: gyo mo la sogs pa gang dag la de dag gi blo skye ba yod pa de dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du bum pa ma zhig pa yang rdzas su yod par dam bcas pa de la chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid des gnod pa'i
translated: The assertion that the undestroyed pot substantially exists is undermined by the characteristics of Abhidharma.

original: phyir pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de ma grub pas bstan bcos mdzad pas dper na bum pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa 'grub bo
analyzed: phyir pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de ma grub pas bstan bcos mdzad pas dper na bum pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa 'grub bo
translated: Since the opponent's thesis is not established, the treatise master's intention in saying, for example, just as a vase does not substantially exist, so the Tathagata does not substantially exist is established.

original: / 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces bum pa dang gyo mo la sogs pa dag zhig pa la de dag gi blo mi skyes bas de dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: / 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces bum pa dang gyo mo la sogs pa dag zhig pa la de dag gi blo mi skyes bas de dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: Here, if the opponent says, it is true that since the cognition of those things such as a vase and potsherds does not arise in their disintegration, they do not substantially exist ultimately,

original: 'on kyang de dag ma zhig pa la de dag gi blo skye ba yod pas ma zhig pa de dag don dam par rdzas su yod par chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las 'byung ba khyed mi 'dod na ni de lta na khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ma zhig pa la de dag gi blo skye ba yod pas ma zhig pa de dag don dam par rdzas su yod par chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las 'byung ba khyed mi 'dod na ni de lta na khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur
translated: but since the cognition of those things does arise in their nondisintegration, if you do not accept that nondisintegration substantially exists ultimately, as the Abhidharmako≈õa states, then your assertion is undermined.

original: ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The Commentary, which is a response to the opponent‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄúIt is a corpse,‚ÄùüîΩsays, ‚ÄúBecause it is ascertained that the cognition of that does not exist,‚Äù

original: de'i blo med pa zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir gang ma zhig pa de la yang de'i blo med do zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i blo med pa zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir gang ma zhig pa de la yang de'i blo med do zhes smras te /
translated: and ‚ÄúThe cognition of that does not exist even in that which is not destroyed.‚Äù

original: yang gi sbras ni gang zhig pa de la yang de'i blo med do zhes bya ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: yang gi sbras ni gang zhig pa de la yang de'i blo med do zhes bya ba bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù includes the statement, ‚ÄúThe cognition of that does not exist even in that which is destroyed.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: chos mngon pa yi mtshan nyid las //
analyzed: chos mngon pa yi mtshan nyid las //
translated: In the Abhidharmako≈õa it says:

original: gang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la ;
analyzed: gang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la ;
translated: That which is the object of a cognition that excludes other

original: ; de'i blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
analyzed: ; de'i blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
translated: Does not have that cognition, like a pot or water.

original: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //
translated: That is a conventional existent.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i skabs kyi de'i blo med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra kho bos 'dir nges par gzung ba'i phyir /üîΩgang zhig pa 'ba' zhig la de'i blo med par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i skabs kyi de'i blo med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra kho bos 'dir nges par gzung ba'i phyir / gang zhig pa 'ba' zhig la de'i blo med par ma zad kyi /
translated: Because I have ascertained the term ‚Äúthe cognition of that does not exist‚Äù in this passage,üîΩit is not only the case that the cognition of that does not exist in that which is destroyed.

original: gang ma zhig pa de la yang de'i blo med par 'dra bas /
analyzed: gang ma zhig pa de la yang de'i blo med par 'dra bas /
translated: The cognition of that does not exist in that which is not destroyed as well.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pa gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pas de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa bzhin du gang ma zhig pa la yang de'i blo med pas de yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par don dam pa'i chos mngon pa 'di
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pa gang zhig pa la de'i blo med pas de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa bzhin du gang ma zhig pa la yang de'i blo med pas de yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par don dam pa'i chos mngon pa 'di
translated: Therefore, just as a vase and so on that has ceased does not have the cognition of it, it does not substantially exist. Likewise, just as a vase and so on that has not ceased does not have the cognition of it, it does not substantially exist.

original: nyid kyi tshul gyis mngon par khas blangs pa la gnod par @175b mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nyid kyi tshul gyis mngon par khas blangs pa la gnod par @175b mi 'gyur /
translated: This is the mode of the Abhidharma of the ultimate, and it is not undermined by the assertion of this.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re /
translated: Here, if the opponent says,

original: de ltar gang zhig pa dang ma zhig pa de la de'i blo skye ba med pas de rdzas su yod pa ma yin du zin kyang blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pa de las gzhan pa blo ma bstsal ba la de'i blo skye ba yod pa
analyzed: de ltar gang zhig pa dang ma zhig pa de la de'i blo skye ba med pas de rdzas su yod pa ma yin du zin kyang blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pa de las gzhan pa blo ma bstsal ba la de'i blo skye ba yod pa
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough that which has ceased and that which has not ceased do not have the cognition of it, they do not substantially exist. However, the cognition that excludes other objects from that does not have the cognition of it. That which has the cognition of it, which is not the cognition that excludes other objects from it,üîΩdoes substantially exist in the ultimate.‚Äù

original: de don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary here raises this opponent‚Äôs position from within.

original: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gzhan dag sel ba la gzhan sel ba zhes bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gzhan dag sel ba la gzhan sel ba zhes bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is asserted that the exclusion of other that possesses appropriation is called the exclusion of other.

original: 'dis ni ji ltar zhig pa dang ma zhig pa de la de'i blo skye ba med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blos gzhan bstsal ba dang ma bstsal ba la yang de'i blo skye ba med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin noüîΩzhes ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ji ltar zhig pa dang ma zhig pa de la de'i blo skye ba med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blos gzhan bstsal ba dang ma bstsal ba la yang de'i blo skye ba med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that just as the cognition of disintegration and nondisintegration does not arise in regard to that, it does not substantially exist, so too the cognition of the exclusion and nonexclusion of other by the mind does not arise, and therefore it does not substantially exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩThe Madhyamaka system is as follows. Just as the meaning of the exclusion of other is the ultimate nonarising of the entity of things,

original: dbu ma pa ni gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba'i don ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo nyid don dam par skye ba med par bstsal ba bzhin du dngos po nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa gzhan dag kyang don dam par skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis
analyzed: dbu ma pa ni gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba'i don ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo nyid don dam par skye ba med par bstsal ba bzhin du dngos po nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa gzhan dag kyang don dam par skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis
translated: so too other things that possess appropriation are the ultimate nonarising of things.

original: sel ba gzhan sel ba zhes bya bar 'dod pas des na blos gzhan bstsal ba la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las gzhan pa blos ma bstsal ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sel ba gzhan sel ba zhes bya bar 'dod pas des na blos gzhan bstsal ba la de'i blo med pa chu lta bu de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las gzhan pa blos ma bstsal ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the exclusion of other is asserted to be the exclusion of other, the cognition of that does not exist in the exclusion of other by the mind, just as in water.üîΩJust as the cognition of that does not exist in the exclusion of other by the mind, and it does not ultimately exist substantially, in the same way, the cognition of that does not exist in the nonexclusion of other by the mind.

original: ji ltar blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pas don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blos gzhan ma bstsal ba la yang de'i blo med par 'dra bas de yang don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar blos gzhan sel ba la de'i blo med pas don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blos gzhan ma bstsal ba la yang de'i blo med par 'dra bas de yang don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is similar, it also does not ultimately exist substantially.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: don dam par bum pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par bum pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: A vase ultimately exists substantially.

original: shes bya yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin te /
analyzed: shes bya yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin te /
translated: Because it is an object of knowledge, like form.

original: shes par bya ba yin pas rdzas de shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes par bya ba yin pas rdzas de shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since it is an object of knowledge, that substance is an object of knowledge, which is synonymous with an object of comprehension.

original: 'dir chos mngon pa bdag nyid brda sprod pa'i tha ma lag gi rjes su zhugs nas dbu ma pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong par skyon 'dogs shing bum
analyzed: 'dir chos mngon pa bdag nyid brda sprod pa'i tha ma lag gi rjes su zhugs nas dbu ma pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong par skyon 'dogs shing bum
translated: Here, the Abhidharmikas, following the last of the grammarians, find fault with the example, saying that the example, ‚Äúbecause it does not substantially exist, like a pot,‚Äù is empty of the predicate of the probandum.üîΩ

original: pa rdzas su yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: pa rdzas su yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Here, the master of the Abhidharma, following the last of the grammarians, criticizes the example, ‚ÄúBecause it does not substantially exist, like a pot,‚Äù that the MƒÅdhyamika states, and he sets forth an inference that proves that a pot substantially exists.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: This is because those are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the reason, the example, and the application of the example, respectively.

original: dper na gzugs ni shes bya yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa yin pa @176a * //
analyzed: dper na gzugs ni shes bya yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa yin pa @176a * //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúBecause form is an object of knowledge, it substantially exists.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du bum pa yang shes bya yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa yang shes bya yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, ‚ÄúBecause a pot is an object of knowledge, it substantially exists.‚Äù

original: shes bya yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rdzas su yod pa yin par ji ltar sgrub ce na /
analyzed: shes bya yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rdzas su yod pa yin par ji ltar sgrub ce na /
translated: How does the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is an object of knowledge,‚Äù prove that it substantially exists?

original: de'i nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba ni shes par bya ba yin pas rdzas de shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: de'i nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba ni shes par bya ba yin pas rdzas de shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don yin la /
translated: Since it is to be known through the application of that, the object of knowledge is the meaning of the term to be understood.

original: de ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And since that is a substance, it is connected to the statement, ‚Äúbecause it exists as a substance.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of that,

original: mtshan nyid las shes par bya ba'i skad kyi byings dag ni rtogs par bya ba'i don yin par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid las shes par bya ba'i skad kyi byings dag ni rtogs par bya ba'i don yin par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause the verbal roots that are to be known from the definitions of grammar have the meaning of to be understood.‚Äù

original: brda sprod pa'i mtshan nyid las shes par bya ba'i skad kyi byings dag ni rtogs par bya ba'i don yin par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brda sprod pa'i mtshan nyid las shes par bya ba'i skad kyi byings dag ni rtogs par bya ba'i don yin par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the verbal roots that are to be known from the definitions of grammar have the meaning of to be understood.

original: 'dir yang shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'i don yin la /
translated: Here, that which is to be known has the meaning of to be understood.

original: de ni rdzas yin pas de'i phyir shes bya yin pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs kyis rdzas su yod pa yin par sgrub tu rung bas /
analyzed: de ni rdzas yin pas de'i phyir shes bya yin pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs kyis rdzas su yod pa yin par sgrub tu rung bas /
translated: Since that is a substance, it is suitable to prove that it exists as a substance by means of the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is an object of knowledge.‚Äù

original: des na gzugs dang bum pa dag shes bya yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: des na gzugs dang bum pa dag shes bya yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub po //
translated: Therefore, since form and pots are objects of knowledge, they are established as substantially existent.

original: de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the summary of that,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub pas bum pa dang chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khungs kyang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub pas bum pa dang chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khungs kyang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: since pots and so on are also established as substantially existent, like pots and water, there is no source for the statement, ‚ÄúThey exist conventionally.‚Äù

original: de ltar brda sprod pa ba'i tha ma lag gis bum pa dang gzugs dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub pas /
analyzed: de ltar brda sprod pa ba'i tha ma lag gis bum pa dang gzugs dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub pas /
translated: Thus since pots and form are established as substantially existent by the last grammarian‚Äôs hand,

original: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las /üîΩgang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las / gang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la //
translated: the definition of AbhidharmaüîΩis stated:üîΩThat which is excluded by the mind from another

original: de'i blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
analyzed: de'i blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
translated: is like a pot and water.

original: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //üîΩzhes 'byung ba de yang 'dir re zhig khungs su mi bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin // zhes 'byung ba de yang 'dir re zhig khungs su mi bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: That is conventional existence.üîΩTherefore that is not a source here.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThat is not good.

original: don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But the example does not exist, because form does not exist substantially in the ultimate.

original: pha rol po dag brda sprod pa pa'i tham lag gi rjes su zhugs nas rang gi lung bor te byung rgyal ji skad smras su zin kyang kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po
analyzed: pha rol po dag brda sprod pa pa'i tham lag gi rjes su zhugs nas rang gi lung bor te byung rgyal ji skad smras su zin kyang kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po
translated: The opponent, following the lead of the grammarians, has abandoned his own scriptures and speaks whatever comes to mind. But in our system, the example does not exist, because form does not exist substantially in the ultimate.

original: dag gis dper na gzugs bzhin te zhes smras pa'i dpe med pas bum pa yang rdzas su yod par ma grub bo //
analyzed: dag gis dper na gzugs bzhin te zhes smras pa'i dpe med pas bum pa yang rdzas su yod par ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the opponent says, ‚ÄúFor example, like form,‚Äù the example does not exist, and therefore a pot does not exist substantially.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la ni chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la ni chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las /
translated: Therefore, for us, the source text of the Abhidharma is not nonexistent, as it says:

original: gang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la //
analyzed: gang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la //
translated: That which is excluded by the mind from another

original: de'i blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
analyzed: de'i blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
translated: Is not the mind, like a pot or water.

original: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'i @176b khungs de yang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin // zhes bya ba'i @176b khungs de yang med pa ma yin no //
translated: That is conventional existence.

original: da ni de ltar don dam pa pa'i chos mngon pa'i tshul grub mod kyi /
analyzed: da ni de ltar don dam pa pa'i chos mngon pa'i tshul grub mod kyi /
translated: Now, although the system of ultimate Abhidharma is established in that way,

original: kun rdzob pa'i chos mngon pa'i tshul yang kho bo cag khas len pas de nyid chos mngon pa la mi mkhas pa khyed nyon cig ces bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i chos mngon pa'i tshul yang kho bo cag khas len pas de nyid chos mngon pa la mi mkhas pa khyed nyon cig ces bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since we also accept the system of the Abhidharma of conventional phenomena, listen to you who are unskilled in the Abhidharma.üîΩConventionally, all things are imputedly existent by the characteristics as they are described.

original: tha snyad du ni mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad btags par yod pa nyid yin yang gang zhig kyang de'i blo mi 'jig pa de ni rdzas su yod pa yin la /
analyzed: tha snyad du ni mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad btags par yod pa nyid yin yang gang zhig kyang de'i blo mi 'jig pa de ni rdzas su yod pa yin la /
translated: However, that which does not destroy the mind that conceives them to be substantially existent is substantially existent.

original: gang zhig pa na de'i blo med pa de ni btags par yod pa yin par rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang zhig pa na de'i blo med pa de ni btags par yod pa yin par rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That which does destroy the mind that conceives them to be substantially existent is imputedly existent.üîΩThis is the presentation.

original: tha snyad du ni chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las /üîΩgang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la//
analyzed: tha snyad du ni chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las / gang zhig blos gzhan sel ba la//
translated: Conventionally, the characteristics of Abhidharma are as they are described:üîΩThat which is excluded by the mindüîΩfrom that which is not that

original: de'i blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
analyzed: de'i blo med pa bum chu bzhin //
translated: is like a pot or water.

original: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //üîΩzhes ji skad smras pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin // zhes ji skad smras pa nyid kyis /
translated: That is conventional existence.üîΩThus all things are imputedly existent.

original: dngos po thams cad btags par yod pa nyid yin yang de la bye brag tu dbye na /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad btags par yod pa nyid yin yang de la bye brag tu dbye na /
translated: However, if they are classified, there are two types.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gang zhig kyang gyo mo la sogs pa de'i blo mi 'jig pa'i gyo mo la sogs pa de ni rdzas su yod pa yin la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gang zhig kyang gyo mo la sogs pa de'i blo mi 'jig pa'i gyo mo la sogs pa de ni rdzas su yod pa yin la /
translated: Whatever thing, such as a vase, is destroyed by the cognition of its disintegration, such as shards, is imputedly existent.

original: bum pa la sogs pa gang zhig pa na bum pa la sogs pa de'i blo med pa'i zhig pa de ni btags par yod pa yin par rnam par gzhag pas des na kun rdzob tu chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gang zhig pa na bum pa la sogs pa de'i blo med pa'i zhig pa de ni btags par yod pa yin par rnam par gzhag pas des na kun rdzob tu chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Since this is posited, it is not contradictory to the definition of Abhidharma in terms of the conventional.üîΩSince nonthings are objects of knowledge in the manner of nonthings, they are not substantially existent.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyi shes bya yin yang rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gis gtan tshigs shes bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de maüîΩnges pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyi shes bya yin yang rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gis gtan tshigs shes bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de maüîΩnges pa nyid du ston te /
translated: This shows that the reason, because it is an object of knowledge, is not established for the opponent.

original: 'dir na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa dag kyang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis shes bya yin yang rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig shes bya yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin du bum pa rdzasüîΩsu yod par 'gyur ram /üîΩ'on te shes bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa dag kyang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis shes bya yin yang rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig shes bya yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin du bum pa rdzas su yod par 'gyur ram / 'on te shes bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, is a pot substantially existent like form because it is an object of knowledge?üîΩOr is a pot not substantially existent like the horns of a rabbit because it is an object of knowledge?

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du bum pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du bum pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is not definite, the opponent‚Äôs reason is not correct.

original: da rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtogs na ni grags pa dang lung gis gnod par 'gyur bas de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: da rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtogs na ni grags pa dang lung gis gnod par 'gyur bas de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni /
translated: If you realize it to be substantially existent, that is illogical because it is undermined by what is renowned and scripture.

original: gal te pha rol po dag shes par bya ba yin pas rdzas de zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa de dag kyang rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtog na ni 'jig rten la grags @177a * //
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag shes par bya ba yin pas rdzas de zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa de dag kyang rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtog na ni 'jig rten la grags @177a * //
translated: If you think that since the other party is to be understood, the words that thing refer to nonthings such as the horns of a rabbit and so on as substantially existent, then that is not so.üîΩ

original: pa dang / lung gis gnod par 'gyur bas de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: pa dang / lung gis gnod par 'gyur bas de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: If the opponent thinks that the words ‚Äúthat substance‚Äù refer to non-things such as the horns of a rabbit, and so on, and that they exist substantially because they are objects of knowledge, then this is illogical because it is undermined by what is renowned in the world and by scripture.

original: de ltar bum pa rdzas su yod par ma grub pas bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: de ltar bum pa rdzas su yod par ma grub pas bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: Thus, since the existence of a vase as a substance is not established, the author of the treatise teaches:üîΩJust as a vase does not exist as a substance, so too the TathƒÅgata does not exist as a substance.

original: dper na bum pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub po //
analyzed: dper na bum pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub po //
translated: The intended meaning of that statement is established.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: phung po lnga ni gdags par bya ba yin yang ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni gdags par bya ba yin yang ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The five aggregates are imputed, but they do not exist intrinsically.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs par gdags pa'i brjod par bya ba yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa de'i ngo bo nyid bcos ma ma yin pa gang yin pa blo la nges par gzhag nas /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs par gdags pa'i brjod par bya ba yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa de'i ngo bo nyid bcos ma ma yin pa gang yin pa blo la nges par gzhag nas /
translated: Moreover, since the Tathagata is the object of designation, one should ascertain the unfabricated essence of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med do zhes sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin te /üîΩphung po rnams byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag sngar dbu ma pas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med de gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med do zhes sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin te / phung po rnams byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag sngar dbu ma pas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med de gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir
translated: Moreover, since the TathƒÅgata is an object of designation, if you posit the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs unfabricated essence in the mind and then prove that the TathƒÅgata is essenceless, that is not proving what has not been established.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúbecause the aggregates are produced‚Äù and so on is as follows.üîΩThe Proponents of the Existence of Essence say that the above argument and example prove that the TathƒÅgata who is the imagined nature is essenceless.

original: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe de dag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe de dag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
translated: However, if the argument and example prove that the TathƒÅgata who is the dependent nature is essenceless, then it is proving what has already been established.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni dpe med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni dpe med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: If you are proving that the reality of the dependent nature is not a TathƒÅgata, then there is no example.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They say:

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga ni de dag la de bzhin gshegs par gdags par bya ba yin yang de dag la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga ni de dag la de bzhin gshegs par gdags par bya ba yin yang de dag la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par zad kyi /
translated: The five aggregates are what is designated as the TathƒÅgata, but they are exhausted in the absence of the imagined nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no //üîΩde la da khyed dbu ma pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa de'i ngo bo nyid bcos ma ma yin pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes blo la nges par
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no // de la da khyed dbu ma pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa de'i ngo bo nyid bcos ma ma yin pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes blo la nges par
translated: They are not absent in the dependent nature.üîΩYou MƒÅdhyamikas, having ascertained in your minds that the reality of the TathƒÅgata, which is not fabricated, the dependent nature, is not realityless,

original: bzhag nas / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bcos ma de ngo bo nyid med do zhes sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te //
analyzed: bzhag nas / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bcos ma de ngo bo nyid med do zhes sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te //
translated: if you prove that the fabricated TathƒÅgata, which is the imagined nature, is realityless, then that is proving what is already established.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag la yang phung po rnams kun brtags pa'i 'khrul pas byas shing bskyed pa'i phyir de dag la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag la yang phung po rnams kun brtags pa'i 'khrul pas byas shing bskyed pa'i phyir de dag la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, for us, the aggregates are established as lacking an imagined reality, because they are produced and generated by the error of imagination.

original: de bas na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if you are proving that the TathƒÅgata lacks an imagined reality, then you are proving what is already established.

original: 'on te gzhan @177b las byung ba'i dngos po rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag las byung zhing skyes pa bdag nyid thob pa gang yin pa la 'gog par byed na ni 'o na de ni dpe med de /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan @177b las byung ba'i dngos po rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag las byung zhing skyes pa bdag nyid thob pa gang yin pa la 'gog par byed na ni 'o na de ni dpe med de /
translated: But if you are refuting that which is produced from other, that which is born and obtains its own nature from other causes and conditions, then there is no example.

original: dngos po thams cad ni gzhan las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo dang bcas pa yin pas 'di ltar kho bo cag ni mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin gzugs la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni gzhan las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo dang bcas pa yin pas 'di ltar kho bo cag ni mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin gzugs la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod
translated: Because all things have an intrinsic reality that is characterized by being produced from other, therefore we are like the wheel of a firebrand, and the eye consciousness and so on, without conceptualization, perceive form and so on.

original: yul gang dag yin pa de dag ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa kho na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni dpe med par ston te /üîΩde dag na re /
analyzed: yul gang dag yin pa de dag ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa kho na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni dpe med par ston te / de dag na re /
translated: This shows that if you prove that the TathaÃÑgata who is the dependent nature is essenceless, then you have no example.

original: khyod kyi gtan tshigs dang dpe des gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan las byung ba'i dngos po rgyu dang rkyen gzhan las byung zhing skyes pa bdag nyid thob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'gog par byed na ni /
analyzed: khyod kyi gtan tshigs dang dpe des gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan las byung ba'i dngos po rgyu dang rkyen gzhan las byung zhing skyes pa bdag nyid thob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'gog par byed na ni /
translated: They say that if your example and reason refute the TathaÃÑgata who is the dependent nature, who arises from other, that is, from causes and conditions, and who has attained his own state,

original: des na khyed kyi dpe mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no zhes bya ba de med de 'di ltar dngos po thams cad ni rkyen gzhan las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas rang gi ngo bo nyid las ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid
analyzed: des na khyed kyi dpe mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no zhes bya ba de med de 'di ltar dngos po thams cad ni rkyen gzhan las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas rang gi ngo bo nyid las ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid
translated: then your example of the circle of a whirling firebrand is not established, because all things are characterized by arising from other conditions, and therefore do not arise from their own nature.üîΩThus, arising is essenceless.

original: yin du zin kyang gzhan gyi dbang gis byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa yin pas /
analyzed: yin du zin kyang gzhan gyi dbang gis byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa yin pas /
translated: But since it does have an essential nature that arises in dependence on other factors, it does have an essential nature.

original: des na 'di ltar kho bo cag ni mgal me'i 'khor lo gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa dang bral ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid don dam par yang ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar kho bo cag ni mgal me'i 'khor lo gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa dang bral ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid don dam par yang ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pas /
translated: Therefore, we do not have the fault that you attribute to us, namely, that we would have no example of something that is essentially natureless because essentially natureless, but is designated as natureless due to being dependent on other factors, like the circle of a whirling firebrand, a sound, a smell, a taste, a tangible object, the eye consciousness, the ear consciousness, the nose consciousness, the tongue consciousness, and the body consciousness, which are all free of conceptualization, free of the imagined, and have an essential nature that is dependent on other factors.

original: des na khyed kyi gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med de dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe med do //
analyzed: des na khyed kyi gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med de dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe med do //
translated: Therefore, you have no example for your claim that ‚Äúit is natureless because it is an object of designation,‚Äù like the circle of a whirling firebrand.

original: de ltar na grub pa la sgrub na yang gtan tshigs skyon chags pa yin la dpe med na yang sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na grub pa la sgrub na yang gtan tshigs skyon chags pa yin la dpe med na yang sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, if you establish what is already established, your reason is faulty. And if you have no example, your proof is faulty because it lacks an example. Therefore, because the Madhyamaka reason is not established,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: the TathƒÅgata who is the dependent nature is not ultimately natureless.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not good.‚Äù

original: dbu ma pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig don dam par ngo bo nyid med par @178a * //üîΩmi sgrub pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba'i lan ni gdab mi dgos so //
analyzed: dbu ma pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig don dam par ngo bo nyid med par @178a * // mi sgrub pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba'i lan ni gdab mi dgos so //
translated: Because the Madhyamaka does not establish that only the TathƒÅgata who is an imagined nature is ultimately natureless,üîΩit is not necessary to respond to the statement that it is the establishment of what is already established.

original: dpe med de zhes zer ba'i lan gdab bar bya ste /
analyzed: dpe med de zhes zer ba'i lan gdab bar bya ste /
translated: But we must respond to the statement that there is no example.

original: pha rol po dag gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa don dam par ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod cing mgal me'i 'khor lo'i gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa dang / dbu ma pa'i dpe med de zhes zer ba de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa don dam par ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod cing mgal me'i 'khor lo'i gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa dang / dbu ma pa'i dpe med de zhes zer ba de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe Madhyamaka example does not exist.‚ÄùüîΩThis is not good.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dir mgal me'i 'khor lo nyid ni 'khrul pa ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir mgal me'i 'khor lo nyid ni 'khrul pa ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here it is said, ‚ÄúThe fire wheel itself is an illusion.‚Äù

original: mgal me gcig 'greng gi rtse mo la 'khor lo med bzhin du myur du bskor ba'i dbang gis 'khor lo 'dra bar mthong ba ni 'khrul pa yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mgal me gcig 'greng gi rtse mo la 'khor lo med bzhin du myur du bskor ba'i dbang gis 'khor lo 'dra bar mthong ba ni 'khrul pa yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
translated: The fire wheel is an illusion because, although there is no wheel on the tip of a single burning piece of wood, due to its rapid spinning, it appears as if there is a wheel. Since it is seen as an illusion, it is not the case that my example does not exist.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that, he says:

original: dngos dang steng dang 'og gi nam mkha'i cha dang mgal me la 'khor lo'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩde ltar nam mkha'i cha dang mgal me la 'khor lo'i ngo bo nyid med bzhin du brten nas 'khor lo gdags pa yin pas kho bo'i dpe grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos dang steng dang 'og gi nam mkha'i cha dang mgal me la 'khor lo'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te / de ltar nam mkha'i cha dang mgal me la 'khor lo'i ngo bo nyid med bzhin du brten nas 'khor lo gdags pa yin pas kho bo'i dpe grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the aspects of space above, below, and to the sides are empty of the entity of a wheel, and because a firebrand‚Äôs wheel is empty of the entity of a wheel, they are asserted to be just like the example.üîΩThus, because the aspects of space and a firebrand‚Äôs wheel are empty of the entity of a wheel, they are imputed in dependence on that.

original: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo ni brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do zhes dam bcas pa
analyzed: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo ni brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do zhes dam bcas pa
translated: For example, because a firebrand‚Äôs wheel is an object of imputation in dependence on that, it is essenceless. In the same way, because the TathƒÅgata is an object of imputation in dependence on the aggregates, he is essenceless.

original: grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: mgal me'i gzugs la sogs pa dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba yang dpe grub po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mgal me'i gzugs la sogs pa dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba yang dpe grub po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Because the arising of the form of a firebrand‚Äôs wheel and so on is refuted, the example is established.

original: gal te pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag na re /
translated: If the opponent says,

original: 'khor lo nyid med kyang mgal me'i gzugs la sogs pa yod pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par grub pas dbu ma pa'i dpe med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor lo nyid med kyang mgal me'i gzugs la sogs pa yod pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par grub pas dbu ma pa'i dpe med do zhe na /
translated: The Madhyamikas have no example.

original: de ni kho bos sngar skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par bkag zin pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni kho bos sngar skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par bkag zin pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no //
translated: We have already refuted that in the chapter on nonarising, so it is not the case that they have no example.

original: rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause substantial existence is refuted‚Äù should be applied in the same way.

original: phung po brtag pa'i rab tu byed par rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po brtag pa'i rab tu byed par rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because substantial existence is refuted in the chapter on the aggregates.

original: de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa de dag gang mig gi blta ba dgag pa bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa de dag gang mig gi blta ba dgag pa bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the objects of eye consciousness and so on are refuted in the same way as the eye‚Äôs seeing is refuted‚Äù should be applied in the same way.

original: sngar @178b pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: sngar @178b pha rol po dag na re /
translated: The opponent says:

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag ni mgal me'i 'khor lo'i gzugs la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gang dag yin pa de dag ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa kho na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag ni mgal me'i 'khor lo'i gzugs la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gang dag yin pa de dag ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa kho na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i
translated: Because we say that the forms and so on of a fire wheel are the objects of the nonconceptual eye consciousness and we assert that they do have intrinsic reality.

original: lan kyang yin te /
analyzed: lan kyang yin te /
translated: This is also a response to the objection.

original: de yang sngar skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed par bkag zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang sngar skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed par bkag zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because we have already refuted that in the chapter on the analysis of the senses and fields.

original: kho bo'i dpe grub pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag gi gzhung nyams shing bstan bcos mdzad pas dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo la ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la yang ngo bo nyid med do
analyzed: kho bo'i dpe grub pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag gi gzhung nyams shing bstan bcos mdzad pas dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo la ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la yang ngo bo nyid med do
translated: Since our example is established, the scriptures of those who propound that the dependent nature exists are undermined. The intention of the treatise is established. For example, just as a fire wheel has no intrinsic reality, the TathƒÅgata also has no intrinsic reality.

original: zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub po //üîΩre zhig de dag gis ni /üîΩgal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
analyzed: zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub po // re zhig de dag gis ni / gal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
translated: This is the refutation of the first part of the objection.üîΩIf the Buddha

original: brten nas ngo bo nyid las med //
analyzed: brten nas ngo bo nyid las med //
translated: depended on the aggregates, he would not exist by virtue of his own nature.

original: ces bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa byed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa byed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This verse composed by the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna demonstrates that the TathƒÅgata does not exist intrinsically.

original: da ni gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that he also does not exist extrinsically, he says:

original: ngo bo nyid las gang med pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las gang med pa //
translated: How could that which does not exist intrinsically

original: de gzhan dngos las gal yod /
analyzed: de gzhan dngos las gal yod /
translated: Exist extrinsically?

original: bdag gi dngos po'i dngos po gzhan la ltos nas gzhan nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po'i dngos po gzhan la ltos nas gzhan nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The point is that the status of being other is established in dependence on the status of being self.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod na de la ltos nas de'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya bar 'grub pas de gzhan gyi dngos po de las 'grub par yang 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod na de la ltos nas de'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya bar 'grub pas de gzhan gyi dngos po de las 'grub par yang 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the essence of the so-called TathƒÅgata existed intrinsically, then in dependence on that, its causes and conditions would be established as the status of being other. Therefore, it would also be established from that status of being other.

original: gal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
translated: If the Buddha were to exist in dependence on the aggregates,

original: brten nas ngo bo nyid las med //
analyzed: brten nas ngo bo nyid las med //
translated: He would not exist intrinsically.

original: ces bya ba'i rigs pas bdag gi dngos po med pas rgyu rkyen rnams kyang gzhan du ma grub pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang grub pa med do //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rigs pas bdag gi dngos po med pas rgyu rkyen rnams kyang gzhan du ma grub pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang grub pa med do //
translated: Since the self is not established, the causes and conditions are not established as other. Therefore, the TathƒÅgata is not established from the entity of other.üîΩMoreover, the section beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover‚Ä¶‚Äù shows another way to prove that it is untenable for the TathƒÅgata to be the self.

original: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba las sogs pas ni sngar gzhan dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas 'grub pa'i phyir kho bo cag la sgrub pa des mi gnod do zhes smras pa'i phyogs snga ma'i bsam pa blangs nas /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba las sogs pas ni sngar gzhan dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas 'grub pa'i phyir kho bo cag la sgrub pa des mi gnod do zhes smras pa'i phyogs snga ma'i bsam pa blangs nas /
translated: Previously, the opponent said, ‚ÄúSince the TathƒÅgata is established in dependence on the aggregates, our position is not undermined by that proof.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po la brten nas gdags pa yin na bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa sgrub pa rnam pa gzhan ston to //üîΩde la / gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos brten nas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po la brten nas gdags pa yin na bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa sgrub pa rnam pa gzhan ston to // de la / gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos brten nas //
translated: Here, the section beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover‚Ä¶‚Äù shows another way to prove that it is untenable for the TathƒÅgata to be the self.

original: gdags pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: gdags pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThat which is designated in dependence on other things‚Äù states the subject.

original: de bdag nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos so //
analyzed: de bdag nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos so //
