translated: The line ‚ÄúIt is not tenable for it to be that itself‚Äù states the probandum.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags @179a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags @179a * //
translated: It is imputed in dependence on other things.üîΩ

original: par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
analyzed: par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
translated: The reason is because it is to be designated in dependence on other things.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: The example is for example, a magical person.

original: de ni bdag nyid med de ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste /üîΩdper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni rma bya'i mdongs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyi
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid med de ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste / dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni rma bya'i mdongs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyi
translated: The conclusion is that is without self, without intrinsic nature.üîΩ For example, a magical person is not tenable as a self because it is to be designated in dependence on other things, such as the eyes of a peacock feather.

original: dbang gi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dbang gi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: Likewise, a tathƒÅgata is not tenable as a self because it is to be designated in dependence on other things, such as the aggregates.

original: gang brten nas gdags pa de ni bdag nyid med de ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang brten nas gdags pa de ni bdag nyid med de ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which is designated in dependence is without self, without intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar / gang zhig bdag nyid med pa de //
analyzed: de ltar / gang zhig bdag nyid med pa de //
translated: Thus, how could that which lacks intrinsic reality

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur //
translated: Become a tathagata?

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i dpe zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i dpe zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: The thought is that the example that proves that things exist by virtue of their own nature is not complete.

original: gang brten nas gdags ba ngo bo nyid med pa de ni don dam par yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i dpe de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: gang brten nas gdags ba ngo bo nyid med pa de ni don dam par yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i dpe de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i
translated: That which is dependently imputed and lacks intrinsic reality does not exist ultimately. Therefore, the example that the opponent uses to prove that things exist by virtue of their own nature, the so-called tathiigata, does not exist.

original: tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Therefore, the fault that the proof is incomplete still exists. This is the result of the valid cognition.

original: de ltar don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pas sngar pha rol po dag gis don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pas sngar pha rol po dag gis don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, since it is established that ultimately the tathiigata lacks intrinsic reality, the opponent's earlier claim that ultimately things such as form exist by virtue of their own nature is undermined.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon de nyid yod pas sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes dam bcasüîΩpa'i dgongs pa grub po //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon de nyid yod pas sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes dam bcas pa'i dgongs pa grub po //
translated: The example is incomplete, and so the intended meaning of the treatise author‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄúUltimately, things such as form are essenceless,‚Äù is established.

original: yang na pha rol po dag 'di skad ces ngo bo nyid las ma grub tu zin kyang gzhan gyi dngos po las grub pas dpe nyid grub pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar grub po zhes zer ba la 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: yang na pha rol po dag 'di skad ces ngo bo nyid las ma grub tu zin kyang gzhan gyi dngos po las grub pas dpe nyid grub pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar grub po zhes zer ba la 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Or, the opponent might say, ‚ÄúEven though they are not established from their own nature, they are established from the nature of something else. Therefore, since the example is established, things are only established as having essence.‚ÄùüîΩIn response to this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If they are essenceless,

original: gzhan dngos yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan dngos yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could they be other entities?

original: ngo bo nyid ma grub pa kho na'i phyir gzhan du 'dod pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa'i phyir de dag las byung ba gzhan gyi dngos po can de yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma grub pa kho na'i phyir gzhan du 'dod pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa'i phyir de dag las byung ba gzhan gyi dngos po can de yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Because they do not intrinsically exist, other things that are dependent on causes and conditions do not exist.

original: pha rol po dag de bzhin @179b gshegs pa zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo nyid las grub pa med kyang de'i gzhan gyi dngos po rgyud dang rkyen gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa nyid rab tu phye zhing mngon par byas pa byang chub tu byed pa'i
analyzed: pha rol po dag de bzhin @179b gshegs pa zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo nyid las grub pa med kyang de'i gzhan gyi dngos po rgyud dang rkyen gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa nyid rab tu phye zhing mngon par byas pa byang chub tu byed pa'i
translated: The opponent says that although the so called tathiigata does not exist by way of its own intrinsic reality, its otherness exists by way of its continuum and conditions, since those conditions and causes that are the factors that distinguish the tathiigata and make it manifest are the factors that create enlightenment.

original: chos sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa dag las grub pa des na de bzhin gshegs pa grub pas dpe grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes zer ba de dgag pa'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'di bshad de 'di ni de bzhin
analyzed: chos sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa dag las grub pa des na de bzhin gshegs pa grub pas dpe grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes zer ba de dgag pa'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'di bshad de 'di ni de bzhin
translated: The treatise was composed to refute the assertion that since the Tathagata is established from phenomena, the perfections, the factors of enlightenment, and so on, the example is established because the Tathagata is established, and thus the desired conclusion is established.

original: gshegs pa zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo nyid las grub pa med pas byang chub tu byed pa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan gyi dngos por mi 'grub pa'i phyir de dag las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa bstan to
analyzed: gshegs pa zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo nyid las grub pa med pas byang chub tu byed pa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan gyi dngos por mi 'grub pa'i phyir de dag las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa bstan to
translated: The first half of this verse is explained by the author of the treatise. It teaches the intention that since the so-called Tathagata does not exist by his own intrinsic reality, the phenomena that cause enlightenment are also not established as the entities of others, and therefore the Tathagata who arises from them also does not exist.

original: // de'i phyir dpe'i skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: // de'i phyir dpe'i skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Therefore, the fault of the example still exists. This is the result of the valid cognition.

original: don dam par byang chub tu byed pa'i chos rnams bkag pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pas bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dgongs pa grub par sbyar ro //
analyzed: don dam par byang chub tu byed pa'i chos rnams bkag pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pas bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dgongs pa grub par sbyar ro //
translated: The ultimate reality of the TathƒÅgata is established by the refutation of the phenomena that are taken to be enlightenment. Since the opponent‚Äôs example is flawed, it is incomplete. Therefore, the intention of the treatise is established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent might say,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid des par ma zin kyang yang yod pa'i phyir dpe grub pas skyon med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid des par ma zin kyang yang yod pa'i phyir dpe grub pas skyon med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though the essence of the TathƒÅgata is not ascertained, it still exists. Therefore, the example is established, and there is no fault.‚Äù

original: pha rol po dag na re /üîΩkho bo cag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid phung po rnams las de nyid dam gzhan nyid dam ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re / kho bo cag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid phung po rnams las de nyid dam gzhan nyid dam ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: The opponent might say,üîΩ‚ÄúWe do not ascertain the essence of the TathƒÅgata in terms of identity with the aggregates, difference from the aggregates, or the entity of the aggregates themselves.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po las grub pa'i dmigs pa nyid nges par ma zin pas shags ma thebs su zin kyang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po las grub pa'i dmigs pa nyid nges par ma zin pas shags ma thebs su zin kyang /
translated: We do not ascertain the object of observation that is established in terms of identity with the aggregates, difference from the aggregates, or the entity of the aggregates themselves. Therefore, we have not lost the debate.

original: yang ni bdag cag sangs rgyas pa rnams la ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa'i phyir dpe grub pas kho bo cag gi sgrub pa dpe ma tshangs pa'i skyon med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: yang ni bdag cag sangs rgyas pa rnams la ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa'i phyir dpe grub pas kho bo cag gi sgrub pa dpe ma tshangs pa'i skyon med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word again means that since we Buddhists have the Teacher, the TathƒÅgata, the example is established, so we have no fault of the example not being established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:üîΩWhat TathƒÅgata is there who has not realized

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma rtogs de bzhin gshegs de gang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma rtogs de bzhin gshegs de gang //
translated: own-nature and other-nature?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid de ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma rtogs pa'i dngos po ni don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid de ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma rtogs pa'i dngos po ni don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That is not so, because own-nature and other-nature are not established.  Since a thing that has not realized own-nature and other-nature is not established as ultimately existent, there is no fault.

original: yang 'jig rten 'di na dngos po zhig yod par gyur na bdag gi dngos po las 'grub pa ni /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten 'di na dngos po zhig yod par gyur na bdag gi dngos po las 'grub pa ni /
translated: If a thing exists in this world, it is established from its own nature.

original: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid lta bu yin /
analyzed: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid lta bu yin /
translated: For example, like the heat of fire.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po /
translated: Other-nature

original: @180a * // las 'grub pa ni dper na bum pa lta bu yin na /
analyzed: @180a * // las 'grub pa ni dper na bum pa lta bu yin na /
translated: If the establishment of the effect is like the example of a pot,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pas phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du yang ma grub la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pas phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du yang ma grub la /
translated: then the TathƒÅgata is not established as the same or different from the aggregates in the manner that has been explained.

original: nyid kyi bdag gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang ma grub na rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin te de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyid kyi bdag gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang ma grub na rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin te de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If he is not established as the entity of self or the entity of another, then what is the TathƒÅgata who is excluded from those aspects? He does not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon med pa ma yin te so na gnas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon med pa ma yin te so na gnas so //
translated: Since an entity that is excluded from the entity of self and the entity of another is not established as ultimately existent, your proof is not free from the fault of having an incomplete example.

original: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin te de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin te de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates, but he is not described as the same as or different from them.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore he is not the entity of the aggregates, nor is he the entity of something else.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa grub pas rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par ma grub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa grub pas rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par ma grub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, since the TathƒÅgata is established, things are not established as lacking entityness, as the inference that is taught.

original: 'dir nyan thos gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir nyan thos gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag na re /
translated: Here the Sthavira VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du grub pas kho bo cag gi dpe grub pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid duüîΩma grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du grub pas kho bo cag gi dpe grub pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ma grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Therefore, you Followers of the Middle Way say that things are not established as lacking an inherent nature by the autonomous reasonings you teach.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Is the TathƒÅgata or a non-TathƒÅgata

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin grang na zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩ'dis ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin grang na zhes bya ba smras te / 'dis ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa'am /
translated: designated in dependence on the aggregates?üîΩThis is saying, ‚ÄúIf ultimately the TathƒÅgata or a non-TathƒÅgata is designated in dependence on the aggregates,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin grang na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin grang na /
translated: then the TathƒÅgata would be established as either the same as or different from the aggregates.

original: rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: Both of these alternatives are untenable.üîΩThe first of these two analyses is untenable. To demonstrate this, the treatise states:üîΩIf the Thus-Gone is the aggregates,

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yin na ni de de la brten pa don med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yin na ni de de la brten pa don med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then the Thus-Gone is subject to destruction.üîΩIf the Thus-Gone is not the aggregates,üîΩthen the Thus-Gone is not the aggregates.üîΩIf the Thus-Gone is the aggregates, then the Thus-Gone is subject to destruction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du grub par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten @180b par bya ba yin na snga nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin na da de yang phung po rnams la brten pa don med pa nyid yin pas deüîΩni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du grub par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten @180b par bya ba yin na snga nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin na da de yang phung po rnams la brten pa don med pa nyid yin pas de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: If the Thus-Gone is not the aggregates, then the Thus-Gone is not the aggregates.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'on te de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin na ni de lta na yang //üîΩgal te phung po ma brten par //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / 'on te de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin na ni de lta na yang // gal te phung po ma brten par //
translated: The second analysis is untenable. To demonstrate this, the treatise states:üîΩIf the Thus-Gone is not the aggregates,üîΩthen the Thus-Gone is not the aggregates.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na //üîΩsnga rol bdag nyid gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na //üîΩsnga rol bdag nyid gzhan gyis so //
translated: If the Thus-Gone is not the aggregates,üîΩthen the Thus-Gone is not the aggregates.

original: de ni da gdod brten 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni da gdod brten 'gyur zhing //
translated: It would be dependent later,

original: brten nas de las 'gyur la rag / ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brten nas de las 'gyur la rag / ces bya ba smras te /
translated: and dependent on that, it would be the TathƒÅgata.

original: gal te phung po rnams la ma brten pa'i snga rol na de bzhin gshegs pa bdag nyid gzhan gyis gnas pa 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni de dag dod de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams la ma brten pa'i snga rol na de bzhin gshegs pa bdag nyid gzhan gyis gnas pa 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni de dag dod de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If the TathƒÅgata were to exist prior to his dependence on the aggregates, he would exist as something other than the TathƒÅgata.

original: brten nas brten pa'i gzhi de las de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur la rag go //üîΩgal te de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: brten nas brten pa'i gzhi de las de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur la rag go // gal te de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag na re /
translated: And dependent on that, dependent on the aggregates, he would be the TathƒÅgata.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúIt would be like that,‚Äù

original: de ltar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //üîΩde mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no // de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: this is the statement of the opponent.

original: phung po rnams lam brten par //
analyzed: phung po rnams lam brten par //
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is untenable, it says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not exist

original: nye bar len pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ma gtogs par //
translated: in dependence on the aggregates.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the TathƒÅgata is not establishedüîΩapart from the appropriated.

original: phung po rnams lam brten pa'i snga rol na de bzhin gshegs pa bdag nyid gzhan gyis gnas pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: phung po rnams lam brten pa'i snga rol na de bzhin gshegs pa bdag nyid gzhan gyis gnas pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Prior to the appropriation of the aggregates, the TathƒÅgata does not exist in any way whatsoever, either as identical with or as different from the self.

original: nye bar len pa ma gtogs par de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ma gtogs par de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the TathƒÅgata is not established apart from appropriation.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the TathƒÅgata does not exist in any way whatsoever, he is called ‚Äúnon-TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: And it is not tenable that he is imputed in dependence on the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs aggregates.

original: da ni de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan par bya ste /üîΩde la / gang zhig ma brten yod yin pa //
analyzed: da ni de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan par bya ste / de la / gang zhig ma brten yod yin pa //
translated: Now, the inference will be explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos can chos can no //üîΩdes ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos can chos can no // des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
translated: With respect to that, the subject is ‚Äúthat which exists without depending on anything else.‚Äù

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos so //
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos so //
translated: The predicate of the probandum is ‚Äúit does not appropriate the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs aggregates.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause he is not a tathƒÅgata‚Äù is the property to be established.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, like something else‚Äù is the example.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa so so'i skye bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩdes na de bzhin @181a * //
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa so so'i skye bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir / des na de bzhin @181a * //
translated: For example, because ordinary beings, who are other than a tathƒÅgata, are not tathƒÅgatas,üîΩthey do not take up the aggregates of a tathƒÅgata.

original: gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du gang zhig phung po rnams la ma brten par de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du gang zhig phung po rnams la ma brten par de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, because that which does not depend on the aggregates does not exist as the essence of a tathƒÅgata, it is not a tathƒÅgata.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed de ;üîΩnye bar len par mi byed pas brten par mi byed la /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed de ; nye bar len par mi byed pas brten par mi byed la /
translated: Therefore, it does not take up the aggregates of a tathƒÅgata.üîΩBecause it does not take them up, it does not depend on them.

original: brten par mi byed pas de dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pas pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: brten par mi byed pas de dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pas pha rol po dag na re /
translated: Because it does not depend on them, it is not something that is imputed in dependence on them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is to be designated in dependence on the aggregates.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ba'i dam bcas pa ma grub po //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ba'i dam bcas pa ma grub po //
translated: He is not to be described as the same or different.üîΩBut if you think that the TathƒÅgata is not the aggregates, but that the TathƒÅgata appropriates the aggregates and becomes the TathƒÅgata,

original: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing 'di skad ces /
analyzed: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing 'di skad ces /
translated: then you should say:üîΩThe TathƒÅgata does not exist

original: gal te phung po ma brten par //
analyzed: gal te phung po ma brten par //
translated: Without depending on the aggregates.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata would depend on them,üîΩAnd then he would change.üîΩIf you think that the TathƒÅgata is not the aggregates, but that the TathƒÅgata appropriates the aggregates and becomes the TathƒÅgata, then you should say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //üîΩde ni dag dod brten 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med // de ni dag dod brten 'gyur zhing //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not existüîΩWithout depending on the aggregates.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata would depend on them,

original: de nas de las 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes kyang zer na zhes bya ba ni ci ste /
analyzed: de nas de las 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes kyang zer na zhes bya ba ni ci ste /
translated: And then he would change.

original: pha rol po dag 'di snyam du gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la ma brten pa'i snga rol na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ma yin pa dper na 'phags pa byams pa lta bus mtshan dang dpe byed yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs bkang
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'di snyam du gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la ma brten pa'i snga rol na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ma yin pa dper na 'phags pa byams pa lta bus mtshan dang dpe byed yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs bkang
translated: The opponent thinks, ‚ÄúPrior to the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs reliance on the aggregates, the TathƒÅgata is not the TathƒÅgata, just like ƒÄrya Maitreya, who has not yet completed the accumulations that will perfect the major and minor marks of a buddha.üîΩAfter he has relied on the aggregates of a buddha, he will become the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: ste / de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: ste / de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: The treatise author wrote the above verses in order to refute that idea.üîΩIf the TathƒÅgata existed

original: gal te phung po ma brten par //
analyzed: gal te phung po ma brten par //
translated: Without relying on the aggregates,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na //üîΩde ni dag dod brten 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na // de ni dag dod brten 'gyur zhing //
translated: He would be the TathƒÅgata even without the aggregates,üîΩAnd he would become the TathƒÅgata through relying on the aggregates.

original: brten nas de las 'gyur la rag / ces gsungs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa de las bzlog pa 'di skad ces /
analyzed: brten nas de las 'gyur la rag / ces gsungs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa de las bzlog pa 'di skad ces /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is the opposite of that:üîΩIf the TathƒÅgata existed

original: gal te phung po ma brten par //
analyzed: gal te phung po ma brten par //
translated: Without relying on the aggregates,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
translated: He would be the TathƒÅgata even without the aggregates,

original: de ni dag dod brten 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni dag dod brten 'gyur zhing //
translated: And he would become the TathƒÅgata through relying on the aggregates.

original: brten nas de las 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes kyang zer na'o//
analyzed: brten nas de las 'gyur ba yin // zhes kyang zer na'o//
translated: and it is dependent on that.üîΩIf you think and say that,

original: de snyam du sems shing de skad zer ba de dag dgag pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de snyam du sems shing de skad zer ba de dag dgag pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: in order to refute that, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response to that, this is said:

original: ci ste phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
translated: Is the TathƒÅgata the entity of the aggregates?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩ'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa'i @181b phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin zhes bya ba smras te / 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa'i @181b phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
translated: Or is he the entity of something other than that?üîΩThis shows the two analyses: ‚ÄúIs the TathƒÅgata who is not the aggregates the entity of the aggregates of the TathƒÅgata?

original: 'on te de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po ma yin pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid gcig yin grang na gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: 'on te de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po ma yin pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid gcig yin grang na gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: Or is he the entity of something other than the aggregates of the TathƒÅgata?‚Äù Both are untenable.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that the first analysis is untenable, it says:

original: de la gal te phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni phyogs snga ma lan btab zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la gal te phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni phyogs snga ma lan btab zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, this is said: If he is the entity of the aggregates, the prior position has already been responded to.

original: phyogs de'i lan ni sngar de la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yin na ni de de la brten pa don med pa nyid do zhes bstan pas lan btab zin to //
analyzed: phyogs de'i lan ni sngar de la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yin na ni de de la brten pa don med pa nyid do zhes bstan pas lan btab zin to //
translated: The response to that position has already been given above: ‚ÄúIf it is the TathƒÅgata, then it is meaningless that he depends on that.‚ÄùüîΩTo demonstrate that the second

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: analysis is untenable, he says:

original: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it has a different nature, it does not exist,üîΩbecause it does not have the nature of the aggregates,

original: phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te //
analyzed: phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te //
translated: like, for example, the horn of a rabbit.üîΩThe subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: connected in order.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva ni phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid de yang phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva ni phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid de yang phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i
translated: In the same way, that other entity also is not the entity of the aggregates, and therefore it does not exist.

original: phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing log thabs smra ba de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing log thabs smra ba de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to think that the TathƒÅgata appropriates the aggregates and becomes the TathƒÅgata.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Again, it is said:üîΩIn this way, the TathƒÅgata is not the appropriator of the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing log thabs smra ba de rigs pa ma yin par sun dbyung ba'i rjes suüîΩdpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing log thabs smra ba de rigs pa ma yin par sun dbyung ba'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the inference that refutes the assertion that the TathƒÅgata is not the appropriator of the aggregates,

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed sngar bstan pa de nyid yang bzlas te ston to //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed sngar bstan pa de nyid yang bzlas te ston to //
translated: the first half of the verse is repeated.

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: In this regard, it is said:

original: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
analyzed: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
translated: That which does not exist without depending on something else

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: is not the characteristic of the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: This is the subject.

original: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
translated: How could it appropriate?

original: des nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos so //
analyzed: des nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos so //
translated: It does not appropriate, that is, it is not the appropriator. This is the predicate of the probandum.

original: med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
translated: Because it does not exist. This is the reason.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni dpe ste //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni dpe ste //
translated: The example is ‚Äúlike a sky flower.‚Äù

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, a sky flower does not exist.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye @182a * //
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye @182a * //
translated: Therefore, it does not appropriate the aggregates of the TathƒÅgata.

original: bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du gang zhig phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de yang med pa'i phyir des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed do //
analyzed: bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du gang zhig phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de yang med pa'i phyir des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, that which is not the characteristic of the aggregates does not exist. Therefore, it does not appropriate the aggregates of the TathƒÅgata.

original: da ni brtag pa de gnyi ga bsnan pa'i tshad ma gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni brtag pa de gnyi ga bsnan pa'i tshad ma gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach another valid cognition that combines both of those examinations,

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i snga rol na med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa dag nye bar len par mi byed do //
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i snga rol na med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa dag nye bar len par mi byed do //
translated: Ultimately, the TathƒÅgata does not appropriate the appropriated aggregates prior to arising,

original: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because he does not exist prior to arising, just like a nonexistent tathƒÅgata.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa ni skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa dag nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir de bzhin
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa ni skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa dag nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir de bzhin
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are applied in order.üîΩFor example, a nonexistent tathƒÅgata does not appropriate the appropriated aggregates prior to arising, because he does not exist prior to arising.

original: gshegs pa'i nye bar len par mi byed do //
analyzed: gshegs pa'i nye bar len par mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, the TathƒÅgata does not appropriate the appropriated aggregates prior to arising, because he does not exist prior to arising.

original: gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir snga phyi mi 'thad pas skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir snga phyi mi 'thad pas skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha
translated: If you say that the reason ‚Äúbecause it does not exist prior to arising‚Äù is not established, because it is untenable that the TathƒÅgata existed prior to or subsequent to samsara, since samsara has no beginning or end, and because the TathƒÅgata is not described as being the same as or different from samsara, then this is not so.

original: rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni don ma grub pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni don ma grub pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs response to the Madhyamaka argument, ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist prior to arising.‚Äù This is a statement that faults the reason, saying that it is not established.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They say:

original: gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma yod dam /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma yod dam /
translated: Does samsara have a beginning or an end?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba zhig yin na ni snga phyi 'thad pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba zhig yin na ni snga phyi 'thad pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the TathƒÅgata were described as the same as or different from the aggregates, then since it would be tenable that he existed before and after, your reason ‚Äúbecause he does not exist prior to arising‚Äù would be established.

original: bdag cag sangs rgyas pa rnams de ltar mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag cag sangs rgyas pa rnams de ltar mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: But because we Buddhists do not assert that,

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: your reason is not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i blo'i spyod yul gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba'i snga rol na med pa nyid do zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i blo'i spyod yul gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba'i snga rol na med pa nyid do zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the TathƒÅgata who is the object of the mind that imputes him conventionally does not exist prior to arising,

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because he is a conditioned phenomenon, like a pot.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya @182b ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya @182b ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: dper na bum pa ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, it is understood that a pot is not prior to its production because it is a product.

original: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa nyid do zhes bya bar shes par bya ba de bzhin du tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo'i spyod yul gyi de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i snga rol na med do zhes bya bar shes par bya'o
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa nyid do zhes bya bar shes par bya ba de bzhin du tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo'i spyod yul gyi de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i snga rol na med do zhes bya bar shes par bya'o
translated: In the same way, it is understood that the TathƒÅgata who is the object of conventional cognition is not prior to his production because he is a product.

original: // de ltar tha snyad du med par grub pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams kyi snga rol na yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba de ni 'thad pa gzhan gyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: // de ltar tha snyad du med par grub pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams kyi snga rol na yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba de ni 'thad pa gzhan gyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Since the mere nonexistence in conventional terms is stated as the reason, and since it is taught that the TathƒÅgata exists prior to the aggregates of the TathƒÅgata, this is the conclusion of the other party.

original: de ltar kho bos tha snyad du skye ba'i snga rol na med par grub pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / khyed la de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i snga rol na yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar kho bos tha snyad du skye ba'i snga rol na med par grub pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / khyed la de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i snga rol na yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus, since we state that the existence of the Tathagata prior to his birth is not established as a reason, and since you do not have an inference that demonstrates the existence of the Tathagata prior to his birth, our reason appears to be unestablished.

original: gsal ba dang de kho nas sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba dang de kho nas sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: But it is established by the clear perception of the world and by reality itself.üîΩThus,

original: de ltar / gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
analyzed: de ltar / gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
translated: That which does not exist without depending on something else

original: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa 'am /
analyzed: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur // zhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa 'am /
translated: How could it appropriate that?üîΩThis shows that neither the Tathagata nor that which is not the Tathagata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa gang phung po rnams la ma brten par yod pa ma yin pa des phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed par bstan nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa gang phung po rnams la ma brten par yod pa ma yin pa des phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed par bstan nas /
translated: that which does not exist without depending on the aggregates, appropriates the aggregates.

original: da ni nye bar len pa pos nye bar ma blangs pa ni phung po ma yin la phung po med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nye bar len pa pos nye bar ma blangs pa ni phung po ma yin la phung po med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that that which is not appropriated by the appropriator is not the aggregates, and that there is no TathƒÅgata at all without the aggregates,

original: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa gcig ston to ;
analyzed: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa gcig ston to ;
translated: he demonstrates another verse, beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover . . . ‚Äù

original: / nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: / nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa //
translated: That which is not appropriated

original: nye bar len par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be the appropriator?

original: zhes bya bas ni nye bar len pa pos nye bar ma blangs pa ni phung po ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni nye bar len pa pos nye bar ma blangs pa ni phung po ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates that that which is not appropriated by the appropriator is not the aggregates.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But how is it?

original: nye bar len pa pos nye bar blangs pa nyid nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni yang ngo //
analyzed: nye bar len pa pos nye bar blangs pa nyid nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni yang ngo //
translated: That which is appropriated by the appropriator would be the appropriated.

original: tha snyad du ni de lta bu yin na de yang sngar /
analyzed: tha snyad du ni de lta bu yin na de yang sngar /
translated: This is also stated in the conventional sense, but that is impossible, as was previously stated:

original: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
analyzed: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
translated: That which does not exist without depending on something else,

original: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
translated: How could it be the appropriator?

original: zhes bstan pa'i tshul gyis mi srid par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i tshul gyis mi srid par bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates that it is impossible.

original: nye bar len pa med pa yi //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa yi //
translated: That which does not exist without appropriation,

original: nye bar len pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid de nye bar len pa po ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go @183a * //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid de nye bar len pa po ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go @183a * //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthe non-appropriated is not the appropriator‚Äù is that the reality of the non-appropriated is not the appropriator.

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po med pa nye bar len pa po ma yin pa'i tshig gi don stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po med pa nye bar len pa po ma yin pa'i tshig gi don stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù is that the non-appropriated is not the appropriator.

original: de lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that such a TathƒÅgata does not exist at all, he says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med ces bya ba smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata does not exist at all.‚Äù

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar len pa yang bsdu ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar len pa yang bsdu ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that both the appropriator and the appropriated are included.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthe TathƒÅgata does not exist in the TathƒÅgata‚Äù is that the TathƒÅgata does not exist in the TathƒÅgata.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po la nye bar len pa po de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po la nye bar len pa po de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the appropriated aggregates do not have the entityness of the TathƒÅgata, the TathƒÅgata does not exist by his own entityness or substantially.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very inference,

original: de la 'dir tshig gi don gsal ba'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni phung po lnga la gang zag med de byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la 'dir tshig gi don gsal ba'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni phung po lnga la gang zag med de byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: here, in terms of the meaning of the words, the inference is stated as follows: The person does not exist in the five aggregates because they are produced, like a pot.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

analyzed: dper na bum pa ni byas pa'i phyir de la gang zag med pa de bzhin du phung po lnga yang byas pa'i phyir de la gang zag med do //
translated: For example, since a pot is produced, a person does not exist in it. Likewise, since the five aggregates are produced, a person does not exist in them.

original: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa dang / log pa dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i yul nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang /üîΩbden par rtogs pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba snga ma de'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa dang / log pa dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i yul nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang / bden par rtogs pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba snga ma de'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: So too, it should be said that the reason is because it is the object of dependent origination, impermanence, reality, error, and doubt, and it is the cause of pleasure and pain.üîΩThe reason for the former thesis is these.

original: ci rigs par sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci rigs par sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag yang phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag yang phyir zlog par byed de /

translated: The TathƒÅgata exists ultimately.üîΩBecause the TathƒÅgata does not exist is not a definitive statement.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas med par gsungs te ;
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas med par gsungs te ;
translated: Here the TathƒÅgata said that whatever does not exist is nonexistent.

original: dper na mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the self imputed by tƒ´rthikas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni med par ma gsungs te /

translated: The TathƒÅgata is not said to be nonexistent.

original: gzhan gyis de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med dam zhes zhus pa na de ni lung du ma bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i tshig des de dgag pa yang gsungs pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med dam zhes zhus pa na de ni lung du ma bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i tshig des de dgag pa yang gsungs pas /

original: @183b de'i phyir don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩde'i phyir de ni rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yang yod do zhes bya ba ni gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag bcom ldan 'das kyis lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi pa'i nang
analyzed: @183b de'i phyir don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa kho na yin te / de'i phyir de ni rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yang yod do zhes bya ba ni gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag bcom ldan 'das kyis lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi pa'i nang
translated: Therefore the TathƒÅgata definitely exists ultimately.üîΩTherefore this is an autonomous inference. Therefore the opponent says, ‚ÄúThere is no error of the reason being contradictory.‚Äù

original: nas de bzhin gshegs pa med do zhes lung du ma bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: nas de bzhin gshegs pa med do zhes lung du ma bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the statement of the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya that proves that the TathƒÅgata exists ultimately by means of the reason that the TathƒÅgata is not declared to exist or not to exist in the fourteen undeclared topics of the Bhagavat.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

translated: Moreover, when asked, ‚ÄúAfter the TathƒÅgata passes into nirvƒÅ·πáa, does he exist or not?‚Äù he did not say that it does not exist. He said that it is not an indeterminate matter. Therefore, ultimately,

translated: Thus, that neutral example is our own independent inference, which is not shared with you MƒÅdhyamikas.

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /

translated: Here, because the TathƒÅgata did not declare that the TathƒÅgata exists or does not exist, your reason is indeterminate.üîΩSince the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs existence is refuted by the inference that the TathƒÅgata is not declared, your thesis has the fault of the property of the subject being undermined with respect to the nature of the subject and the distinction.
