translated: Since they are proponents of persons, they assert that the TathƒÅgata ultimately exists substantially.

original: tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those words are the subject, the predicate, the proof, the example of the opposite, the application of the proof, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: 'di na sbrul gyi rkang pa lta bu gang med pa nye bar len pas gdags par bya ba ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na sbrul gyi rkang pa lta bu gang med pa nye bar len pas gdags par bya ba ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, that which does not exist like the foot of a snake is not designated by appropriation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nye bar len pas rnam par grol ba bla na med pas rab tu phye ba'i phung po'i rgyun la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pas don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nye bar len pas rnam par grol ba bla na med pas rab tu phye ba'i phung po'i rgyun la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pas don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is designated in dependence on the continuum of aggregates that is distinguished by unsurpassed liberation through appropriation. Therefore he alone exists ultimately.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: ji ltar don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'thad pa de ltar sngar /üîΩsku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: ji ltar don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'thad pa de ltar sngar / sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
translated: As it has been explained earlier how the TathƒÅgata is untenable ultimately,

original: de la sku med der de med //
analyzed: de la sku med der de med //
translated: The body is not the TathƒÅgata, nor is the TathƒÅgata other than the body.üîΩThe body does not possess the TathƒÅgata, nor does the TathƒÅgata possess the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have a body,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
translated: So what is the TathƒÅgata?üîΩSince this has already been analyzed,

original: zhes bya ba des dpyad zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba des dpyad zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: de ltar / rnam pa lngas ni btsal byas na //üîΩgang zhig de nyid gzhan nyid du //
analyzed: de ltar / rnam pa lngas ni btsal byas na // gang zhig de nyid gzhan nyid du //
translated: Having been sought in five ways,üîΩThe TathƒÅgata who does not exist as the same or different

original: med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de //
analyzed: med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de //
translated: From the aggregates,

original: nye bar len pas ji ltar gdags //
analyzed: nye bar len pas ji ltar gdags //
translated: How could he be imputed by appropriation?

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo @185a * //üîΩnyid du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo @185a * // nyid du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In reality, the TathƒÅgata is the essence of the aggregates, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lngas btsal na phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du ma grub pa de nye bar len pas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji ltar gdags te gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lngas btsal na phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du ma grub pa de nye bar len pas don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji ltar gdags te gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang
translated: If the TathƒÅgata is sought in five ways, he is not established as the same as or different from the aggregates. How could he be imputed in reality as the essence of the TathƒÅgata by appropriation? The meaning of the reason is not established.

original: 'gal ba nyid do zhes ston te //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid do zhes ston te //
translated: It is contradictory.

original: gdags par bya ba nyid yod na ni bum pa la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba nyid yod na ni bum pa la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the object of imputation exists, then the TathƒÅgata would exist just as the existence of a pot, etc.,

original: de lta na ni 'dod pa nyams so zhes bya bas ni khyed ni de bzhin gshegs pa don dam par rdzas su yod par sgrub pa yin na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'dod pa nyams so zhes bya bas ni khyed ni de bzhin gshegs pa don dam par rdzas su yod par sgrub pa yin na /
translated: exists. But in that case, your assertion is undermined.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gdags par bya ba nyid du yod pa nyid yin na ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gdags par bya ba nyid du yod pa nyid yin na ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: If the TathƒÅgata exists as the object of imputation, then he does not exist substantially, just like a pot, etc.

original: de lta na khyed kyi 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta na khyed kyi 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bstan to //
translated: In that case, your assertion is undermined.

original: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don yang don dam par ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don yang don dam par ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is the object of imputation‚Äù is not established ultimately.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also contradictory.

original: bum pa la sogs pa nye bar len pas gdags par bya ba dag ni tha snyad du yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa nye bar len pas gdags par bya ba dag ni tha snyad du yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúBecause such things as pots, which are imputed in dependence on their appropriated parts, exist conventionally.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the reason the opponent gives is not established ultimately, and that it is contradictory conventionally.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa ;üîΩnye bar len pa med pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa ; nye bar len pa med pa yi //
translated: Others say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med //
translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata does not existüîΩWithout appropriation.‚ÄùüîΩThis is illogical.üîΩThis and more is said.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs argument that the TathƒÅgata exists because the appropriated aggregates exist is illogical.

original: ces gang smras pa de mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag phung po nye bar len pa po'i gang zag dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po yang nye bar len pa po de bzhin gshegs pa dangüîΩbcas pa yin pas /
analyzed: ces gang smras pa de mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag phung po nye bar len pa po'i gang zag dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po yang nye bar len pa po de bzhin gshegs pa dangüîΩbcas pa yin pas /
translated: The reason the opponent gives is that the TathƒÅgata exists because the appropriated aggregates exist.

original: dbu ma pas sngar nye bar len pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med do zhes bshad pa mi rung ba'i sgrub pa'i tshig ston to //
analyzed: dbu ma pas sngar nye bar len pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med do zhes bshad pa mi rung ba'i sgrub pa'i tshig ston to //
translated: The Madhyamika presents the following argument to show that it is not correct to say that the Tathagata is not the entity of the appropriator:

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir kho bo smra'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir kho bo smra'o //
translated: We say that because of the reason stated, the Tathagata is the appropriator.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa ni nye bar len pa po dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa ni nye bar len pa po dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: The Tathagata's appropriation is the appropriator,

original: nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is appropriation.

original: 'di na gang nye bar len pa po dang bcas pa nyid ma yin pa de ni nye bar len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang nye bar len pa po dang bcas pa nyid ma yin pa de ni nye bar len pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which is not the appropriator is not appropriation,

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the hair of a tortoise and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa @185b dag gi gzhi yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa ni nye
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa @185b dag gi gzhi yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa ni nye
translated: The Tathagata's appropriated five aggregates are the basis of the uncontaminated qualities such as the unshared qualities of the Buddha. Therefore, by the power of the reason stated, the Tathagata's appropriation is the appropriator.

original: bar len pa po dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bar len pa po dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: The appropriator exists,

original: nye bar len pa po gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: and the one who appropriates is the Tathagata.

original: de yod pas dpe grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yod pas dpe grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since that exists, the example is established, and thus the desired meaning is established.

original: des ni phung po'i nye bar len pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis nye bar len pa po dang bcas pa nyid yin par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /üîΩde dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te 'di na rus sbal gyi spu lta bu gang nye bar len pa ma yin pa de la ni nye bar len pa po spu sogs par byed pa med kyi /
analyzed: des ni phung po'i nye bar len pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis nye bar len pa po dang bcas pa nyid yin par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /üîΩde dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te 'di na rus sbal gyi spu lta bu gang nye bar len pa ma yin pa de la ni nye bar len pa po spu sogs par byed pa med kyi /
translated: This demonstrates an inference that proves the existence of the appropriator by means of the reason that the aggregates are appropriated.üîΩThe aggregates are the subject, the property to be proven is that they are appropriated, the proving property is that they are appropriated, the example of the dissimilar class is ‚Äúlike the hair of a tortoise,‚Äù the application is the application of the reason, and the conclusion is ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: phung po rnams ni nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po dang bcas pa yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa che ba'i yon tan zag pa med pa dag gi gzhi yin
analyzed: phung po rnams ni nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po dang bcas pa yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa che ba'i yon tan zag pa med pa dag gi gzhi yin
translated: Because the aggregates are appropriated, they possess an appropriator.üîΩThe aggregates of the TathƒÅgata are the basis of the great qualities of the Buddha, such as the uncontaminated factors of virtue.

original: pa'i phyir che ba'i bdag nyid can de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir che ba'i bdag nyid can de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
translated: Because the aggregates are appropriated, they have an appropriator. Therefore, since the aggregates of the TathƒÅgata are the basis of the great qualities of the Buddha, such as the uncontaminated, great powers, and so on, the TathƒÅgata has a great self.

original: de yod pas kho bo cag gi dpe grub pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yod pas kho bo cag gi dpe grub pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Since he exists, our example is established. Therefore, the meaning of the assertion that the entityness of things exists is established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this assertion, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgang zhig nye bar blang ba de /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gang zhig nye bar blang ba de /
translated: Here we reply:üîΩThat which is appropriated

original: nye bar blang bar bya ba'o //üîΩde ni ngo bo nyid las med //
analyzed: nye bar blang bar bya ba'o // de ni ngo bo nyid las med //
translated: Is that which is to be appropriated.üîΩIt does not exist intrinsically.

original: nye bar blang ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It does not exist intrinsically as the appropriated. This is what it means.

original: des ni phung po rnams nye bar blang ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub par ston to //
analyzed: des ni phung po rnams nye bar blang ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub par ston to //
translated: This shows that since the aggregates do not exist inherently as that which is appropriated, the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde ltar yang sngar nye bar len pa la nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid med de ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir / de ltar yang sngar nye bar len pa la nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid med de ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the correctness of that,

original: dper na nye bar len pa po bzhin no zhes rgya cher bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na nye bar len pa po bzhin no zhes rgya cher bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it was previously extensively explained that ‚ÄúIn that case, that which is appropriated does not exist inherently as that which is appropriated because it is dependent, like, for example, the appropriator.‚Äù

original: sngar nye bar blangs ba dang nye bar len pa po brtag pa'i skabs su de skad bstan zin to //
analyzed: sngar nye bar blangs ba dang nye bar len pa po brtag pa'i skabs su de skad bstan zin to //
translated: This is because it was previously explained in the chapter on the appropriator and that which is to be appropriated.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is that which is appropriated‚Äù is not established and it is contradictory. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid la @186a * //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid la @186a * //
translated: The reason of the opponent is not established ultimately,

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: and it is contradictory conventionally.

original: gal te nye bar len pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po las 'grub pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po las 'grub pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re /
translated: If you say that appropriation is established from the entity of another, then the error stated is not committed.

original: phung po rnams bdag gi dngos po las ma grub kyang rgyu rkyen gzhan gyi dngos po las 'grub pas kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba'i skyon ni med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams bdag gi dngos po las ma grub kyang rgyu rkyen gzhan gyi dngos po las 'grub pas kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba'i skyon ni med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThe aggregates are not established from the entity of the self, but they are established from the entity of other causes and conditions. Therefore the reason of us MƒÅdhyamikas is not nonestablished, and the error of contradiction does not exist.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de yang bzang po ma yin no //üîΩbdag gi dngos las gang med pa //
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin no // bdag gi dngos las gang med pa //
translated: That is also not good.üîΩIf it does not exist from the entity of the self,

original: de gzhan dngos las yod re skan //
analyzed: de gzhan dngos las yod re skan //
translated: how could it exist from the entity of another?

original: nye bar len pa ni gzhan las yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni gzhan las yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the words is that appropriation does not exist from another.

original: des ni phung po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis med pas rgyu rkyen rnams gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzhan las 'grub pa yang med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni phung po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis med pas rgyu rkyen rnams gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzhan las 'grub pa yang med do zhes bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates that since the aggregates do not exist inherently, it is not tenable that they are established from another because their causes and conditions are not established.üîΩSince nonarising from another has already been demonstrated, it is not necessary to demonstrate it again.

original: gzhan las skye ba med pa ni sngar bstan zin pas yang bstan mi dgos so zhes bya bas ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa'i 'thad pa ni sngar rkyen brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba med pa ni sngar bstan zin pas yang bstan mi dgos so zhes bya bas ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa'i 'thad pa ni sngar rkyen brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: The rationale for the nonexistence of arising from another has already been presented in the chapter on the analysis of conditions, where it says:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //üîΩdngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: not from both, not without cause,üîΩNowhere do any things

original: skyes ba nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes ba nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: ever arise.

original: zhes bya ba dang 'di nyid kyi skabs su yang sngar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'di nyid kyi skabs su yang sngar /
translated: And in this chapter it was previously stated:üîΩHow can that which does not exist

original: ngo bo nyid las gang med pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las gang med pa //
translated: through its own intrinsic reality

original: de gzhan dngos las ga la yod ;
analyzed: de gzhan dngos las ga la yod ;
translated: exist as another entity?

original: / ces bstan zin pas 'dir yang bzlas mi dgos so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: / ces bstan zin pas 'dir yang bzlas mi dgos so zhes bstan to //
translated: Since this has already been taught, it is not necessary to repeat it here.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na /
translated: Therefore, when this is thoroughly investigated,

original: de ltar nyer blang nyer len po //
analyzed: de ltar nyer blang nyer len po //
translated: the appropriated and the appropriator

original: rnam pa kun gyis stong pa yin //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyis stong pa yin //
translated: are empty in every respect.

original: rnam pa kun gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa dag gis so zhes bya bas ni phung po dang gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa dag gis so zhes bya bas ni phung po dang gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to
translated: ‚ÄúIn every respect‚Äù means by way of essence, by way of another entity, by way of sameness and difference, and so on. This teaches the conclusion of the demonstration that the aggregates and the person are essenceless.

original: // de'i phyir don dam pa'i de kho na mthong ba dag nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po rtogs pa de lta bu des /üîΩstong pas de bzhin gshegs pa stong pa /
analyzed: // de'i phyir don dam pa'i de kho na mthong ba dag nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po rtogs pa de lta bu des / stong pas de bzhin gshegs pa stong pa /
translated: Therefore, those who see the way things really are, the ultimate, understand that the appropriated and the appropriator are empty.

original: ji lta bur na 'dogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji lta bur na 'dogs par 'gyur /
translated: Since they are empty, how could the TathƒÅgata be imputed?

original: zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor pa don dam pa'i de mthong ba dag phung po dang gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i stong pa des de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis stong pa la don dam par tha snyad 'dogs
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor pa don dam pa'i de mthong ba dag phung po dang gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i stong pa des de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis stong pa la don dam par tha snyad 'dogs
translated: This shows that yogis who see the ultimate do not conceive of the Tathagata as empty of emptiness, which is the realization that the aggregates and the person are natureless.

original: shing mngon pa zhen par mi byed do zhes bstan to /üîΩ// / bam po bdun cu gcig pa /
analyzed: shing mngon pa zhen par mi byed do zhes bstan to / // / bam po bdun cu gcig pa /
translated: They do not make conventional designations or cling to the ultimate.

original: 'dir @186b gzhan dag ne ro da ltar dbu ma pa dag nye bar blang ba dang / nye bar len pa po stong pas de bzhin gshegs pa stong pa 'dogs par mi byed na /
analyzed: 'dir @186b gzhan dag ne ro da ltar dbu ma pa dag nye bar blang ba dang / nye bar len pa po stong pas de bzhin gshegs pa stong pa 'dogs par mi byed na /
translated: Here, others say, ‚ÄúIf Madhyamikas, by the emptiness of the appropriated and the appropriator, do not designate the Tathagata as empty,üîΩthen how do they explain the following passage from scripture?üîΩThe Lord is the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Completely Enlightened

original: lung las 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: lung las 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: One, endowed with knowledge and feet,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the Sugata,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /üîΩskyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: the Knower of the World,üîΩthe Trainer of those to be tamed,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: the Teacher of gods and men,üîΩthe Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: The teacher of gods and humans

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin te /
translated: is the Buddha, the Bhagavan.üîΩAnd from among them, one should recollect the Buddha.‚Äù

original: de rnams las rjes su dran par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dag khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ram zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de rnams las rjes su dran par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dag khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ram zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here says:

original: dbu ma smra ba dag phung po lnga la brten nas tha snyad dang rjes su mthun par bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa stobs bcu dang ma 'dres pa dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing rmad du byung ba'i
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba dag phung po lnga la brten nas tha snyad dang rjes su mthun par bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa stobs bcu dang ma 'dres pa dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing rmad du byung ba'i
translated: ‚ÄúThe proponents of the Middle Way, in accordance with conventions, designate the Bhagavan, the Omniscient One, who is based on the five aggregates, as the one who has an inconceivable and marvelous collection of good qualities such as the ten powers, the unique qualities, and the fearlessnesses.

original: 'od zer dag gis gsal bar gyur pa /
analyzed: 'od zer dag gis gsal bar gyur pa /
translated: He is illuminated by the light rays of the excellent teachings.

original: bka' 'gro ba mtha' dag gis bkur ba zhes 'dogs par byed de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bka' 'gro ba mtha' dag gis bkur ba zhes 'dogs par byed de zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He is revered by all the beings of the three realms.‚Äù

original: tha snyad du de ltar 'dogs par byed pas lung dang mi 'gal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩde la bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa stobs bcu dang ma 'dres pa dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing rmad du byung ba'i 'od zer dag gis gsal bar gyur pas zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: tha snyad du de ltar 'dogs par byed pas lung dang mi 'gal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro // de la bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa stobs bcu dang ma 'dres pa dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing rmad du byung ba'i 'od zer dag gis gsal bar gyur pas zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: and it is not contradictory to scripture, since it is conventionally designated in that way.üîΩTherein, the Blessed One is the one who has the inconceivable and marvelous collection of good qualities such as the ten powers, the unique qualities, and the fearlessnesses, and who is illuminated by the light rays of the ten powers, etc.

original: bla na med pa bstan la /
analyzed: bla na med pa bstan la /
translated: This shows the Blessed One‚Äôs perfection of his own aim, which is unsurpassed.

original: bka' 'gro ba mtha' dag gis bkur ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bla na med pa bstan to //
analyzed: bka' 'gro ba mtha' dag gis bkur ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bla na med pa bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúHis word is honored by all who are virtuous‚Äù shows the Blessed One‚Äôs perfection of the aims of others, which is unsurpassed.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa dang legs pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa dang legs pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, ‚ÄúBlessed One‚Äù is so called because he has destroyed the four demons and possesses the six higher knowledges.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
translated: ‚ÄúOmniscient‚Äù means that he possesses the highest of all aspects.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are fully awakened to the knowledge of all things.

original: stobs bcu ni gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs @187a * //
analyzed: stobs bcu ni gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs @187a * //
translated: The ten powers are the power of knowledge of what is and is not possible, the power of knowledge of the fruition of actions, the power of knowledge of various higher and lower faculties,

original: dang ; khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: dang ; khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of various interests, the power of knowledge of various dhƒÅtus, the power of knowledge of paths and their respective destinations, the power of knowledge of concentration, freedom, samƒÅdhi, and absorption,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / ldang ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / ldang ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of recollection of former existences, the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, and the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: This is the power of knowing the exhaustion of contaminants.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad de /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad de /
translated: The eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha are as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa dang /
translated: The TathƒÅgata has no error, no idle talk, no loss of mindfulness, no non-meditative mind, no different kinds of discrimination, no equanimity that is not thoroughly analyzed.

original: 'dun pa nyams pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dun pa nyams pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa dang /
translated: He has no loss of aspiration, no loss of effort, no loss of mindfulness, no loss of concentration, no loss of wisdom, no loss of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa nyams pa med pa dang / lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing yi shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa nyams pa med pa dang / lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing yi shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang /
translated: The wisdom vision of complete liberation is unimpaired. All physical actions are preceded by wisdom and follow after wisdom. All verbal actions are preceded by wisdom and follow after wisdom.

original: yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang /
translated: All mental actions are preceded by wisdom and follow after wisdom. The wisdom vision that engages the past is unattached and unobstructed. The wisdom vision that engages the future is unattached and unobstructed.

original: da ltar gyi dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa'o //
translated: The wisdom vision that engages the present is unattached and unobstructed.

original: mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi ste /
translated: Fearlessness means the four fearlessnesses of the TathƒÅgata.

original: chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa thams cad zad par mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa thams cad zad par mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: fearlessness in fully and completely awakening to all phenomena, fearlessness in knowing that all contaminations have been exhausted, fearlessness in declaring that obstacles are irreversible,

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'gyur ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la @187b mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'gyur ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la @187b mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: and fearlessness in declaring the path that will definitely lead to attaining all that is excellent.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in the root verse refers to the thirty-two major marks of a great being, the eighty minor marks, the four aspects of complete purity, the four unshared foundations of mindfulness,

original: bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / mchog mkhyen pa dag bsdu ste /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / mchog mkhyen pa dag bsdu ste /
translated: The three types of fearlessness, the great compassion, the nature of nonforgetfulness, the complete destruction of the traces, the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of the most excellent.

original: de la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ni dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / dbu skra g-yas su 'khyil ba dang ldan pa dang / dpral ba'i dbyes mnyam pa dang / mdzod spu dang / spyan mthon mthing la ba'i rdzi ma lta bu dang /
analyzed: de la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ni dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / dbu skra g-yas su 'khyil ba dang ldan pa dang / dpral ba'i dbyes mnyam pa dang / mdzod spu dang / spyan mthon mthing la ba'i rdzi ma lta bu dang /
translated: The thirty-two marks of a great being are: the head has a crown protrusion, the hair of the head is curly and turns to the right, the forehead is even, there is a tuft of hair between the eyebrows, the eyes are deep blue like the petals of a lotus,

original: tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa dang / 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / ljags shin tu ring zhing srab pa dang /
analyzed: tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa dang / 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / ljags shin tu ring zhing srab pa dang /
translated: there are forty teeth, the teeth are even, the teeth are set close together, the teeth are very white, the taste is supreme, the jaws are like those of a lion, the tongue is very long and slender,

original: tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa dang / dpung mgo shin tu zlum pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / thal gong rgyas ba dang / pags pa srab cing mdog gser 'dra ba dang / bzhengs bzhin du ma btud par phyag pus mor slebs pa dang /üîΩro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / shing n+ya gro da ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / spu re re nas skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa dang / dpung mgo shin tu zlum pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / thal gong rgyas ba dang / pags pa srab cing mdog gser 'dra ba dang / bzhengs bzhin du ma btud par phyag pus mor slebs pa dang / ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / shing n+ya gro da ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / spu re re nas skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa dang /
translated: He has the voice of Brahma, his shoulders are very round, he has the seven convex surfaces, his chest is broad, his skin is smooth and his complexion is golden, when standing he is taller than the crowd without bending,üîΩhis upper body is like a lion, he is as broad as he is tall like a Nyagrodha tree, his body hair grows singly and curls to the right, the body hair on his body points upward, his sexual organ is concealed in a sheath,

original: brla legs par zlum pa dang / zhabs long mo'i tshigs mi mngon pa dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba dang / sor mo ring ba dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: brla legs par zlum pa dang / zhabs long mo'i tshigs mi mngon pa dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba dang / sor mo ring ba dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang /
translated: his thighs are well rounded, the ankle bones of his feet do not protrude, his hands and feet are soft and youthful, his hands and feet are webbed, his fingers are long, and the palms of his hands and the soles of his feet have the marks of a wheel.

original: zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang / byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang / byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i lta bu'o //
translated: His feet are very steady. The soles of his feet are broad. His legs are like the [tapering] legs of the black antelope.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni /
translated: The eighty minor marks are as follows:

original: sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu dang / sen mo mdog snum pa dang / sen mo mtho ba dang / ser mo rnams zlum pa dang / ser mo rnams rgyas pa dang / sor mo rnams byin gyis phra ba dang / rtsa mi mngon pa dang /
analyzed: sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu dang / sen mo mdog snum pa dang / sen mo mtho ba dang / ser mo rnams zlum pa dang / ser mo rnams rgyas pa dang / sor mo rnams byin gyis phra ba dang / rtsa mi mngon pa dang /
translated: His nails are the color of copper. His nails are shiny. His nails are raised. His fingers are rounded. His fingers are full. His fingers are tapered. His veins are not visible.

original: rtsa mdud med pa dang // @188a * //
analyzed: rtsa mdud med pa dang // @188a * //
translated: His veins have no knots.

original: long bu mi mngon pa dang / zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa dang / seng ge'i stabs su gshegs pa dang / glang po che'i stabs su gshegs pa dang / ngang pa'i stabs su gshegs pa dang / khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: long bu mi mngon pa dang / zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa dang / seng ge'i stabs su gshegs pa dang / glang po che'i stabs su gshegs pa dang / ngang pa'i stabs su gshegs pa dang / khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa dang /
translated: His ankles do not protrude. His feet are not uneven. He walks with the stride of a lion. He walks with the stride of an elephant. He walks with the stride of a swan. He walks with the stride of a bull.

original: g-yas phyogs su ldog cing gshegs pa dang / mdzes par gshegs pa dang / ma yo bar gshegs pa dang / sku 'khril bag chags pa dang / sku byi dor byas pa lta bu dang / sku rim par 'tsham pa dang / sku gtsang ba dang /üîΩsku 'jam pa dang / sku rnam par dag pa dang / mtshan rdzogs pa dang / sku kho lag yangs shing bzang ba dang / gom pa snyoms pa dang / sku shin tu gzhon mdog can dang / sku zhum pa med pa dang / sku rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su ldog cing gshegs pa dang / mdzes par gshegs pa dang / ma yo bar gshegs pa dang / sku 'khril bag chags pa dang / sku byi dor byas pa lta bu dang / sku rim par 'tsham pa dang / sku gtsang ba dang / sku 'jam pa dang / sku rnam par dag pa dang / mtshan rdzogs pa dang / sku kho lag yangs shing bzang ba dang / gom pa snyoms pa dang / sku shin tu gzhon mdog can dang / sku zhum pa med pa dang / sku rgyas pa dang /
translated: He walks with his right side forward. He walks beautifully. He walks without staggering. His body is well rounded. His body is well proportioned. His body is clean.üîΩHis body is smooth. His body is pure. His body is complete with all the major marks. His body is well formed. His steps are even. His body is very youthful. His body is not stooped. His body is full.

original: sku shin tu grims pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa dang / gzigs pa rab rib med cing rnam par dag pa dang / dku zlum pa dang ; dku skabs phyin pa dang / dku ma rnyongs ba dang /
analyzed: sku shin tu grims pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa dang / gzigs pa rab rib med cing rnam par dag pa dang / dku zlum pa dang ; dku skabs phyin pa dang / dku ma rnyongs ba dang /
translated: His body is very firm. His major and minor body parts are very distinct. His eyes are free from film and are very pure. His belly is round. His belly is well proportioned. His belly is not protruding.

original: phyal phyad de ba dang / lte ba zab pa dang / lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba dang / kun nas mdzes pa dang / kun spyod gtsang ba dang / sku la sme ba dang / gnag bag med pa dang / phyag shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa dang /
analyzed: phyal phyad de ba dang / lte ba zab pa dang / lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba dang / kun nas mdzes pa dang / kun spyod gtsang ba dang / sku la sme ba dang / gnag bag med pa dang / phyag shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa dang /
translated: His navel is deep, his navel is coiled to the right, he is completely beautiful, his conduct is pure, his body is free from moles and blemishes, his hands are extremely soft like cotton wool,

original: phyag gi ri mo mdangs yod pa dang / phyag gi ri mo zab pa dang / phyag gi ri mo ring ba dang / zhal ha cang yang mi ring ba dang / zhal la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba dang / ljags mnyen pa dang /
analyzed: phyag gi ri mo mdangs yod pa dang / phyag gi ri mo zab pa dang / phyag gi ri mo ring ba dang / zhal ha cang yang mi ring ba dang / zhal la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba dang / ljags mnyen pa dang /
translated: his hand lines are radiant, his hand lines are deep, his hand lines are long, his face is not too long, the reflection of forms appears on his face, his tongue is supple,

original: ljags srab pa dang / ljags dmar ba dang / glang po che'i nga ro dang / 'brug gi spu dang ldan pa dang / gsung snyan cing ma nyen la 'jam pa dang / mche ba zlum pa dang / mche ba rno ba dang / mche ba dkar ba dang /
analyzed: ljags srab pa dang / ljags dmar ba dang / glang po che'i nga ro dang / 'brug gi spu dang ldan pa dang / gsung snyan cing ma nyen la 'jam pa dang / mche ba zlum pa dang / mche ba rno ba dang / mche ba dkar ba dang /
translated: his tongue is slender, his tongue is red, he has the voice of an elephant, he has the voice of a dragon, his speech is melodious, clear, and gentle, his tusks are round, his tusks are sharp, his tusks are white,üîΩand his tusks are even.

original: mche ba mnyam pa dang / mche ba byin gyis phra ba dang / shangs mtho ba dang / shangs gtsang ba dang / spyan rnam par dag pa dang / spyan yangs pa dang / rdzim  stug pa dang / spyan dkar gnag 'byes shing pad ma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu dang /üîΩsmin tshugs ring ba dang / smin ma 'jam pa dang / smin ma'i spu mnyam pa dang / smin ma snum pa dang / snyan shal stug cing ring ba dang / snyan mnyam pa dang / snyan gyi dbang po ma nyams pa dang / dpral ba legs par 'byes pa dang /
analyzed: mche ba mnyam pa dang / mche ba byin gyis phra ba dang / shangs mtho ba dang / shangs gtsang ba dang / spyan rnam par dag pa dang / spyan yangs pa dang / rdzim  stug pa dang / spyan dkar gnag 'byes shing pad ma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu dang / smin tshugs ring ba dang / smin ma 'jam pa dang / smin ma'i spu mnyam pa dang / smin ma snum pa dang / snyan shal stug cing ring ba dang / snyan mnyam pa dang / snyan gyi dbang po ma nyams pa dang / dpral ba legs par 'byes pa dang /
translated: His canine teeth are even, his canine teeth are tapered, his nose is prominent, his nose is clean, his eyes are pure, his eyes are large, his eyelashes are thick, his eyes are like the petals of a fully opened lotus,üîΩhis eyebrows are long, his eyebrows are smooth, his eyebrows are even, his eyebrows are shiny, his neck is thick and long, his ears are even, his ears are undamaged, his forehead is well formed,

original: dpral ba dbyes che ba dang / dbu @188b shin tu rgyas pa dang / dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa dang / dbu skra stug pa dang / dbu skra 'jam pa dang / dbu skra mi 'dzings pa dang / dbu skra mi bshor ba dang /
analyzed: dpral ba dbyes che ba dang / dbu @188b shin tu rgyas pa dang / dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa dang / dbu skra stug pa dang / dbu skra 'jam pa dang / dbu skra mi 'dzings pa dang / dbu skra mi bshor ba dang /
translated: his forehead is broad, his head is very full, his hair is as black as a bee, his hair is thick, his hair is smooth, his hair is not matted, his hair does not fall out,

original: dbu skra dri zhim pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dpal be'u dang / bkra shis dang / g-yung drung 'khyil bas brgyan pa dang / sdong ris dag go /
analyzed: dbu skra dri zhim pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dpal be'u dang / bkra shis dang / g-yung drung 'khyil bas brgyan pa dang / sdong ris dag go /
translated: His hair is fragrant, and his hands and feet are marked with auspicious wheels, swastikas, and spirals.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi ni gnas yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi ni gnas yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The four purities are the purity of the place, the purity of the object, the purity of the mind, and the purity of gnosis.

original: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus par nyan pa dang / gus par mi nyan pa rnams la btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus par nyan pa dang / gus par mi nyan pa rnams la btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of unshared close mindfulness are the evenness of mind toward those who listen respectfully, the evenness of mind toward those who do not listen respectfully, and the evenness of mind toward those who both listen respectfully and do not listen respectfully.

original: bsrung ba med pa bzhi ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa bzhi ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The four fearlessnesses are the purity of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs conduct of physical action.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi phrin las la spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi phrin las la spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste ;
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs conduct of physical action is not impure, and the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs conduct of verbal action is pure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gsung gi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gsung gi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata has no impure verbal activity.üîΩThe Tathagata has pure activity of mind.üîΩThe Tathagata has no impure activity of mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la thugs kyi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la thugs kyi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata has pure livelihood.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa med pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata has no impure livelihood.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: The great compassion of the Tathagata is thirty-two-fold.üîΩAll phenomena are selfless.üîΩAll phenomena are without sentient beings.üîΩAll phenomena are without life.üîΩAll phenomena are without persons.

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa dang / chos thams cad ni sems can med pa dang / chos thams cad ni srog med pa dang / chos thams cad ni gang zag med pa dang ; chos thams cad ni byed pa med pa dang / chos thams cad ni gnas med pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa dang / chos thams cad ni sems can med pa dang / chos thams cad ni srog med pa dang / chos thams cad ni gang zag med pa dang ; chos thams cad ni byed pa med pa dang / chos thams cad ni gnas med pa dang /
translated: All phenomena are without agents.üîΩAll phenomena are without owners.

original: chos thams cad ni gzhi med pa dang / chos thams cad ni nga yir bya ba med pa dang / chos thams cad ni bdag po med pa dang / chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa dang / chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzhi med pa dang / chos thams cad ni nga yir bya ba med pa dang / chos thams cad ni bdag po med pa dang / chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa dang / chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa dang /
translated: All phenomena are unborn.üîΩAll phenomena are without death and transmigration.üîΩAll phenomena are without afflictions.üîΩAll phenomena are free from desire.

original: chos thams cad ni shi 'phos med cing ma skyes pa dang / chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / chos thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad ni zhe sdang dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni shi 'phos med cing ma skyes pa dang / chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / chos thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad ni zhe sdang dang bral ba dang /
translated: All phenomena are free from anger.üîΩAll phenomena are free from ignorance.

original: chos thams cad ni gti mug dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad ni 'od pa med pa dang / @189a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gti mug dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad ni 'od pa med pa dang / @189a * //
translated: All phenomena are without darkness.

original: chos thams cad ni 'gro ba med pa dang / chos thams cad ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / chos thams cad ni spros pa med pa dang / chos thams cad ni stong pa dang / chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'gro ba med pa dang / chos thams cad ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / chos thams cad ni spros pa med pa dang / chos thams cad ni stong pa dang / chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: All phenomena are without going, all phenomena are without formation, all phenomena are without conceptual elaboration, all phenomena are empty, all phenomena are signless,üîΩall phenomena are wishless. Since sentient beings do not believe in this, the Thus-Gone One‚Äôs great compassion arises for sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad ni smon pa med pa yin na sems can rnams de ltar ma mos pas de'i phyir sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni phan tshun rtsod pas yongs su zin cing gnod sems kyi thab dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni smon pa med pa yin na sems can rnams de ltar ma mos pas de'i phyir sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni phan tshun rtsod pas yongs su zin cing gnod sems kyi thab dang /
translated: ‚ÄòAlas, this world is caught up in mutual conflict, malice,

original: zhe sdang la zhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni phyin ci log dang ldan zhing lam nyam nga bar zhugs pa dang lam gol ba la gnas pa dang / 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni brkam zhing 'dod pas zil gyis non pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang la zhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni phyin ci log dang ldan zhing lam nyam nga bar zhugs pa dang lam gol ba la gnas pa dang / 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni brkam zhing 'dod pas zil gyis non pa ste /
translated: and hatred. This world is full of error, has entered a dangerous path, and abides on a wrong path. This world is greedy and is overcome by desire.

original: chog mi shes shing gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa dang / sems can 'di dag ni bu dang / sman dang / khyim dang / nor dang / 'brul sred pas khol ba ste /üîΩsnying po med pa la snying por 'du shes pa dang / sems can 'di dag ni mi rigs pas 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: chog mi shes shing gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa dang / sems can 'di dag ni bu dang / sman dang / khyim dang / nor dang / 'brul sred pas khol ba ste / snying po med pa la snying por 'du shes pa dang / sems can 'di dag ni mi rigs pas 'tsho ba ste /
translated: medicines, homes, wealth, and grain.

original: gcig la gcig 'drid par gnas pa dang / sems can 'di dag ni chog mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'drid par gnas pa dang / sems can 'di dag ni chog mi shes pa ste /
translated: These sentient beings are not content.üîΩThey engage in acquiring material gain, honor, and praise, but they think, ‚ÄúWe are content.‚ÄùüîΩThese sentient beings are always delighted in the household life, which is a vessel of suffering and is full of afflictions.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la spyod kyang bdag cag ni chog shes pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang / sems can 'di dag ni khyim gyi gnas sdug bsngal gyi snod kun nas nyon mongs pa can la rtag tu dga' bar gzigs nas de'i phyir sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po skye ba dang /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la spyod kyang bdag cag ni chog shes pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang / sems can 'di dag ni khyim gyi gnas sdug bsngal gyi snod kun nas nyon mongs pa can la rtag tu dga' bar gzigs nas de'i phyir sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po skye ba dang /
translated: Seeing this, the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs great compassion arises for sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad ni rgyus nye bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rgyus nye bar 'gro ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are connected with causes.

original: bsgrub pas nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin na sems can rnams kyis de ltar mi shes pa dang / sems can rnams ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes dam pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa 'di gtang zhing gang 'di nyan thos kyi theg pa dang /
analyzed: bsgrub pas nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin na sems can rnams kyis de ltar mi shes pa dang / sems can rnams ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes dam pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa 'di gtang zhing gang 'di nyan thos kyi theg pa dang /
translated: If it were a matter of establishing the nature of things, sentient beings would not know it as it is, and sentient beings would abandon this excellent, sublime, unattached gnosis of perfect buddhahood and seek the lower vehicles of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dman pa tshol ba yin gyis de dag la gang 'di sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la dmigs par bya ba'i phyir rgya chen po la blo mos par bya'o zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po skye ba'o
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dman pa tshol ba yin gyis de dag la gang 'di sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la dmigs par bya ba'i phyir rgya chen po la blo mos par bya'o zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po skye ba'o
translated: So the Thus-Gone One‚Äôs great compassion for sentient beings arises, thinking, ‚ÄúI will inspire them to aspire to the vast so that they may focus on the gnosis of buddhahood.‚Äù

original: // bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: // bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four aspects of the nature of nonforgetfulness are as follows.

original: mdzad pa thams cad dang / @189b yul thams cad dang / mdzad pa'i thabs thams cad dang / dus thams cad du bsnyel ba mi mnga'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa thams cad dang / @189b yul thams cad dang / mdzad pa'i thabs thams cad dang / dus thams cad du bsnyel ba mi mnga'o //
translated: The Buddha is never forgetful of all his activities, all his objects, all the means of his activities, and all the times.

original: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The complete destruction of traces is also fourfold.

original: bskyod pa dang / gzegs pa dang / gsung ba dang / gnas pa la nyon mongs pa mnga' ba 'dra ba'i kun du spyod pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: bskyod pa dang / gzegs pa dang / gsung ba dang / gnas pa la nyon mongs pa mnga' ba 'dra ba'i kun du spyod pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have the conduct of one who is afflicted by shaking, trembling, stammering, or dwelling.

original: rnam pa thams cad dang / mchog mkhyen pa ni chos rnams kyi tshogs gsum po don dang ldan pa dang / don dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang don dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang ldan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dang / mchog mkhyen pa ni chos rnams kyi tshogs gsum po don dang ldan pa dang / don dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang don dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang ldan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of the most excellent are the complete and perfect enlightenments of the three collections of dharmas, those that are meaningful, those that are not meaningful, and those that are neither meaningful nor not meaningful.

original: tha ma gnyis mkhyen pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: tha ma gnyis mkhyen pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin la /
translated: The knowledge of the last two is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dang po mkhyen pa ni mchog mkhyen pa yin te /
analyzed: dang po mkhyen pa ni mchog mkhyen pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the first is the knowledge of the most excellent.

original: des ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bstan to //
translated: By that, the complete and perfect enlightenment of the knowledge of omniscience endowed with the most excellent of all aspects is taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' ni de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa'i dpal gyi mgur nas don dam pa'i chos dang lam gyi chos dang / bstan pa'i chos bka' stsal pa dag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' ni de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa'i dpal gyi mgur nas don dam pa'i chos dang lam gyi chos dang / bstan pa'i chos bka' stsal pa dag ste /
translated: The speech of the Tathagata is the Dharma of the ultimate, the Dharma of the path, and the Dharma of teaching, which is spoken from the throat of glory that understands reality.

original: de dag 'gro ba mtha' dag gis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du bkur ba ni bsgrub pa la sogs pas mchod pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'gro ba mtha' dag gis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du bkur ba ni bsgrub pa la sogs pas mchod pa yin te /
translated: Those who respect those teachings in accordance with their inclinations are worshiping through practice and so forth.

original: dbu ma smra ba dag kun rdzob tu phung po lnga la brten nas tha snyad dang rjes su mthun par de dag 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba dag kun rdzob tu phung po lnga la brten nas tha snyad dang rjes su mthun par de dag 'dogs par byed do //
translated: The Madhyamikas conventionally designate the person in dependence on the five aggregates in accordance with worldly conventions.
